loans.name: 18.06.50 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Huong N. T. is 28 and lives in Thanh Hoa.  She is the group leader of a 3-member group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 50-Quang Hung (180650-Quang Hung).


Huong is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, she owns & operates a furniture making business; she makes and sells bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  Huong has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong repaid her previous loan of 3253800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 3079800 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be her 3rd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thanh is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.


2.  Lê Thị Cầu is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huong N. T. (2) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Huong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 50-Quang Hung (180650-Quang Hung).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang T.ết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huong kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2009, Huong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua dụng cụ & T.ết bị khác để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thanh (6) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị Cầu (3) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya D. is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 39 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling household items and making food to sell in her local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities. Her husband is a motorcycle driver and has his own motorbike.
In 2001, Ligaya joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to acquire a motorcycle. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be her twentieth from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is a mother of three children. Her eldest is aged 14 and goes to school. She married her husband, Ruben, in 1994. Mariafe got involved in rice farming in 2000 and continues to farm today. The rice farm provides food for her family and it is also how she generates income.
A few years back, Mariafe was also able to open a sari-sari store. She now focuses on running the store and taking care of her children, while her husband mostly maintains their rice farm. She hopes to succeed in her ventures.
Mariafe would like to request a loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also add merchandise to her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Four people who live in Trav village in the Prey Veng province make up this group loan. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Sarun S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a pig breeder who can earn some money from selling pigs to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Soun Ben, is a farmer who owns a little land and grows rice to sell. Her problem is that her husband’s field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sarun S. is finding a loan to buy fertilizer. 

She is a mother of five children, one of whom is helping with the farming while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mr. V. is 27 years old and lives in a rural commune of Phnom Penh City, where he works as a security guard in a garment factory. He started his job when he was single, but is now married to Theavy, who is 25 years old and a seamstress. The couple has two children who are both enrolled in school. V. currently faces a problem: he does not have an electricity line for use at home. Therefore, V. is applying for a loan in order to pay a bill for connecting a new electricity line for his family's use.

loans.use: To pay a bill for connecting a new electricity line for his family's use

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina A. is from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba. She is 52 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Avelina has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Avelina joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP for her hog raising business. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Umuco Ii Group

texts.fr:
Sara N. est une commerçante âgée de 22 ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo dans la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle est mariée à un  commerçant de souliers. Elle  achète des haricots  pour les revendre au  marché central de Rugombo. C’est un métier qu’elle a  commencé à pratiquer avec  le crédit de Turame qui arrive maintenant au 4e cycle ayant reçu respectivement pour les trois premiers cycles : 60,000fbu ; 100,000fbu et 270,000fbu.

Elle est mère de 3 enfants : 1garçon âgé de 5ans et deux fillettes âgées respectivement de 3ans et 3mois. Aucun de se enfants n’a déjà commencé l’école. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités de  haricots à revendre aux clients. Elle a l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice avec cette augmentation de son capital et ainsi pouvoir relever les défis quotidiens de la vie comme la ration, les frais d’entretien du ménage et autres. 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe « Umuco II  ».
texts.en:
Sara N., 22, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Rugombo, province of Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She is married to a businessman who sells shoes. She buys beans to resell at the central market of Rugombo. She started up this business using a Turame loan and she is now on her fourth loan, having received for the three preceding loans, respectively, the amounts of 60,000 fbu; 100,000 fbu, and 270,000 fbu. She is the mother of three children: a son aged 5, and two daughters, one 3 years old and one 3 months old. None of her children has begun school yet. She is asking for this Kiva loan to buy bigger quantities of beans to resell to her clientele. She hopes to have a greater profit with this increase in her working capital and thus cope better with her daily needs such as food, household expenses, etc. Sara is a member of a group called « Umuco II ».

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying greater quantities of beans to sell her clientele

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita J. is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 39 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fuels in the local community. Elita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities. She is also engaged in coco lumber business.

In 2006, Elita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Elita is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used as additional cash to purchase fuel. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. 

About PMPC

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur with her husband Marcelo and their two children, both of whom attend school. A rice farmer who needs inputs for her farm, Mary Ann also runs a small store located at the front of her house. While the store helps in providing for some of their daily needs, the farm is their main source of income, so she and her husband work their best to make it productive. She has applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI to buy the necessary inputs her farm lacks, and with this amount Mary Ann will be able to buy sacks of fertilizers and also crude oil for the tractor

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia B. is from the village of Del Pilar. She is 65 years old, married and has six adult children. To make a living, Rosalia plants crops. The main source of income for her business comes from selling bananas and cassava she's harvested in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2004, Rosalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will also be used as additional capital. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosalia from PMPC. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Thu is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Thu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL..  Thu has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thu is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en: Mr. Morn P. is a group leader, selected by four group members who will each use a loan for different purposes. They live in Trav Village in Prey Veng province and they are given a group loan. He and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Mouv, are farmers and own a one hectare plot of land. They cultivate rice on their land and sell it to support their family. Their problem is that their farm is a long way from the irrigation system. To improve production, Mr. Morn P. is asking for a loan to buy gasoline. The couple has two children, one of whom works in a garment factory, and the other of whom is one years old.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen B., 60, is from the village of Mabini. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member if one is delinquent or defaults.

Helen is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting crops. The main source of income for the business comes from the cassava and vegetables she plants and then sells in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This will be Helen’s 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s living standard. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita S.’s “sari-sari” (variety) store is a great source of cash for supporting the needs of her family. It was financed by a loan she requested from ASHI, of which she has been a member since 2008. Though all of her children have their own families now, Nenita still has to work hard and maintain her business because she is the sole provider for her unemployed husband and 77 year-old father. Her business currently provides only a small revenue, but Nenita enjoys spending it on her family’s most immediate needs, and would not want to stop growing her business until it becomes stable and profitable through loans. Though Nenita’s store only sells a few varieties of goods and grocery items at the moment, she envisions someday selling huge volumes of commodities and groceries.

loans.use: o purchase grocery items and comodities for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Huguette Aurore

texts.fr: S. Huguette Aurore est née le 24 Octobre 1973 et est mariée à HOUNTONDJI Josée Jules, un technicien. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Vêdoko à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Huguette Aurore assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Huguette Aurore n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis sept ans, Huguette Aurore mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (lait, papier hygiénique, savons, conserves de tomates, eau de javel, etc.). Parallèlement à cette activité, Huguette Aurore vend également des boissons et de la glace à son domicile. Huguette Aurore est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui effectue bien ses remboursements. Dans l'optique d'agrandir son activité et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Huguette Aurore sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Huguette Aurore S. was born on 24 October 1973 and is married to Josée Jules HOUNTONDJI, a technician. The couple has three children who all attend school. The family settled down ten years ago in the Vêdoko district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Huguette Aurore shares responsibility with her husband for the various family expenses. She went to primary school only. For the past seven years she has had an activity selling various products (milk, toilet paper, soaps, tinned tomatoes, bleach, etc.) At the same time Huguette Aurore sells drinks and ice-cream from her home. She is an old customer of ALIDé who makes her repayments on time. With the aim of expanding her activity and in order to satisfy customer demand more readily, she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and various products

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan from Trav village in Prey Veng province consists of 5 members. Mr. Khoeun V. was selected by the other members as the group leader. The members will use the loan for different purposes, hoping to improve their businesses.

Mr. Khoeun V. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare parcel of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family.  His wife, Mrs. Sinal Sek, is a farm laborer. They have four children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school; the other is too small to work or study.  Although they try to work hard, the couple’s income is low. So they want to start a new business, but do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Khoeun V. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Iyunge Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie N. est une commerçante âgée de 33 ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo dans la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle  achète des haricots  pour les revendre au  marché central de Rugombo. C’est un métier qu’elle a  commencé à pratiquer avec  le crédit de Turame qui arrive maintenant au 4e cycle ayant reçu respectivement pour les trois premiers cycles : 60,000fbu ; 200,000fbu et 270,000fbu.

Elle est mère de 3 garçons respectivement de 10 ans, 6 ans et 4ans dont les deux premiers étudient. Elle lutte pour que ses enfants puissent étudier et terminer avec succès pour devenir responsables et mener une vie heureuse. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités de  haricots mais aussi de nouveaux produits alimentaires à revendre aux clients. Elle a l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice avec cette augmentation de son capital. 

Elle est une des membres du groupe «IYUNGE.»
texts.en:
Pascasie N., 33, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Rugombo in the province of Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She buys beans to resell at the central market of Rugombo. She started up her business with a loan from Turame and she is presently on her fourth loan, having received the amounts of 60,000 fbu ; 200,000 fbu et 270,000 fbu for her first three loans. She is the mother of three sons, 10, 6, and 4 years old. The two older boys are enrolled in school. She makes a big effort to see that her children will be able to stay in school and graduate successfully, so that they can become responsible adults and have a happy life. Pascasie is requesting this Kiva loan to buy bigger quantities of beans, as well as other, different foodstuffs to sell to her customers. She hopes to make a lot of profit due to this increase in her working capital. She is a member of a group called « IYUNGE ».

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing bigger quantities of beans but also new products to sell her customers

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena L., from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba, is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena plants a variety crops to sell in the local community. Engaged in her business for many years, she earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 41,000 PHP from PMPC that used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase a motorcycle. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 28-year-old single woman living with her parents. She is hard-working and wants to be independent. Therefore, Diana has been working as a seamstress. She is engaged in the business of sewing and designing clothes. 

Six years ago, she decided to open her own sewing factory where she repairs and creates all type of clothes. Sometimes her clients come with their own clothing materials. Most of her customers are her neighbors, but she also works sewing for clothing shops in her town.

For the first time, Diana is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine, which will allow her to improve her work efficiency, expand her sewing business and generate a better income.

Currently, thanks to her perseverance and dedication, she owns several sewing machines. She feels very happy with everything she has accomplished and hopes to keep on improving her work, as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie J., from the village of Southwestern Poblacion, is 26 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Regie owns and operates a business venture selling household items (basic needs) in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Regie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional stocks for the store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for the store

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up this group loan. They live in Trav Village in the Prey Veng province. Mr. Sok K. is the group leader selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes in support of their businesses. 

Mr. Sok K. is a village chief and aside from this, he is a farmer who owns 1.2 hectares of land and cultivates rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sarun KH., is a pig breeder. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand it. So to improve the pig breeding business, Mr. Sok K. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets. He is the father of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Meur

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a widow who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns about USD$5 per day from selling fresh fish at the market. 

Mrs. P. has three children: one is now married and lives outside of family home, while the other two are no longer in school and are employed at different jobs. Since the current income of the family is not enough, Mrs. P. has a goal to buy a piece of farmland where she will plant different kinds of crops for extra income.

Her goal is not possible because she doesn’t have money yet. Therefore, Mrs. P. is looking for assistance from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, in the amount of $1,000 to be used to buy a neighbor’s farmland to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a neighbor’s farmland to grow crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more liters of kerosene and more groundnut oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and bags to sell

loans.name: Bareaa

texts.en:
Bareaa is a 47-year-old married woman with two children. In 1998, she started running a sewing business. She does handicrafts from her home to earn more income for her family, in addition to being independent with her own business. She is well-known in her region due to her nice and talented work. She creates many different products and also offers repair services. 

For the second time, Bareaa is requesting a loan to buy pearls and a new sewing machine to replace the used one, so that she can faster serve her clients and maintain her good reputation. Her previous loan allowed her to improve her work by purchasing more thread.

loans.use: To buy pearls and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Narsise

texts.en:
Narsise is 47 years old, married and father of two children. He is by profession a sheet metal worker but also does general mechanics. He has 12 years experience as a car repairer. He also sells used car spare parts. 

He is applying for a loan to buy materials for his garage such as a generator, blow-torch, files, etc. This loan will allow him to be more productive in his work and to be able to provide better for his family's needs. This is Narsise's third loan, and he has always repaid on time. His previous loan allowed him to purchase new tools and spare parts so he could improve his business as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To buy materials for his garage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Huoy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people who live in Prey Sangkum village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Huoy H. is the group leader, selected by all the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice: not to sell but to support her family. She also breeds pigs and her husband, Mr. Thoeurm Hang, is a construction worker. They try to work hard with their careers but they earn a low income. To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Huoy H. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

Mrs. Huoy Huoen is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school. The other child is 3 years old and is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mr. Sat S. is 50 years old and is married to Mrs. Khy Heang, 51, who sells a few cakes in the village. For more than nine years, Sat S. has been earning a living by catching fish in and around the river. This couple takes care of three school-aged kids; another child is married and lives separately. 

Recently some of his fishing tools were ruined, so his fishing activity and current income have been affected. To solve the problem, Sat S. has decided to seek a loan to repair his broken tools and to buy new essential accessories for fishing.

loans.use: To repair broken tools and to buy new essential accessories.

loans.name: Kalil Turdakunova`s Group

texts.ru:
Калил 49 лет. Она замужем, ее супруг крестьянин. у них есть собственный земельный надел, где они выращивают риса, овощей. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян и удобрений. У нее 7 деетй. Кроме младшей дочери, все взрослые. Большинство проживает отдельно своими семьями. 

Чолпоной,25, замужем. Ее супруг занимается земледелием. У нее трое детей: все трое мальчики. Она занимается торговлей товарами народного потребления. На полученную прибыль они купли корову, теленка и несколько овец. Кредит запрашивается для расширения товарооборота магазина. 

Жылдыз 47 лет. Она мать 5 детей. Ее супруг работает водителем, ежемесячный доход составляет около 110 долларов. Клиент вместе со старшими детьми занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции. Этим бизнесом она занимается 10 лет. НА полученную прибыль они смогли построить дом. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений. 

АЙгул 33 года. Она разведенная мать с одной дочерью Дочь учится на 9 классе. Клиент в основном выращивает рис, т.к. земля Узгена очень пригодна именно для этой культуры. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений. Сезонный доход от земледелия равени около 600 долларов. 

Алтына, 48, замужем. У не 5 детей: две дочери и два сына. Старшие двое детей работают в РФ, остальные дома. клиент вместе с супругом выращивают овощи на своем земельном наделе. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kalil is 49 years old. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They own a plot of land, where they grow rice and vegetables. They are requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. Kalil has 7 children. All of the children, except the youngest daughter, are grown, and the majority of them live separately with their own families. Cholponoy is 25 years old, married. Her husband is involved in farming. She has three children, all of whom are boys. She is involved in sales of consumer goods. Cholponoy used her business profits to purchase a cow, calf and several sheep. She is requesting the loan in order to expand the goods turnover at the store. Jyldyz is 47 years old. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband works as a driver, and his monthly income is about 110 dollars. The client and her older children are involved in growing agricultural crops. She has been in this business for 10 years. They were able to use business profits to build a house. The loan is need for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. Aygul is 33 years old. She is a divorced mother of one daughter. Her daughter is now in 9th grade. The client primarily grows rice because the soil in Uzgen is especially suitable for this crop. The loan is needed for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. The seasonal income from farming equals to about 600 dollars. Altyna is 48 years old, married. She has 5 children: two daughters and two sons. The oldest two children work in the Russian Federation, and the rest are at home. The client and her husband grow vegetables on their plot of land. The loan is needed for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Marapat Okoeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Марапат, 57, она замужем и мать 6 детей. Самому старшему 36 лет, а младшему 26. все взрослые и проживают отдельно. Ее супруг крестьянин. Она занимается животноводством: откормом и разведением КРС. 5 лет назад она начала этот бизнес, использовав полученный кредит в другой финансовой компании на закуп МРС. С тех пор она несколько раз использовала заемные средства. Сейчас она запрашивает этот кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. 

Калыскан, 47, вдова. У нее 4 детей. Старший сын работает в Казахстане, старшая дочь замужем и проживает отдельно. С ней живут двое младших, которые учатся в школе. Она занимается животноводством. Ежемесячная прибыль равна 3К сом (70 долларов). Кредит запрашивается для закупа МРС. 

Элмире 43 года. Она также вдова и мать 5 детей: 3 сына и 2 дочери. Она также как и Калыскан, занимается разведением скота на дому. Кредит запрашивается для закупа КРС. 

Орун, 49, вдова. У нее трое детей: все дочери и учаться в местной школе. Клиент занимается малым производством: пошив и реализация тушаков. Кредит необходим для закупа сырья - ткани для шитья национальных изделий. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Marapat is 57 years old. She is married and is a mother of 6 children. The oldest is 36 years old, and the youngest is 26. All of the children are grown and live separately. Her husband is a farmer. Marapat is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding of cattle. She started this business 5 years ago, after using a loan, obtained from a different financial company, to purchase small livestock. Since then, she used borrowed means several times. Now, she is requesting this loan in order to repair her house. Kalyskan is 47 years old, a widow. She has 4 children. The oldest son works in Kazakhstan, and the oldest daughter is married and lives separately. Two of the youngest children, who go to school, live with Kalyskan. She is involved in animal husbandry. Her monthly profit equals 3k som (70 dollars). She is requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock. Elmira is 43 years old. She is also a widow and a mother of 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. Just like Kalyskan, she is involved in livestock breeding at home. Elmira is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. Orun is 49 years old, a widow. She has three children, all of whom are daughters, attending a local school. The client is involved in a small-scale manufacturing. She sows and sells tushaks. The loan is needed for the purchase of fabric for sowing national crafts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people who live in Trav village in Prey Veng province. Mr. Yean Y. is group leader, selected by all the members who will use a loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. San Brok, are farmers who own a 1.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. 

Their obstacle is that their farm has infertile soil, but they did not have enough money to support it. So to improve rice production, Mr. Yean Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He is a father of five children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is helping with the farming, and the last is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries  to sell

loans.name: Subanova Saltanat Group

texts.ru:
У Салтанат есть собственное кафе, где она предоставляет услуги общественного питания. Этим делом она занимается вот уже на протяжении последних 12 лет. В бизнесе помогает ей супргу. У нее 3 детей. В основном они готовят национальные блюда. Кредит запрашивается для улучшения инфраструктуры кафе, чтобы привлечь большее количество посетителей. 

Сурмакан, 53, замужем. Ее супруг занимается частным извозом. У нее 7 детей. Клиент занимается животноводством. На кредит она планирует купить теленка.

Иният 41 год. Она разведенная мать 4 детей. Дочь работает в РФ, а остальные сыновья учаться в средней школе. Клиент работает в кафе "Акжол", продает орех. Кредит запрашивается для пополнения запасов ореха. 

Гулкан, 28, замужем. ЕЕ супруг находится в России на заработках, каждый месяц присылает деньги для поддержания семьи. Кроме этого клиент сама зарабатывает деньги, работая поварихой. В месяц получает 70 долларов. На кредит она планирует купить МРС для домашнего разведения.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Saltanat owns a café, where she provides public food service. She has been involved in this business over the course of the last 12 years. Her husband helps her with the business. Saltanat has 3 children. She primarily cooks national dishes at the café. She is requesting the loan in order to improve the café infrastructure and to attract a large number of customers. Surmakan is 53 years old, married. Her husband is involved in private transportation. She has 7 children. The client is involved in animal husbandry. She plans to use this loan to buy a calf. Iniyat is 41 years old. She is a divorced mother of 4 children. Her daughter works in the Russian Federation, and the sons attend a secondary school. The client works at the “Akjol” café and sells nuts. She is requesting the loan in order to replenish the stock of nuts. Gulkan is 28 years old, married. Her husband works in Russia and sends money home every month in order to support the family. Besides this, the client earns money herself, working as a cook. She makes 70 dollars per month. She plans to use the loan to buy small livestock to breed at home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve cafe infrastructure

loans.name: Dev Maiya

texts.en:
Ms. Dev Maiya M. is a 52-year-old lady who lives in Thecho village. Thecho is one of the underdeveloped villages of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her father, mother and her brother.

Dev Maiya M. and her brother opened their shop 12 years ago. They sell different types of steel goods such as jugs, plates, water carrying pots, etc. Revenue from the shop is the only source of income for their family. 

She already has repaid her second loan from Kiva. With her second loan, she was able to buy additional stock for her store. She sells basic household tools and supplies and has used the funds to increase her stock of plastic and metalware.

Dev Maiya M. is requesting a loan of Rs 25,000 to expand their business and buy necessary items for their shop.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her shop

loans.name: Yamen

texts.en: Yamen Y. is 31 years old and married with three members in his family. Yamen has a mattress store. Through this loan, he wants to increase his productivity through providing new mattresses, which will increase his income at the same time.

loans.use: To increase his productivity through providing new mattresses

loans.name: Gulburak Egenberdieva Group

texts.ru:
Гулбурак 32 года. У нее трое детей, их воспитывает одна, т.к. она несколько лет назад развелась. Двое сыновей учатся в школе, дочь дома. Клиент занимается разведением КРС и МРС, этот кредит она хочет использовать на закуп цемента, чтобы отремонтировать своей дом. Сейчас у нее есть две коровы и два теленка. Также она продает молоко и молочные продукты. 

Айгул, 25, замужем. Ее супруг работает наемным сельскохозяйственным рабочим, а клиент разводит скот. На всю сумму кредита клиент планирует купить МРС. В планах она собирается родить ребенка.

Рустамбеку 35 лет. Его супруга домохозяйка и у него 4 детей. Только старшая дочь учится в школе, остальные все дома. За ними приглядывает их мать. Он занимается животноводством. КЛиент собирается купить одного быка для откорма.

Алтынай, 25. Она пока не замужем. Клиент работает в сельской управе ведущим специалистом. В сельской управе она работает чуть более года, до этого работала учительницей. Клиент планирует кредит потратить на весениий посев.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulburak is 32 years old. She has three children, whom she is raising on her own because she got divorced several years ago. Two of her sons go to school, and the daughter is at home. The client is involved in breeding cattle and small livestock. She wants to use this loan to buy cement in order to repair her house. Currently, Gulburak has two cows and two calves. She also sells milk and dairy products. Aygul is 25 years old, married. Her husband works as an agricultural worker for-hire, and the client breeds livestock. She plans to use the whole sum of the loan to purchase small livestock. She also plans to have a child. Rustambek is 35 years old. His wife is a homemaker, and he has 4 children. Only the oldest daughter goes to school, and the rest stay at home. Their mother looks after them. Rustambek is involved in animal husbandry. The client plans to buy one sheep for fattening. Altynai is 25 years old. She is not married yet. The client works as a specialist at the village administration office. She has been working there for just over a year and previously worked as a teacher. The client plans to spend the loan for the spring sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget owns a store where she sells medicines. She is also a trained nurse and she treats her patients when they fall ill. She has been in this business for 9 years. Bridget is a kind and friendly woman. She is 38 and married, with a child. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines  to sell

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Mrs. P., 47, is a resident of Phnom, the capital of Cambodia. She is a vendor who sells different kinds of perfume around her community. From her work, she is able to generate $3 per day to help solve her family's financial crisis. She is married to Houch Chengly, 50, who is a district consultant advisor, and they have two school-aged children, while another three are now married and work as garment workers. 

P. has a goal to improve her business, but she has no ability to do that because she doesn’t have the money yet. Thus, P. is requesting a loan to grow her business capital by buying more perfume to sell.

loans.use: To increase her business capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1951, N. Justine vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Justine est une veuve ayant un enfant qui est scolarisé. Justine assure seule les différentes charges de la famille. Justine n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Justine  mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui l'aident à faire face à ses différents besoins. C'est à Lomé au Togo, et également au Nigéria, deux Etats voisins du Bénin, que Justine achète ses tissus. Justine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Justine sollicite un autre prêt, en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits et de pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1951, Justine N. has lived for around twenty years in the Ayélawadiè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is a widow with one child who attends school. Justine covers the various family expenses herself. She has never been to school. For almost 25 years Justine has had a business selling fabric through the distribution system. This activity generates income which helps her to provide for her various needs. She buys her fabric in Lomé in Togo, as well as in Nigeria, both of these countries bordering on Bénin. Justine is an old customer of ALIDé and has always repaid her loans without problem. Faced with growing customer demand, she is requesting another loan in order to increase her stock of products and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pieces of fabric

loans.name: Shakil

texts.en:
Shakil H. is a 45-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli city. He started in this business at a very young age and now he has a lot of permanent customers who always buy good sheep for meat production from Shakil. 

Mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people and sheep breeding brings stable income to Shakil. He is single and lives with his parents. Shakil believes one day he could marry, and, for this purpose, he works very hard. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more sheep and fodder. As summer is a high season for wedding parties where barbequed mutton is very popular, Shakil hopes to fatten as many sheep as possible by June.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Pascal Comlan

texts.fr: Y. Pascal Comlan est né le 17 Mai 1969 et est marié à HODEHOU Valérie. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C’est depuis son jeune âge que Pascal Comlan réside au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où il vit avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pascal Comlan n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs cinq ans, Pascal Comlan vend de l’huile de palme par le système de distribution ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer les charges qui lui incombent. Pascal Comlan s’approvisionne à Kpondave au Bénin. C’est un ancien client de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter son stock de produits et de pouvoir mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle, Pascal Comlan sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Pascal Comlan Y. was born on May 17, 1969. He is married to Valérie Houdehou. The couple has four children who all attend school. Since a very young age, Pascal Comlan has been a resident of the neighborhood of Xwalacodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where he lives with his children and wife. The parents provide together for their family. Pascal Comlan never attended school. Pascal Comlan has been selling palm oil through the distribution system for about five years. This enables him to pay for his expenses. Pascal Comlan gets his supplies in Kpondavé in Benin. He is a long-standing customer with Alidé and has already been granted four loans which he has repaid on schedule. He wants to increase his inventory and better meet the high demand from his customers. This is why Pascal Comlan applies for another loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman M. was born in 1986. He lives in Sevkar village, in the Tavush region, with his parents and a brother. After serving in the Armenian army, Arman joined his family's occupation: cattle-breeding and bee-keeping. Arman says that farming is a very hard business, not only because it’s labor-intensive, but also because he has to defend the beehives from bears, who sometimes steal them from the villagers.   
Arman is asking for a 450,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals, to repair beehives and to transport his animals to the mountains for grazing.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals, to repair beehives and to transport his animals to the mountains for grazing

loans.name: Mamajanova Kanayim`s Group

texts.ru:
Канайым, 39, замужем. Она занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение КРС и МРС. В настоящий момент откармливает 35 овец, 3 коровы и 2-х бычков. Супруг работает в пожарной охране. У нее 4 детей: сыну 19 лет, дочерям 17, 5, 12 лет. На кредит планирует закупить сено и корм для живности.

Борубаева Мотобар 43 года. Ее супруг частный сварщик, также полуает пособие в размере 6 000 ом (120 долларов). У нее 7 детей: Старшая дочь на заработках в РФ, старший сын работает в отделе охраны сержантом, второй сын на заработках в РФ, вторая дочь студентка, остальные дети школьники. Клиент занимается животноводством: откорм и разведение КРС. Клиент хочет закупить живность для увеличения поголовья.

Алиме  77 лет. она вдова, у нее двое детей. Клиент вместе с сыном сельским хозяйством: выращивание и реализация картофеля. Посадила на 0,20 га земли картофель, 0,10 га планирует посадить табак, 0,10 га кукурузу. Клиент планирует закупить 200 кг мин. удобрения, обработать землю и сделать минирования грядков.

Кимсан,  78 лет. Она вдова. 'Она занята откормом и разведением КРС, дома откармливает 3 поголовье КРС. Она хочеть купить холодильник для дома.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kanayim is 39 years old, married. She is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding cattle and small livestock. She is currently fattening 35 sheep, 3 cows and 2 bulls. Her husband works with the fire prevention service. Kanayim has 4 children: son is 19 years old, daughters are 17, 5 and 12 years old. She plans to use the loan to buy hay and feed for the livestock. Motobar B. is 43 years old. Her husband is a private welder and also receives a pay in the sum of 6000 som (120 dollars). Motorbar has 7 children. The oldest daughter works in the Russian Federation, oldest son works as a sergeant at the security department, second son also works in Russia, second daughter is a student, and the rest of the children go to school. The client is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding cattle. She wants to buy livestock in order to increase livestock headcount. Alima is 77 years old. She is a widow and has two children. The client and her son are involved in agriculture: growing and selling of potatoes. She planted potatoes on 0.20 hectares of land, plans to plant tobacco on 0.10 hectares and corn on another 0.10 hectares. The client plans to purchase 200 kg of mineral fertilizers, treat and mine the soil. Kimsan is 78 years old. She is a widow. She is involved in fattening and breeding of cattle, and has 3 heads of cattle at home. She wants to buy a refrigerator for home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hay and livestock feed

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin A. is 44 years old. He sells toys for children in his store in Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Elchin likes selling. His wife helps him. Elchin started his business in 2006. He decided to start his own business when he found himself without an income. With his savings he was able to purchase the first merchandise for his store. For the last five years he has been building his business. Elchin applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more merchandise to sell in his store so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Abdyrazakova`s Group

texts.ru:
Айтбу, 51, вдова. У нее 2 детей, сыну 26 лет, дочери 21. Сын находится на заработках в Рф занимается строительством, а дочь помогает матери по хозяйству. Клиент выращивает и реализует картофель на земельном наделе 0.30 га земли посеяли 800 кг семена картофеля. В настоящее время идет обработка и прополка картофеля. На кредит она хочет закупить цемента для стройки дома, планирует закупить 1тн.
 
Маматсаку 43 года. Он женат и отец '4 детей: сыну 19лет, дочерям 17,14,12 лет. 'Сын студент, учится в Ош МУК, дочери школьницы, вмести с клиенткой живет мать, пенсия 3000 сом. 'На кредит он планирует закуп минеральных удобрений, для выращивания картофеля.

Мухабаткан 38 лет. Ее супруг строитель. У нее 4 детей: все они школьники. Она занимается Селським хозяйством: выращивание и реализация картофеля. В огороде и на земельном наделе посеяли картофель. Она хочет закуп цемента 1т по 5 сом для стяжки.

Гулмира, 39, замужем. Клиент занята откормом и перепродажей КРС. С весны до поздней осени откармливает на пастбище Кара-Булак. Дома откармливает доенную корову. Она планирует закуп семян картофеля для выращивания. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aytbu is 51 years old, a widow. She has 2 children. Her son is 26 years old, and daughter is 21. The son works in the Russian Federation and does construction work, and the daughter helps her mother with the household. The client grows and sells potatoes on her plot of land. She planted 800 kg of potato seeds on 0.30 hectares of land. Currently, Aytbu is treating and weeding potatoes. She wants to use this loan to buy cement in order to build a house. She plans to buy 1 ton. Mamatsak is 43 years old. He is married and a father of 4 children. His son is 19 years old, and daughters are 17, 14 and 12 years old. The son is a student at a university in Osh, and daughters are school students. The client’s mother, whose pension is 3000 som, lives with him. Mamatsak plans to use this loan to buy mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes. Muhabatkan is 38 years old. Her husband is a construction worker. She has 4 children, all of whom are school students. Muhabatkan is involved in agriculture, specifically growing and selling potatoes. She planted potatoes in the backyard and land plot last week. She wants to buy 1 ton of cement at 5 som for foundation. Gulmira is 39 years old, married. The client is involved in fattening and reselling of cattle. She fattens livestock at the Kara-Bulak pasture from spring to late autumn. She is raising a dairy cow at home. Gulmira plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds for growing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement

loans.name: Abd Elmuhsen

texts.en: Abd elmuhsen K. is 36 years old. He is married and has six members in his family. Two of his children are in school in Ramallah. Abd aims to increase his income through this loan. He will buy extra equipment and materials for his small business: an accessories shop. He hopes that the increased income will support him in opening a barbershop, which will also increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase extra equipment and materials

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku E. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock firewood to sell. Kaku is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a small-scale farmer. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up her stock of charcoal.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Levon

texts.en: Levon K. was born in 1957 in Ijevan city. He is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. His son is school-aged, one daughter is a student, and his elder daughter graduated from the institute last year but is still jobless. For 12 years Levon worked as a warehouse manager at Ijevan's building administration. After that he moved from Armenia to Russia, but in 2000 he returned to his native land and organized his own food trading business. During these years, with income from his business, Levon was able to keep his family, pay for his daughters’ education and also to increase the size of his shop. Levon seeks a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy sausages, chicken meat, juice, etc. for his shop. He intends to spend future income on his shop's extension and repair.

loans.use: To buy sausages, chicken meat, juice, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.en:
Bahriddin is 28 years old and lives with his wife, parents and a small child. He is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard-worker and very dedicated to his agricultural work raising the cattle. Bahriddin saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. The challenge is to improve the breed but, in order to do so, he would have feed them properly. Bahriddin has the best intentions for his children, this ensures him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living. In order to do so, Bahriddin is asking for a loan. This will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality.  
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Mahtab Gull Group

texts.en: Zoolf A. is the son of P. A.. He is 59 years old and the leader of Mahtab Gull group. He is educated and bears the responsible for his whole family. He sells fresh fruit from a cart, which he has done for more than three years, and lives in a rental house. With his income he can support his family and pay the rent, but he can't buy or build a house. A few years ago, he bought a piece of land but was unable to build on it. He has requested a loan to start working on his land to build his new home and start a new life to help give his family a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Aslidin

texts.en:
G. Aslidin is 39 years old. He is married and has 4 children. During the last 11 years Aslidin has been providing transportation services. As a rule he works locally, in his region only. At the same time, together with the help of his wife and children, he raises cattle at his home, which gives additional income to his family. Currently Aslidin’s truck needs repairing. He requests $1000 US Dollars. Aslidin promises to pay the loan on time and thanks everyone for support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts necessary for the maintenance of the truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used electronics

loans.name: Apiyu

texts.en:
Apiyu M. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and bags of beans to sell.  Apiyu is 31 years old. She is married and her husband is a clerk. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. loans.use: To stock onions and bags of beans to sell.

loans.name: Mahmudova`s Group

texts.ru:
Зехрахон, 40, замужем.  'Супруг работает в цементном заводе водителем, зарплата около 170 долларов. Сын школьник, также с заемщицей живет свекровка, пенсионерка получает пенсию 70 долларов. Клиент в настоящее время занимается откормом овец дома, а также получает пенсию в размере 1500 сом. Бизнес была начат с одного быка, потом продав быка закупили 8 овец. На кредит она планирует закупить 2-х теленков для откорма и разведения.

Содат, 44, замужем. У нее 3 детей: дочке 22, сыну 18 и 13 лет. 'Дочь помогает матери по хозяйству, сын занимается откормом живности, младший сын школьник. В настоящее время занимается сельским хозяйством, выращиванием картофеля и подготовкой земли для посева хлопчатника. На кредит планирует акупить мин. удобрения и семена хлопчатника.

Момине 47, замужем. 'супруг преподаватель по биологии, з/та 50 долларов. Клиент откармливает живность для разведения. Также работает учительницей в школе, препадает по черчению и рисованию. На кредит планирует закупить овец и отправить на пастбище.

Замирахон, 53, замужем. Супруг занимается предоставлением услуг. На машине Зил 53 доставляет строй материалы по указанным местам. В настоящее время она активно занимается реализацией молока. также клиентка работает в школе преподавательницей. На кредит она планирует закупить теленка и отправить в адыр для откорма.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zehrahon is 40 years old, married. Her husband works as a driver at the cement plant and receives a salary of about 170 dollars. The son is a school student. The client’s retired mother-in-law also lives with Zehrahon and receives a pension of 70 dollars. The client is currently involved in fattening sheep at home and also receives a pension in the sum of 1500 som. Zehrahon started the business with one bull, which she then sold and bought 8 sheep. She plans to use the loan to buy 2 calves for fattening and breeding. Sodat is 44 years old, married. She has 3 children. The daughter is 22 years old, and the sons are 18 and 13 years old. The daughter helps Sodat with the household, son is involved in fattening livestock, and the youngest son is a school student. Currently, Sodat is involved in agriculture, growing potatoes and preparing soil for sowing cotton. She wants to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizers and cotton seeds. Momina is 47 years old, married. Her husband is a biology teacher, whose salary is 50 dollars. The client fattens livestock for breeding. She also works as a drafting and arts teacher at a school. She plans to buy sheep and send it off to a pasture. Zamirahon is 53 years old, married. Her husband provides truck driving service. He uses the Zil 53 vehicle to deliver building materials to set destinations. Currently, Zamirahon is actively involved in selling milk. She also works as a school teacher. She plans to use the loan to buy a calf and send it off to Adyr for fattening.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 calves

loans.name: Ubaid

texts.en:
A married father of 5 children, Ubaid was born in 1963 in Shahrinav district, where he currently lives. A farmer for 12 years, he has mastered farming techniques and always achieves good agricultural harvests, especially when the climatic conditions are favorable. The good yield, Ubaid realizes, is in general due to the seeds he uses. His current seeds have already been used for 3 years and are beginning to lose their productivity and need to be replaced by new ones. However, the lack of investment capital is his current problem. For this, Ubaid is asking for a loan of $3000 USD to buy selected seeds and fertilizers to revitalize his business. The improvement of his yield will give him the financial means to meet the needs of his family.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Awate

texts.en:
Awate M. is currently in the business of selling both fresh and dried fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase pulses and beans to sell. Awate is 41 years old. She is married and her husband is a retired army captain. She has 7 children, 3 of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en:
Mirzoali is married and has 5 children. He sells groceries. His store is located in a very busy place, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Mirzoali. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. Mirzoali has been running this business for 10 years. Lending services from “IMON International” have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Mirzoali’s business is the only source of income for his family. He takes this responsibility seriously and is doing his best to meet the needs of his children. Today he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fresh food items. Mirzoali will never forget the support you give to him.
