loans.use: To purchase food to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Khazar

texts.en: Khazar Q. is a 28 year old man who sells construction materials in the Saatli region. He is married and has two daughters. Khazar started his business in 2005 when he needed money for a wedding. Khazar applies for 1000 AZN to increase the number of items he sells.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.en:
Z. Lutfullo is 39 years old. He is married and has four children. After he received a loan from IMON International, he witnessed an increased harvest for the first time in his life. With the loan, Lutfullo expanded his vegetable growing business. With the additional income from the harvest, Lutfullo opened a small kiosk, at his home, where his family sells different foodstuff items. Accordingly, his family’s standard of living has improved. He is seeking a loan of $2200 USD to expand his farming operations, which will enable him to meet his targets for the coming season and, in turn, to generate additional income.

Margret P. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and onions at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock groundnut paste to sell.  Margret is 19 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot, build and rent it out.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy E. is 42 years old from the Igbo tribe. She is married to a clergyman and they have four children. Joy has owned a poultry and fish farm for 12 years. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living with part of her profits from the business. Joy needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more young chickens and fish for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase more young chickens and fish to breed

loans.name: Shohib Group

texts.en:
Afghan Gull is the group leader of the Shohib Group. She is married and 50 years old. She has two daughters who are in school. She wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She has been involved in this business for more than 20 years and she is quite experienced in tailoring. She needs this small loan for her business. She needs a machine, a disk and a chair for her business. She is very happy with this loan because she will be able to support her daughters in a better way. 

She hopes to grow more in her business.

loans.use: She wants to buy a machine, a disk and a chair for her business

loans.name: Aygul

texts.en: Aygul S. is a 49 year old woman who lives in an Internally Displaced People Settlement and has bred calves for the last 20 years. Aygul is married and has five children. She likes her job and, for her family, it is the only source of income. Aygul wakes up early in the morning to graze her cattle. She  fattens calves for meat production and local butchers come to Aygul to purchase good calves. Aygul applied for 1000 AZN in case to purchase three calves to fatten them and sell by July to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.name: Sharaf Gull Group

texts.en:
Bibi Gull is the daughter of R.. The 28 year old is the leader of the Sharaf Gull group. She is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her whole family, including her father and mother. Her husband has a workshop in the city of Kabul in which he repairs cars. Now he needs some money to buy more tools and enlarge his workshop, but no one is present to give him this much money as a loan.

Therefore, Bibi Gull has requested a loan for her husband. With this loan, he wants to buy more parts of cars for his workshop. He wishes to become a good mechanic in the future. Bibi Gullh would like to thank Kiva's partner AFS a lot.

loans.use: To buy more parts of cars for his workshop

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia T. sells local brews and beer from home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Nadia is 39 years-old and is married with a husband that is a nurse . She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar at the market place.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir B. is a 49 year old man who sells men's and women's shoes in the central bazaar of Imishli city. Tahir is married and has four children who are the central meaning of his life. Tahir started his business ten years ago and, since that time, he has become a very successful entrepreneur. Thanks to his good taste in fashion and his constant smiling face, Tahir`s shop is always full of customers. Tahir`s dream is to build his own shoestore. For this purpose he has applied for a 1200 AZN loan. He will spend this loan to purchase more seasonal shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal shoes.

loans.name: Amer

Amer S. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and dresses at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell. Amer is 39 years old. She is married to a major in the army. She has 5 children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Razia Hamida Group

texts.en:
Razia, the daughter of G. Q., is the leader of the Razia Hamida group. She is an educated and married woman and the mother of six children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. Her husband has had a shop for fresh fruit and vegetables for more than three years. Razia wants to take a loan for her husband and with this loan, he wants to buy apples, oranges, watermelon and so on.  
 
She would like to thank everyone who is supporting him and hopes to continue the partnership with both Kiva and AFS in the coming years.

loans.use: To buy apples, oranges, watermelon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Freshta Mary Group

texts.en:
Freshta is the group leader of the Freshta Mary group. She lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 35 years old and she has four children who are students. She wants to take a loan for her business of embroidery. She needs this loan because she wants to rent a new shop for her business and purchase important supplies such as different kinds of threads, needles and so on.

In the future, she desires to have a progressed business and to support her husband and children in a better way.

loans.use: To rent a new shop for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam A. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock irish potatoes, bags of rice, beans and cassava flour to cook and sell. Mariam is 31 years old. She is married to a builder. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Amina Mayl Group

texts.en:
Mahboba is the daughter of J. and the 33 year-old the leader of the Amina Mayl group. The married mother of three children lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and she wants to take a loan for her husband who has a retail shop.  When he first started this business, it was small and weak, but when he got an individual loan the business really improved.  He is still furthering his business, attracting good numbers of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time. 

For this loan cycle, he will use it to buy, pens, notebooks, candy and shampoo for the store.

Mahboa is happy with this loan. She would like to thank Kiva, AFS and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, she wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy store stock.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata S. lives in Wellington with her husband and four children. She is 36 years old. She has a shop very close to Wellington Market, where she sells pepper, palm oil, onions, maggi (instant soup), tomatoes, groundut oil and charcoal. Aminata has taken two loans from LAPO,SL since she joined in 2009. She was able to take care of her children's school fees with the extra profits resulting from the loan. She is asking for a loan of SLL1,500,000 to enable her buy more pepper, maggi, palm oil, groundnut oil, tomatoes, rice, charcoal and beans to stock her shop. She intends to make a good profit from this loan that will change her living forever.

loans.use: This loan will be use to buy pepper, palm oil, onions, maggi, rice, tomatoes and beans.

loans.name: Rhokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rhokhaya N. est une femme mariée sans enfant qui est âgée de 33 ans et qui habite dans le quartier de Ndeugagne dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC   depuis avril 2008.Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt. Madame N. exerce la profession de bibliothécaire depuis 2004. Auparavant elle était monitrice à la garderie d’enfant Tafsir de Diamalaye. Elle a choisi la profession de bibliothécaire par passion pour les livres. En plus elle a fait la formation et était pensionnaire à l’Ecole Des Archivistes et bibliothécaire de L’Université Cheikh Anta Diop De Dakar. Elle prête régulièrement des livres aux étudiants et élèves des différents établissements de Yoff. Elle est soutien de famille et vit sous le toit paternel. Elle sollicite  un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de portes prévues pour la finition d’un  salon et de quelques chambres. Ce crédit lui permettra de  créer des revenus additionnels  qui pourront  supporter une partie des charges de la famille par le biais de la mise en location de quelques chambres.
texts.en:
Mrs Rhokhaya N., aged 33, is married without children. She lives in the neighborhood of Ndeugagne in the town of Yoff. She has been a member of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since April 2008. She has never got a loan. Mrs N. has been a librarian by profession since 2004. Before that she was an instructor in the Tafsir day-care center in Diamalaye. She decided to become a librarian because of her passion for books. In addition, she is a trained librarian and was a resident student at the School for Archivists and Librarians of the University Cheikh Anta Diop in Dakar. She regularly lends books to students and pupils of the various schools in Yoff. Mrs N. is the main wage-earner in her family and lives in her father's house. She applies for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs to buy doors for her living room and a few other rooms. These rooms will be rented out and the additional income will help her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing off a few rooms to rent out

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu B. is a pregnant woman who lives in Wellington, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She lives with her husband and son, who is in primary school. She has a shop where she sells coco, milk, rice by cup, biscuits and sweets. Kadiatu has been a LAPO,SL client since November 2008 and this is the fourth loan she is taken from LAPO,SL. She added more goods to her shop with her previous loans and now she needs a loan of SLL2,500,000 to open another, smaller shop somewhere in town.

loans.use: This loan will be use to buy, coco, milk, rice, sweets and biscuits.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq A. is a 35-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in Gaza. He opened a computer store in 2008 after realizing that there were no stores of this kind in the area. He hopes that, through this loan, he will be able to buy new computers to sell, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new computers to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu B., 32, lives with her husband and one child in the  Wellington area of Freetown. Her husband is a businessman. Kadiatu sells baby clothes, bags, flasks, and rubber bowls at the Wellington market. She has been a client of LAPO, SL, for two years and has taken out three loans since joining. With her previous loans she purchased more goods thereby expanding her business. This time Kadiatu is seeking a loan of two million Leones to purchase a larger quantity of baby clothes, bags, flasks and rubber bowls. She believes that this will allow her to expand her business and increase profits, giving her the opportunity to support her family.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden D. sells fish and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. Kiden is 29 years old and married  to a policeman. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food to sell.

loans.name: Pari

texts.en: Pari T. is a 47 year old woman who breeds cattle in Bilasuvar city. She is an internally displaced person. She fled to Bilasuva. The only way to earn any money was cattle breeding. Peri has more that 20 years experience in this field. She enjoys her calves and working all day long looking after them. Pari is single and lives with her parents, helping them. Pari has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more cattle to fatten and sell for a profitable price, several months from now.

loans.use: To purchase more calves to sell.

loans.name: Kaldar Group

texts.en:
Kaldar is the daughter of A. J. and the the leader of Kaldar group. She is 33 years-old and the married mother of six children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. Kaldar’s husband has a metal shop in the city making doors, windows, chairs and more. He has some difficulties and needs to buy more iron and some other tools for his metal shop. 

Therefore, Kaldar is requesting a loan for her husband to buy needed tools for his metal shop. She would like to say that Kiva is an effective process that can support entrepreneurs to start a business and to sustain it as well.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Saidia

texts.en:
Saidia S. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at the street in the evening. She is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and milk to make tea to sell. Saidia is 30 years old, married, and her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant at the market.

The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and milk to make to sell.

loans.name: Đỗ's Group

texts.en:
Hà Đỗ Thị is a 26 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Kiva partner SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 05.

Hà is married and has two school-aged children.  Hà works in someone else's business venture in the services sector providing general services to local community members.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide the service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Trương Thị V. is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị M. is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Trương Thị Tỵ is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hà Đỗ Thị (20203050025) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 05 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Trương Thị V. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh H.ng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Trương Thị Tỵ (0) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh H.ng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Khalida Zaryalay Group

texts.en:
Jamila is the daughter of M. S.. She is the 47 year-old leader of the Khalida Zaryalay group and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has seven children. Her husband has a fresh fruit and vegetable shop in the city of Kabul. He has been involved in this business for more then four years. He would now like to expand his business but he needs more money so he will buy more fresh fruit and different kinds of vegetables for his shop to be more successful.

Jamila is requesting a loan for her husband so that he can expand and progress his business by buying the necessary materials and stock his shop. 

Jamila is very happy for the loan process in Afghanistan because it provides a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy stock.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 31-year-old housewife and mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Sarah's husband Fareez is a school bus driver and, in the evening, a taxi driver, so Sarah established her own business to help her husband support the big family they share together.

Last year Sarah used the couple's savings to buy a number of hens, feed and a coop. The hens were bought for the purpose of producing and selling eggs and chicks. For the past year the farm has been making good money and attracting a good number of customers, which has helped the couple afford life expenses.  Sarah is thinking of expanding the farm and buying more hens to increase production, so she came to FATEN to take a loan.

Sarah's husband Fareez stands next to the hens' coop in the picture as Sarah is a conservative woman who doesn't want her picture published online.

loans.use: To buy more hens for her farm

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad B. is a 39 year old man who breeds and sells cattle in Bilasuvar city. He has been engaged in this business for the last 12 years. Murad purchases baby calves and then fattens them to sell in the livestock bazaar for a more profitable price. Murad is married and has two children. He wishes to have his own farm with more than 100 cattle. To reach his goals, Murad took a loan of 1000 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase four baby calves.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Abas Hassan Zada Group

texts.en: Abas, son of A. H., is a 33-year-old and married. He is the leader of Abas H. Zada group. He lives in a big family, having 6 children, in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a bus driver and he wants to repair his bus and buy some new spare parts. He has been driving for more than 5 years. So he has requested a loan to for this purpose. He is happy that he has got the chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: he wants to repair his bus

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married to a driver and they have three children. Only one of her children is at the university. Deborah owns the house where the family resides and she takes care of additional family members. Deborah stays in Makerere and moves door-to-door selling second hand clothes. She has been doing this business for quite a long time. Besides this clothing business, she also works as a health worker with MAWDA (Makerere Women Development Association) and works six days a week. She pays for transportation from town to her home. She buys from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. The family has access to electricity and piped water and her monthly expenses include feeding the family, medication and school fees.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Deborah aspires to see her business grow big and to build a house on the plot of land she bought with previous loans. She joined MCDT because it was charging low interest compared to other MFIs in the region.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal M. is currently in the business of selling various items in his shop, such as bags of rice, beans, salt, etc. He is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell. Racheal is 50 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar and salt to sell,

loans.name: Marsha

texts.en: Marsha is a professional salon-products distributor. She started her business in 2007 when she completed cosmetology school and was working with a small client base. Becoming a products distributor to professional salons allowed her the opportunity to increase her income and network with more experienced salon professionals. One of Marsha’s greatest successes in running her business has been to offer educational classes for cosmetologists. She says “For knowledge truly is power. By sharing knowledge, I not only help other professionals improve their businesses but improve mine as well.” One of Marsha’s biggest challenges has been to obtain the resources to increase her inventory in order to provide products on a larger scale. She realizes any business that cannot keep up with the demand for their product will ultimately lose the sale to another company. She explains “Hair stylists need products on a daily basis and I realize that if I didn't have the product, they would have no choice but to shop elsewhere.” Marsha will be using this loan will to purchase additional inventory along with an inventory/accounting software package. For the future she is working towards developing a website for her retail products and an actual storefront away from her home. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy new inventory and a software package

loans.name: Mina Shakiba Group

texts.en:
Mina is the daughter of S. and the leader of Mina Shakiba group. She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and she needs a small loan for her business of tailoring because she wants to buy a new sewing machine for her business to make more and better dresses. 

So she has a requested a loan and she wants to expand and move her sewing business forward. She wishes she could become a famous dressmaker in the future.

 She is very happy with this small loan  that helps poor people in Afghanistan. She thanks all lenders of AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new  sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed B. is a 24-year-old, married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and three children. In 2008, Mohamed opened his own poultry farm. With this loan, he hopes that he would be able to buy more poultry, which will increase his income and improve the status of his farm.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Wili Waldo

texts.es:
EL Señor Wili Waldo H. L. tiene 39 años y está concuvinado con la Señora Carmela Ríos Orellana por más de 16 años, tiene 5 hijos dependientes que estudian, El señor mayormente se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser ama de casa y cuidando a sus animales. 
                                                                                                                                                                                       El señor Wili Waldo H. L. vive en Colomi sindicato Santa Barbara zona este  rural del pueblo de colomi, el crédito  utilizara para abrir una tienda de abarrotes en el domicilio mismo.  
                                                                                                                                                                  El señor Wili Waldo H. L. nos comenta que su sueño aparte de abrir la tienda comercial, es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar la vivienda para vivir más cómodamente con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficie (aumentara la producción), porque es la primera necesidad de la canasta familiar a nivel Bolivia, a la vez es un recurso económico que genera ingresos para mantener y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wili Waldo H. L. is 39 years old. He has been in a common law marriage with Carmela Ríos for over 16 years. They have five dependent children who go to school. He primarily works in agriculture. He grows potatoes, beans, “oca” (an edible root), and “papa liza” (a tuber grown in the Andean region). He takes them to the weekly fair in Colomi to sell. His wife helps him in the agricultural production in addition to being a housewife and taking care of their animals. Wili Waldo H. L. lives in Sindicato Santa Barbara, a rural area to the east of the town of Colomi. He will use the loan to open a grocery store in his home. Wili Waldo H. L. tell us that his dream, besides opening the grocery store, is to keep improving his economic resources so that his children keep going to school until they become professionals. He also wants to improve his house in order to live more comfortably with his family. Lastly, he tells us that he will plant in a larger area (this will increase production). His crops are the basic needs for a Bolivian family. At the same time, they are an economic resource that generates income to support and feed his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama L. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) and dried fish. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Mama is 28 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for beans, pulses and maize flour in order to expand her business .

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Djily

texts.fr: Monsieur Djily D. est un jeune boutiquier de 36 ans qui exerce son activité de commerce dans un local pris en location situe a quelque mètres  de  la caisse de Yoff. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 2 mois. Il a appris l’activité pendant plusieurs années en étant  employé par d’autres boutiquiers plus expérimentés. Actuellement il gère sa propre boutique. Pour Monsieur D. c’est le seul moyen de gagner sa vie et subvenir a ses besoins. Cependant c’est aussi une activité  qu’il a hérité de ses parents. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de marchandises pour renforcer sa boutique. Ce crédit pourra l’aider à acheter certains produits qui sont fréquemment demandes par les clients et qu’il ne peut pas acquérir avec son fond propre. Ainsi il pourra considérablement accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et ses bénéfices avec ce financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Djily D. is a 36-year-old shopkeeper who rents his commercial location a few meters from the local Yoff branch of U-IMCEC. He is married and the father of a two-month-old infant. He learned the business for several years working as an employee of more experienced shop owners. He currently manages his own shop. Mr. D. feels this is the only way he can earn a living and meet his personal needs. Running a business is also something he has inherited from his parents. He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy merchandise and build up his shop. The loan will enable him to buy certain products frequently requested by his customers, for which he lacks sufficient funds. He will therefore be able to significantly increase his turnover and his income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: boost working capital

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz M. is a 38-year-old man who is engaged in a trade business. He is a successful entrepreneur and has run his business for the last 10 years. 

Eldaniz is married and has two sons. He sells different car tools and car spare parts. This is the only source of income for his family and he is doing his best to increase his income to improve the living conditions of his children. Eldaniz applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: Increase number of items in inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Emilia G. D. I., cuenta con 48 años, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 3 hijos, la hija mayor ya se encuentra casada. Emilia vive sola con sus dos hijos. La señora Emilia vive en la zona D. Pucarita Chica D. la provincia Cercado del Departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Emilia se dedica exclusivamente a la producción D. leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero D. la zona, que a su vez recoge la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy modestas, tienen una casa con habitaciones normales hechas D. barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Emilia es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y sus dos hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican a pastear a las vacas, es una actividad ardua donD. ambos trabajan.   

La señora Emilia solicita el crédito para la compra D. alimento en general que en la época D. invierno este escasea bastante, D. esta manera pueda producir más leche, e incrementar  sus ingresos y tener una nivel D. vida estable.
texts.en:
Sra. Emilia G. D. I., 48, has little more than an elementary school education. She has 3 children including a recently marrid daughter. She lives with her two other children in Pucarita Chica, a region of the "departamento" of Cochabamba. Sra. Emilia makes a living by producing and selling raw milk, all of which is processed at a local dairy called PIL ANDINA. Sra. Emilia's living conditions are very modest. She has a house maD., like most in the area, of clay bricks and shares her roof with her cows. Sra. Emilia is a hard-working woman. She and her chidren get up very early every day to milk the cows. They spend their days pasturing the cows, a very arduous job that requires all their effort. Sra. Emilia is applying for a loan so that she buy feed for the cows, feed that is most scarce in winter, but which will allow her to increase her milk production and, in turn, her income and living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed for milk cows

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en: Sarvan A. is a 30-year-old internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar settlement in 1992. He started his business in 2004 by buying one cow and now he has gained enough experience to breed more cattle. Sarvan is married and has four children. He has applied for 1200 AZN to purchase more cattle and increase his income by fattening and selling calves to the local butchers.

loans.use: To purchase five baby calves

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is married with children. Her husband is a businessman dealing in spare parts. All her children go to school and she resides in her own house where she stays with additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees. Hajara deals in bananas in Kalerwe markets in one of the city suburbs. She sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Hajara has been in this business for a long time. Besides banana selling, she also owns a boda boda (motorcycle) which brings in additional income on a daily basis. Hajara also owns rental houses. She has been with MCDT for a long time and has received many loans from MCDT, She wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas. She works six days a week. Business challenges include defaulters and thieves. Hajara aspires to see her business increase, to educate her children and improve her standard of living. She joined MCDT to generate capital for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora E. sells fresh and sour milk at the market and is requesting a loan to stock jericans of honey to sell.  Debora is 26 years-old and is married with a husband that is a cattle keeper. She has two children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To buy honey to sell.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer A. is a 38 year-old married man from Ramallah. He lives with his wife and four children. In 2008, Samer opened his own general store.  With this loan, he hopes that he will be able to buy a variety of goods, which will increase his income and improve the status of his store.

loans.use: To buy various goods.

loans.name: Mammadov

texts.en: Mammadov M. is a 62 year-old man who has breed cattle in the Bilasuvar internally displaced settlement since 1992. M. has three grown sons who are independent adults thanks to his example. He is a hardworking man who works from early morning until late at night looking after his cattle. He would like to increase his numbers of cattle by purchasing three calves and some fodder and is applying for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair accessories to sell

loans.name: Matebyo

texts.en:
Matebyo G. sells green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sweet potatoes to sell.  Matebyo is 20 years-old and unmarried.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to let for rent.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel tiene 44 años D. edad está casado con el señor Carlos E. tiene dos hijos D. 12 años y 16 años D. edad viven en Esquilan es una comunidad D. la provincia D. Colcapirhua D. Cochabamba, ella es productora D. leche y Carlos trabaja en perforación D. pozos.

Isabel tuvo varios problemas en diciembre del año 2009, porque su esposo sufrió un accidente muy grave en una perforación D. pozo el cual la empresa para la cual realizaba el trabajo no pago nada ella tuvo que vender sus vacas para poder ayudar y pagar la operación D. su esposo como también la escuela D. sus hijos los padres D. Carlos no quisieron ayudarla ella sola pago y él se quedo si trabajo y no podía caminar y este año en el mes D. febrero le realizaron una nueva operación D. la columna la cual salió muy bien porque él empezó a caminar y empezara con sus fisioterapias para poder trabajar y ayudar a su esposa y a sus hijos, Isabel es una mujer que nunca lo dejo solo a Carlos en esos momentos en los que él estaba muy mal ella no perdió la fe ni la esperanza D. que Carlos salga adelante y luche por estar bien.

Isabel piD. el crédito para poder comprar una nueva cabeza D. ganado y poder entregar más leche y realizar quesillo para poderlo vender en el mercado D. Quillacollo D. esa manera poder obtener más ingresos hasta que su esposo este totalmente recuperado y puedan trabajar juntos para que sus hijos puedan realizar una carrera y darles un futuro mejor y sobre todo enseñarles a valorar la vida y seguir apoyando a su papá para que pueda recuperarse trabajar junto a él son una familia que son muy unidos y que tienen sueños para poderlos realizar en un futuro, como el hijo menor quiere hacer estudiar la carrera D. medicina para poder ayudar a niños que por su zona son familias muy pobres y también ayudar a personas que necesitan, como su padre lo necesito cuando tuvo el accidente.
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and married to Carlos E.. She has two children, ages 12 and 16. They live in Esquilan, which is a community in the Colcapirhua province of Cochabamba. Isabel works in dairy production, and Carlos works in drilling. Isabel had various problems in December of 2009; that is when her husband suffered a serious drilling accident that maD. them realize that the company and the job paid poorly. She had to sell her cows in order to help pay for her husband's operations as well as for her children's schooling. Carlos' parents did not want to help; she paid everything herself. Carlos was left without a job -he couldn't walk- and this year in February, he went through another operation for his spine, which went well because he has begun to walk and has started physical therapy in order to be able to work and help his wife and kids. Isabel is a woman who never left Carlos' siD.. In those moments when he was in bad shape, she never lost her faith or hope that Carlos would succeed and fight to become well. Isabel is asking for this loan to be able to buy a new head of cattle and so she can to produce more milk and make farm cheese to sell at the Quillacollo market. With this help she can earn more income until her husband is totally recovered and that they can work together so that their children can have careers and a better future and, above all, to teach them the value of life and to continue supporting their father so that he can return to work. Together they are a very united family, and they have dreams they hope to achieve in the future, such as the youngest son who wants to study medicine in order to help children of poor families in their neighborhood and to also help people who need it, like his father needed help after his accident.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Umjima

texts.en:
Umjima M. sells beer from home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Umjima is 21 years-old and married with a husband that is a driver. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and buy fridges.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase beer to sell.

loans.name: Ciprian

texts.es:
El señor Ciprian tiene 44 años de edad está casado con la señora Leucadia tienen tres hijos dos niñas de 12 y 4 años y el niño de 8 años, ellos viven en Kuluyo una comunidad de la provincia Sacaba de la ciudad de Cochabamba él se dedica a la agricultura y ella a la pecuaria son dos personas que sufrieron mucho cuando eran jóvenes y salieron solos adelante en una comunidad tan alejada de la ciudad.

Ciprian se crio solo con la madrina ya que sus padre murió cuando el tenia solo 8 años la madre murió cuando él nació y sus hermanos mayores no estaban con el entonces salió solo con una persona mayor a quien respeta mucha y aun esta con el que es Francisca que es su madre él cuando la conoció a su esposa decidió irse a Argentina a trabajar para que no les falte nada a su familia pero cuando él estaba haya sufrió un robo lo golpearon y le robaron toda la plata que había juntado de los tres años que estuvo lejos de su familia y el da gracias a Dios de que no lo hayan matado  y volvió al país y se puso a trabajar junto con su esposa en las tierras que le dejo su padre. 

El solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para sembrar papa y otros productos los cuales aumentaran sus ingresos y de esa manera les podrá brindar un mejor futuro a su familia sin salir del país y dejarlos solos el es un hombre muy trabajador sale muy temprano de su casa para tener una buena cosecha y tener unos buenos productos ayuda a su esposa en el ordeño d las vacas para que ella pueda realizar quesillos y de esa manera venderlos en la comunidad ellos sueñan con mandarlos a sus hijos a estudiar a colegios de la ciudad ya que están en una escuela de la comunidad y no tienen buena educación, el quiere que nada le falte a su familia y así tengan una vida mejor a la que tuvieron ellos.
texts.en:
Ciprian is 44 years old and married to Leucadia. They have three children: two daughters, ages 12 and 4, and a son, age 8. They live in Kuluyo, a community in the Sacaba province of Cochabamba. He works in agriculture, and she in livestock. They are two who suffered a great deal when they were young, and they have moved ahead in a community far from the city. Ciprian was raised alone by his godmother after his parents died when he was 8. His mother died when he was born, and his older brothers were not around, and he went by himself to an older person who he really respects, Francisca, and who is still around today and who serves as his mother. When he met his wife, Ciprian decided to go to Argentina to work so that his family wouldn't be lacking for anything, but when he was beaten and robbed and all his money that he had saved for the three years he was away from his family had been stolen, he gave thanks to God that he wasn't killed and returned to his country and went to work alongside his wife on the land that his father left him. He is seeking this loan in order to buy seeds so he can plant potatoes and other produce that will increase his income and allow him to provide a better future for his family without having to leave the country and leave them alone. He is a very hard-working man; he leaves home very early to have a good harvest and other good results. He helps his wife with milking of the cows so she can make the fresh cheeses and sell them in the community. They dream of sending their children to study in the city schools since they are in a local school and don't receive a good education. He wants that his family never lacks anything and that their children can have a better life than they had.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for potatoes and other agricultural products

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señorita Lidia V. tiene 20 años, vive en London comunidad de las Zona de Santivañez de la Provincia de Capinota, Ubicada al Sur del departamento de Cochabamba. Lidia es soltera, y vive con sus padres, el Sr. Erasmo y la Sra. Florencia quienes son personas de la tercera edad, de 66 y 65 años.

Lidia y sus papas se dedican a la producción de leche cruda y entregan al modulo de la zona, además tienen propiedades de cultivos donde siembran papa, zanahoria y cebolla, actividad que también le genera ingresos. Lidia y sus papas son personas muy dedicadas a su trabajo, Lidia es la hija menor de su matrimonio, el Sr. Erasmo es una persona muy trabajadora, jubilado del magisterio y ha inculcado en sus hijos la responsabilidad y el deseo de superación, virtudes que las tiene muy presentes Lidia, es así que ella desea estudiar para Pedagogía, pero no puede dejar solos a sus papas solos, además que para estudiar tendría que viajar una hora y media desde London hasta la Universidad que se encuentra en la provincia Cercado de la Ciudad de Cochabamba, y poder realizar sus sueños y los de sus padres. 

Lidia solicito un crédito para poder comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno, de modo de poder incrementar sus ingresos, considerando que la lechería solo necesita atención por las madrugadas y al finalizar el día, entonces sus padres durante el día solo tendrían que cuidar al ganado y ver que se alimenten, y Lidia tendría la oportunidad para iniciar su carrera con la ayuda de sus padres. La lechería les ha ayudado durante toda su vida, con los ingresos de la lechería Lidia ha logrado terminar el Colegio, ahora para sus estudios de Lidia necesita más recursos, por lo tanto al incrementar una cabeza de ganando podrá disponer de más ingresos, y cuando pueda terminar sus estudios poder desenvolverse en Santivañes, pues es una localidad que ha sido olvidada y marginada por nuestras autoridades por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Lidia V. is 20 years old. She lives in the community of London, in the Santivañez region of the Capinota province, located in the south of the Cochabamba. Lidia is single and lives with her senior citizen parents, Mr. Erasmo and Mrs. Florencia, ages 66 and 65. Lidia and her parents work in the production of raw milk that they deliver to the unit in their region. They also have fields where they grow potatoes, carrots, and onions, an activity that generates a good income. Lidia and her parents are very dedicated to their work. Lidia is the youngest daughter of the couple. Erasmo is a very hard-working person, a retired teacher, and has instilled in his children the idea of responsibility and the desire for improvement, virtues that Lidia hold dear. She wants to study education, but she cannot leave her parents alone; also studying would mean she would have to travel an hour and a half from London to the university in the Cercado province of Cochabamba in order to realize this dream of hers and her parents. Lidia is requesting a loan to be able to buy a head of cattle. This way she can increase their income, considering that the dairy farm only needs her attention in the mornings and at the end of the day. Then, her parents can care for the livestock and see that they are fed by themselves during the day, and Lidia can have the opportunity to begin her education with the help of her parents. Their dairy farm has seen them though their entire lives. Lidia was able to finish high school with the money earned from the farm. Now, Lidia needs more resources for her studies, and increasing the number in their herd will make more income available. When she is able to finish her studies, she can settle in Santivañes, a town that has been forgotten and marginalized by the authorities for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia N. sells bread and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell.  Fozia is 31 years-old and is married with a husband that is a farmer. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Kanie

texts.fr: Madame Kanie N. est une femme âgée mais dynamique de 73 ans. Elle s’active et forme les jeunes filles de la maison à la restauration en sevrant du petit déjeuner et diner aux gens de son quartier. Elle habite à Ngaparou dans la localité de Yoff. Elle a 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 35 et 50 ans. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2004. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans la restauration. Madame N.  projette  à avoir une activité secondaire qui consiste à louer des chaises. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a compléter les frais d’acquisition des chaises. Ses revenus lui permettent de mieux soutenir  ses enfants et ses petits enfants qui sont dans le besoin. Elle compte agrandir son restaurant son restaurant et accroitre ses gains financiers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kanie N. is a dynamic 73-year-old woman. She actively coaches young girls in the household to the restaurant business by serving breakfast and dinner to customers from her neighbourhood. She lives in the Ngaparou area of Yoff. She has seven children whose ages vary from 35 to 50 years old. She has been a member of the Yoff branch of UIMCEC since January 2004. Mrs. N. has over 20 years’ experience in the restaurant business. She would like to start a side business renting chairs. For this she is requesting a loan for 300,000 francs to finalise the acquisition of chairs. Her earnings enable her to provide support to those of her children and grand-children in need. She wishes to expand her restaurant and increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice S. sells fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions to sell.  Alice is 40 years-old and is married with a husband that is a cattle keeper. She has four  children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El Sr. Bernardino es un cliente antiguo de la institución, es muy responsable y puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas, se dedica al servicio de transporte, tiene su movilidad propia con la que trabaja como radiotaxi, vive en su casita ubicada en la zona de San Isidro Bajo, con su esposa que se dedica a las labores de la casa el solo mantiene el hogar trabaja para los gastos de el y de su esposa; sus hijos ya son independientes y viven también por la zona, El crédito será invertido en la compra de cuatro llantas y motor de arranque para su movilidad, al cliente le gusta tener su movilidad siempre en buen estado para poder trabajar sin problemas y asi poder brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Bernardino is a long-standing customer of the institution. He is very responsible and punctual in his loan payments. He works in transportation services, and has his own car with which he works as a radiotaxi. He lives in a small house located in the San Isidro Bajo region, with his wife who works in the house. He maintains the home alone, working to make the money to cover the expenses for himself and his wife. Their children are already independent and also live in the region.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of four tires and a starter motor for his car. Bernardino always likes to have his car in good condition to be able to work without problems and therefore be able to offer good service to his customers. He is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and a starter motor

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Daniel K. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “In God We Trust”. He is 31 years old, is married, and has a 5-month-old child. He also cares for his parents.

For nine years Daniel has been selling medicines at the S. D. Cooper Road Market in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells at an ideal location and gives his business center good maintenance in order to keep customers returning.

Daniel's goal and dream is to expand his business to other locations outside of Montserrado County. He will use his 16,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 83,500 Liberian dollar loan to purchase more medicines to sell. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Daniel is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El joven Fernando V. F. tiene 23 años y actualmente vive solo en la zona Norte de Cochabamba en el barrio conocido como Temporal. Fernando vive solo porque quiere superarse por su cuenta. El trabaja en un Casino de la ciudad de Cochabamba como Barman. Fernando acudió a un instituto por 3 años para aprender el oficio de Barman, y así tomar un paso muy importante en su sueño de ser el mejor barman no solo de Cochabamba sino también de Bolivia.

Fernando también da clases de Barman en su domicilio para todos los que quieran aprender a preparar diferentes tragos, y quieran aprenden los diferentes trucos que deben saber los que trabajan como Barman. Es para esto que necesita el crédito, para comprar equipo de Bar para poder enseñar mejor y ganar más clientes, y si Dios quiere abrir un instituto algún día.
texts.en:
Fernando V. F. is 23 and currently lives on his own in the Norte area of Cochabamba, in a neighborhoods known as Temporal. Fernando lives alone because he wants to excel through his own efforts. He works as a bartender in a Cochabamba casino. Fernando attended an institute for 3 years in order to learn the bartending trade, and he took an important step towards reaching his dream of becoming the best bartender not only of Cochabamba but of Bolivia. Fernando also gives bartending classes in his home for all who want to learn how to prepare different drinks and to learn the different tricks that are essential to work as a bartender. He needs a loan to be able to buy bar equipment so he can teach better and gain more clients, and, God willing, he wants to open his own institute one day.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment Capital (purchase of bar equipment)

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: La señora Alba Nubia tiene 43 años de edad. La señora se dedica a una pulpería. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace ocho años,  nunca pensó que se dedicaría a esta actividad algún día. Ella empezó con este negocio como una búsqueda alternativa de una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera obtener ingresos adicionales por lo que es muy importante para ella y su familia, por lo que siempre se ha esforzado por proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos necesarios como golosinas, pan, galletas y granos básicos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios para sufragar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Alba Nubia is 43 years old. She works in a corner store. She began this business eight years ago, but she never thought that she would come to dedicate herself to this activity one day. She started this business while searching for alternative sources of income that would give her the extra income that is so important for her and her family, especially since she has always striven to provide her children with the basic necessities. Currently, she is seeking this loan to use as working capital so she can buy more of the products she needs like candy, bread, crackers and grains. She dreams of improving her business and of it providing her with the income needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zesar

texts.es: EL SR. ZESAR  ES CASADO, ES COCHABAMBINO NACIO EL 30 DE JULIO DE 1978, EN COCHABAMBA,  TIENE SU PARSELA EN SAN LUIS EN LA BANDA DEL RIO EN LA CUAL SIEMBRA PAPA,Y AJI Y EL PERSONALMENTE LO LLEVA A VENDER A SUCRE, EL AJI PICANTE ES UN PRODUCTO MUY CONSUMIDO EN SUCRE PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS COMIDAS YA QUE LE PONEN MUCHO AJI PICANTE EN LA MAYORIA DE SUS PLATILLOS TRADICIONALES COMO EL PICANTE MIXTO, SALTEÑAS MONDONGO Y LA FRITANGA. HACE 3 AÑOS QUE VIENE TRABAJANDO CON EMPRENDER EL ES UN BUEN CLIENTE PAGA PUNTUAL SUS CUOTAS, PORQUE ELLOS SON 3 HERMANOS Y SE AYUDAN ENTRE ELLOS PARA NO TENER ATRAZOS, LOS TRES HERMANOS TRABAJAN EN LA AGRICULTURA, EL SR. CESAR ESTA CASADO Y TIENE HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y SIEMPRE ESTA PENSANDO QUE PRODUCTOS SEMBRAR SEGUN A LA TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA ESTE PRODUCTO  TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA EN LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ DONDE EL VIVE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Zesar is married and from Cochabamba. He was born on July 30th of 1978 in Cochabamba. He has a land parcel in San Luis on the riverbank. He plants potatoes and peppers and takes them personally to sell in Sucre. Spicy peppers is a very popular product in Sucre for food preparation. It is used in most of the traditional dishes, such as picante mixto, salteñas, mondongo and fritanga. He has been working with Emprender for three years and he is a good client. He makes his payments on time, because he is one of three brothers and they all help each other so as not to fall behind. All three brothers work in agriculture. Zesar is married and has three small children. He is very hardworking and he is always thinking of what products to plant according to the planting season. With the money from the loan, he will buy seeds to plant potatoes. This product is in high demand in the city of Santa Cruz where he lives. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is married to a market vendor and they have four children together. All of her children go to school. Jessica looks after her old parents. She sells second hand clothes in a retail shop in Kawempe and sells to all categories of people. She has been in this business for a long time. Jessica wants to use this loan of 600,000/= to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Jessica, at times, goes to mobile markets and works six days a week. Her business challenges include transportation of clothes from Owino market (one of the biggest markets in Uganda where she goes for shopping) to her place of work. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can earn enough profits to build a house for the business.  Jessica decided to work with MCDT because it had good services for the active poor women. She owns a house where the family stays and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees, medication and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Know Yourself Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Know Yourself Group”. She is 49 years old, is married, and has seven children who range from 18 to 32 years old. Jacqueline was only able to attend school through elementary school because of a lack of financial support.

For over fifteen years, Jacqueline has been selling dry goods like floor mats, rugs, and used clothing at the G. Town Market,  near Monrovia. She says that she talks to her customers in a friendly manner, which keeps them returning.

Jacqueline plans to use her 26,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 89,600 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods like floor mats, rugs, and used clothing.  Her dream is to grow her business and expand it to other parts of Monrovia.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jacqueline is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods like floor mats, rugs, and used clothing

loans.name: Natividad Ninfa

texts.es:
La señora Ninfa tiene como atividad la venta de hot dos y choripanes se encuentra en su cuarto credito con nuestra institucion pagpo sus cuotas siempre a tiempo, demostrando ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superación esta actividad la realiza los fines de semana ya que ella trabaja como empleada de limpieza de una frial, de esta manera ayudando al sustento de su familia. 
La Sra. Ninfa vive en casa de su suegra pero de manera independiente, comparte la vivienda con sus dos pequeños hijos y con su esposo el cual se dedica a la confección de ropa de temporada.  El destino del crédito es precisamente para la compra de insumos como papa, salchicha, etec para la elaboracion de la comida que ofrece para la venta, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Ninfa es el comprarase una casita y asi poder irse a vivir con toda su familia ya que en la casab de su suegra se siente un poco incomoda, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ninfa's business is selling hot dogs and sausages in buns. She is in her fourth loan cycle with our institution, and she always makes her payments on time, demonstrating that she is a hard-working person with the desire to get ahead. She operates her business on weekends, since she works as a cleaning person during the week to help support her family. Ninfa lives in her mother-in-law's house, but in an independent manner. She also shares the home with her two small children and her husband, who works making seasonal clothing. The loan will be used specifically to buy ingredients such as potatoes, sausages, etc., to prepare the food she sells. One of Ninfa's desires is to buy a small house where she can live with all of her family, since she feels a bit uncomfortable in her mother-in-law's home. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el anexo El Cuarenta del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural pertenenciente al distrito de Mórrope, lugar conocido a nivel regional por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de trece años a la crianza y venta de animales. El cría aves de corral, cerdos y ganado vacuno en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, como esta es su principal fuente de ingresos, el trata de brindar una buena alimentación a sus animales para que estos tengan buena acogida con los negociantes que siempre llegan al lugar a adquirirlos. Adicionalmente Edilberto trabaja como peón agrícola en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona, lo que le brinda una fuente de ingresos que le ayuda a solventar la economía de su familia.

La crianza y venta de animales tiene mucha acogida en la zona, y de ella dependen muchas familias para sobrevivir. Edilberto desea ampliar su negocio para así seguir sustentando la economía de su familia. Siguiendo este objetivo ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas animales y de alimento balanceado.

Edilberto es una persona trabajadora y que siempre trabaja para sacar a su familia adelante. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y ayudarles a susperarse. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas
texts.en:
Edilberto is 36 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and children in the are of El Cuarenta in the neighborhood of Lagunas, a rural zone in the district of Mórrope, a place known regionally for having the largest concentration of population in the rural areas. It is in the province of Lanbayeque and is about an hour and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Edilberto has worked for more than 13 years raising and selling animals. He raises poultry, pigs, and cattle in corrals located on the exterior of his house. Since this is his principal source of income, he tries to provide good feed to the animals so that they are well received by the merchants that arrive at his place to buy them. Edilberto also works as an agricultural laborer in various fields in the area which provides an additional source of income to help him meet the economic needs of his family. Raising and selling animals is widespread in the area and many families depend on that to earn a living. Edilberto wants to expand his business so he can continue providing for his family. Following this objective he has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 new soles that he plans to invest in the purchase of more animals and balanced feed. Edilberto is a hard working person and always strives to help his family get ahead. His main wish is to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and help them to better themselves. He has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small animals and balanced feed to expand his business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Junet

texts.es: Junet es una trabajadora mujer de 29 años, comparte su vida con Willy de 39 años y sus hijos; Edilma de 15 años y Arnold de 6 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeña ella aprendió el arte del tejido y bordado, sin pensar que esta actividad sería hoy en día su principal fuente de ingresos. Desde entonces se dedica al bordado de lana en prendas que le son encargados para que le den los últimos acabados. Su forma de trabajo consiste en agruparse con un grupo de vecinas que se dedican la primera parte del tejido, mientras que Junet termina de acabar con los bordados respectivos. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza y siempre le pone mucha dedicación a sus bordados, ya que gracias a ello puede aportar con los gastos de su hogar al igual que su esposo, además tiene la ventaja de poder trabajar con comodidad dentro de su hogar pudiendo pasar más tiempo con su familia. En el futuro ha pensado poner una librería o una tienda, que sea un negocio más estable. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y trabajar con mucho esmero en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales para seguir con sus bordados, además desea ayudar a su esposo, por lo que invertirá una pequeña parte en la compra de ropa, para luego ser distribuidas y vendidas a diferentes provincias del Perú.
texts.en:
Junet is a working woman, 29 years of age, who shares her life with Willy, 39 years old, and her children, Edilma, 15, and Arnold, 6. They live together in their own home. From an early age she learned the art of weaving and embroidery, without thinking that this activity would today be her principal source of income. Since then, she has dedicated herself to embroidering woolen accessories that are passed on to her for the final touches. The way she does this is to get her neighbors together to do the basic embroidery, then she does the distinctive final work. She greatly enjoys this activity and she always applies much dedication to her embroidery, since thanks to that, she can contribute to household expenses along with her husband. In addition, she has the advantage of being able to work in comfort within her own home, spending more time with her family. In the future she has thought of installing a book store or a general store, which would be a more stable business. This is her 1st credit with MFP and she promises to be punctual in her payments and to work with much dedication in her communal group. With the loan she requests, Junet will buy materials to continue with her embroidery. In addition, she wants to help her husband, for which reason she will invest a small part in the purchase of clothing, to be distributed and sold in different provinces of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS FOR EMBROIDERY

loans.name: Know Yourself Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Know Yourself Group. She is 49 years old, married, and has seven children who range from 18 to 32 years old. Jacqueline was only able to attend school through elementary school because of lack of financial support.

For more than fifteen years, Jacqueline has been selling dry goods such as textiles and sundries at the G. Town Market, near Monrovia, Liberia. She says she talks to her customers in a friendly manner which keeps them returning.

Jacqueline plans to use her 26,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 89,600 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods. Her dream is to open a shop.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jacqueline is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods.

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en:
Adamsay K. owns a store that is located along one of the popular streets in Makeni. She has been in business for about twenty-five years and used to trade in various food produce such as rice, palm oil and onions until recently when she changed to the sale of cosmetics.

Adamsay is married to a nurse and they have three kids and four dependents.She is therefore in need of a loan so that she can buy more cosmetics products to sell which will increase her profit. She intends to educate her children with the proceeds from the business which is one of her main priorities.

Adamsay also hopes to construct a dwelling house in the future. She is a very hardworking and determined woman.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu is married to a taxi driver with whom she has children and all her children are in school. Nulu doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a drug shop in Bwaise. Nulu wants to use this loan of 900,000/=to buy more boxes of drugs and syrups for her drug shop (pharmacy). She has been operating this business for a long time. Nulu rents the shop where she has her drug shop and pays a monthly rent of 50,000/=. Besides this drugshop, Nulu also owns piped water which she sells to neighbors at 100/= per jerry can. She also owns a dry cleaning business.In this dry claening business she doesn't operate it alone but has  got three employees.  Her major customers are people around her place of work and former work mates. Nulu’s business challenges include thieves and the rainy season, which disturbs her business because she works in a muddy place. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a fully stocked pharmacy. Nulu joined MCDT because they were helping women from grassroots and, above all, low income earners. Nulu has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs and syrups

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu J. sells palm oil and gari (cassava flakes) at Flamingo Axis and she is well organized as she operates from a rented store. She has spent four years in this business and spends her entire time on it.

Isatu is married to a trader and they have four children. She needs a loan to buy more palm oil and gari and hopes to use the proceeds to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more gari and palmoil to sell

loans.name: Walakema Group

texts.en:
Hawa S. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Walakema. She is married with 4 children who range from 9 to 23 years old. Hawa did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 16 years, she has been selling pepper at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia. She established the business by herself but lacks good shelter to do business. Hawa sells her goods at a reasonable price to keep customers returning.

Her goal and dream is to own a store and provide an education for her family. She plans to use her 16,000 LRD portion of this 80,000 LRD group loan to purchase more pepper for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more pepper for sale

loans.name: Villa Obrajes Group

texts.es:
