EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO VILL. OBRAJES LLAMADO ASI PORQUE TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES VIVEN EL L. ZONA D. VILL. OBRAJES, TODOS LOS SOCIOS SE CONOCEN Y SE GARANTIZAN ENTRE SI.

L. PRESIDENTA ES L. SRA. ALCIRA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ALQUILER  TIENE UNA TIENDA D. BARRIO EN FINAL CALLE COLOMBIA QUE ATIEND. TODOS LOS DIAS SE LEVANTA DESD. MUY TEMPRANO Y ABRE SU TIENDA HASTA LARGAS HORAS D. L. NOCHE, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL TRANPORTE URBANO TRABAJA TAMBIEN TODO EL DIA, PASA A RECOGER A SU ESPOSA A L. TIENDA Y VAN A SU DOMICILIO PARA QUE AL DIA SIGUIENTE SIGAN L. MISMA RUTINA,  ES UNA PERSONA CON MUCHA INICIATIVA Y BUENA LIDER DEL GRUPO POR SU RESPONSABILIDAD Y SU SOLIDARIDAD FUE ELEGIDA COMO REPRESENTANTE DEL BANCO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA.

L. SECRETARIA ES L. SRTA. VIVIANA  VIVE EN ALQUILER HACE 2 AÑOS, ELL. SE DEDICA AL RECICLADO D. BOTELLAS, ESTA ES UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE L. REALIZAN MUCHAS PERSONAN RECOGEN BOTELLAS D. LOS BASUREROS D. L. CALLE, D. LAS CASAS BUSCAN POR TODO LADO Y DESPUES LO VENDEN A EMPRESAS QUE SE ENCARGAN D. RECICLARAS, CON EL DINERO DLE CREDITO L. SRTA. VIVIANA DESEA ALQUILAR UNA TIENDITA PARA QUE COMPRE ESTOS PRODUCTOS D. OTRAS PERSONAS Y DESPUES ELL. PODER ENTREGAR A LAS FABRICAS DOND. LAS RECICLAN.

ES UN GRUPO  D. 8 PERSONAS JOVENES INDEPENDIENTES   CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENEN UNA ACTIVIDAD INDEPENDIENTE, SON MUY ORGANIZADOS Y ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR L. CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN L. OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The “VilL. Obrajes” communal bank is so called because all its members live in the VilL. Obrajes area; they all know each other and serve as each other’s guarantor. The group president is Alcira. She’s married and has two small children. She rents her house and has a neighborhood grocery store at the end of Colombia Street that’s open every day from very early in the morning until late at night. Her husband is a public transportation driver and also works all day. He comes by to pick up his wife at the end of the day and takes her home to continue the next day with the same routine. She is a person with a lot of initiative and a good group leader. She was elected group president thanks to her responsibility and solidarity. She will use the funds to buy stock merchandise for her store. Viviana is secretary. She rents her house. For two years she has recycled bottles. This is an activity that many people are engaged in. They gather bottles from trash in the street and from homes; they look for them everywhere and sell them to firms that recycle them. Viviana will use the funds to rent a little store where she can buy these products from others and then she will resell them to the recycling firms. This is a group of 8 independent young people. Each has an independent commercial activity. They are very organized and grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señorita Lidia H. V. tiene 28 años es soltera, vive en la zona de la Maica Central de la Provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.Lidia ha estudiado para farmacéutica y trabaja en Omereque una Localidad ubicada al Sur del departamento de Cochabamba. Ella trabaja en el Centro de Salud de Omereque, en atención de la Farmacia del Centro de Salud de Omereque.

Lidia viaja hasta Omerque cada 2 semanas y viene a visitar a madre viuda a La zona de La Maica pues es la hija menor, y la única que le acompaña en su casa, Lidia ya puede ganar su propio sueldo, aunque en Bolivia los sueldos al sector salud no son muy bien reconocidos, y más  aun a Lidia, que solo está encargada de la atención de la farmacia del Centro de Salud del Pueblo, además de eso ella debe pagar un alquiler, porque no cuenta con propiedad en Omereque, ese es el estilo de vida que lleva Lidia, a veces cuando debe viajar por emergencia a visitar a su madre no tiene le alcanza sus sueldo, pero es el sacrificio que debe pasar por cumplir los sueños de su madre de poder desenvolverse como Farmacéutico, Lidia lleva casi dos años trabajando así, su deseo que es que pueda llevarse a su mamá hasta Omereque y allá vivirían las dos, pero como no tiene suficientes ingresos para poder mantener a su mamá mas. La madre de Lidia ha trabajado toda su vida en la lechería pero ahora se encuentra cansada además que tiene una edad muy avanzada, y sufre de reumatismo, no podrá dedicarse por mucho tiempo a esta actividad.

Lidia ha solicitado el crédito para poder iniciar su negocio de Farmacéutico en Omereque,  ella ha podido ver que en esa pequeña localidad la población necesita de una Farmacia que pueda atender en los horarios cuando el Centro de Salud está cerrado, así con esos ingresos más podrá con el tiempo cumplir sus deseos de llevar a su madre a vivir con ella, y no estar tan separadas, además podrá cuidar a su mamá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia H. V. is 28 years old, single, and lives in the Maica Central region of the Cercado province, in the department of Cochabamba. She has studied to be a pharmacist and works in the health center of Omereque, located in the southern region of Cochabamba. Lidia travels to Omereque every two weeks and goes to visit her mother in the region of La Maica, since she is the youngest daughter and the only one who accompanies her at home. She can already earn her own salary, although in Bolivia the salaries in the health sector are not very high. Furthermore, Lidia is only in charge of the health center's pharmacy, and she must pay rent since she doesn't own property in Omereque. Occasionally, when she has to make an emergency visit to her mother, she cannot afford to travel. However, this is the sacrifice she must make to fulfill her mother's dream of seeing her become a pharmacist. She has been working like this for almost two years, and her wish is to take her mother to Omereque so they can live there together. However, currently she does not earn enough income to support her mother, who has worked her whole life in a creamery but now finds herself worn out and older in age. Also, she suffers from rheumatism and will not be able to carry on this activity much longer. Lidia has requested this loan to be able to start up a pharmaceutical business in Omereque. She has been able to see in this small town that the population needs a pharmacy that can attend to them during the hours when the health center is closed. Also, with this income she will be able to fulfill her desire to live together with her mother and also care for her.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pharmaceuticals for her business

loans.name: Nazratu

texts.en:
Nazratu K. sells plastic products and household utensils at a popular area called  P.Z Roundabout. She is very hard working and business-minded. She is married to a graduate who is unemployed and they have three children. Nazratu K. has 12 years of business experience.  She spends her entire time with the business and needs a loan to buy household utensils for her business to grow.

She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her children, buy land and help her husband who has not yet gained employment.

loans.use: To buy plastic items and household utensils

loans.name: Jems Melvin

texts.es:
Jems forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene 23  años, es natural de Puno, es soltero y estudia en la Universidad  Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco  la carrera profesional de “Electrónica” y está cursando el sexto semestre.    

Jems es un joven responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante,   él requiere el préstamo para hacer un curso de especialización en automatización industrial en el instituto privado TECSUP. 
Jems y su familia tiene una fábrica de gaseosas llamada “Sumac  Kola”. Ya son 8 años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien.  Su anhelo del socio terminar el curos de especialización y automatizar la planta de producción de gaseosa.        

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Jems is part of the community bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley). He is 23 years of age, and is a native of Puno. He is single and is studying at the Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad of Cusco. His course of study is "Electronics" and is now enrolled in the sixth semester. Jems is a responsible young entrepreneur who looks at every opportunity to succeed. He needs a loan to be able to continue with his study and take a course specializing in industrial automation in the private technical institute TECSUP. Jems and his family have a soft drinks factory called "Sumac Kola." They have worked in their business for 8 years and do very well. Jem's hope is to complete the specialization at school and automate the soft drink (soda) production plant. He is very grateful for the opportunity afforded by this organization, and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para realizar un Curso especialización en Electrónica.  (to be able to take a course specializing in the study of electronics)

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Gertrude S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing. She is 38 years-old and married with two children who are each 10 years-old.  Due to poverty, Mrs. S. was only able to attend school through 12th grade.

For six years, Mrs. S. has been running a mini cinema business in Paynesville on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  She says customers are attracted by her business because of the new and good movies she offers which make customers return.  She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy additional new movies.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Gertrude is the one holding the sign. Stanley B. is inset in the lower right.

loans.use: To buy new movies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married to a businessman who deals in sugar, soap, and cooking oil. Maria doesn’t have any school-going child, although she takes care of her late sister's children who are currently schooling.. Maria owns a pub where she sells beer, soda, and mineral water. This business has lasted for years. Maria wants to use this loan of 800,000/= to buy boxes of mineral water, crates of beer and soda.  Maria doesn’t have any other side business. She rents the business premises where she operates. Maria sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her business challenge is the  seasonality .She doesn’t pay any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. Maria aspires to see her business grow big and to start selling at wholesale only. She joined MCDT because was it was giving out loans to women who are in groups with no collateral security but only group co–guarantorship.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and mineral water

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu J. sells locally-dyed clothes. He is hard working and business-minded. He has 10 years experience and his business is located in the central part of Makeni.

He is married to a merchant and has four children. He spends all his time selling and needs a loan to buy raw materials such as bright textiles and the ink used to process the textiles.  He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate his children and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Adela vive junto con su familia, un hijo y su esposo. Su negocio lo inicio desde hace dos años. Con el propósito de poder ayudar en los gastos básicos de agua y luz, su esposo trabaja como contador, el cual apoyo la iniciativa de mi negocio en donde me afilie con la empresa zermat y vendo por catálogos al gusto del cliente. Son producto bonito y accesible de compra. Pues ha logrado captar clientes. Con el crédito anterior logro mejorar un closet que tenia en mal estado todo esto gracias a su ganancias, a través del financiamiento. Con este préstamo pondrá cielo raso en la sala de su casa con el objetivo de amortiguar la presión del calor, ya que en estos días, ha sido muy caliente produciendo mucha presión alta. Es por eso la necesidad de esta mejora.
texts.en:
Adela lives with her family: a son and her husband. She started her business 2 years ago, with the objective of being able to help out with the basic household expenses such as the water and light bill. Her husband works as an accountant. He supported her in starting up her business, which involves catalog sales from the Zermat (beauty products) company. They have nice products that are affordable, and so she has managed to attract customers. With her previous loan, and thanks to her earnings, she managed to improve a closet that was in bad condition. With this loan she will put in a stucco ceiling in the living room of her house to make the room cooler, since during this summer it has been uncomfortably hot. This is the reason that she wants to make this improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to put a stucco ceiling in her house

loans.name: Heridas De Amores Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO HERIDAS DE AMORES SE ENCUENTRA EN SU SEGUNDO CICLO, SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES QUE PAGARON SUS CUOTAS SIEMPRE A TIEMPO, LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO EN SU MAYORIA SON MADRES SOLTERAS POR ESO EL NOMBRE DE HERIDAS DE AMORES YA QUE PASARON MOMENTOS DIFICILES SENTIMENTALMENTE, LAS ACTIVIDADES DE LAS SEÑORAS ESTAN ENTRE LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS, VENTA DE COMIDA, VENTA DE F.. LAS REUNIONES SE LLEVAN A CABO EN LA CASA DE LA PRESIDENTA. LA SRA BALBINA , LOS DÍAS LUNES A LAS 14:00, LA SRA BALBINA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE EDREDONES Y SABANAS Y EN ESTA TEMPORADA DE INVIERNO DEJA ROPA A CREDITO PARA DESPUES IR COBRANDO SEMANALMENTE O QUINCENAL YA QUE POR FRIO QUE ESTA HACIENDO TIENE YA MUCHOS PEDIDOS, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE ESTA CON ALGUN PRODUCTO NOVEDOSO SEGUN A LA TEMPORADA, EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA.

LA SRA LUISA  ES NUEVA EN EL GRUPO ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE F. QUE TRAE DESDE EL MUNICIPIO DE EL TORNO Y LAS ENTEGA A LOS CEMENTERIOS DE LA VILLA, ELLA TIENE DOS HIJOS MAYORES PERO A SU CARGO SE ENCUENTRAN DOS NIETOS PORQUE SUS PADRES TRABAJAN EN EL CAMPO Y ELLA SE ENCARGA DE CUIDARLOS TODOS DIAS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA F. POR CANTIDAD YA QUE TIENE MUCHOS PEDIDOS. 

LA SEÑORA FABIOLA  ES UNA SOCIA FUNDADORA QUE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN SU CASA, TODOS LOS DIAS EN LA NOCHE ELLA SACA A VENDER LA COMIDA QUE PREPARA ADEMAS DE LAS GASEOSAS Y RERESCOS TRADICIONALES QUE PREPARA. TODAS ELLAS SON SOCIAS EJEMPLARES QUE AYUDAN A LA ECONOMIA DE SU HOGAR. TODAS PIENSAN INVERTIR EL CREDITO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA AGRANDAR SUS NEGOCIOS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDR Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The community bank Heridas de Amores is in its second cycle. They are responsible people who have always made their payments on time. The bank's members are mainly single mothers and that is why they called the group "Heridas de Amores" (Hurt by Love), since they all went through bad times emotionally. The women's activities range from selling cosmetics and food, to selling flowers. They have the meetings at the president's house, at Balbina's, Mondays at 2:00 p.m. Balbina sells comforters and sheets and during the winter season she sells clothing on credit and collects weekly or bi-weekly. During the cold weather, she has a lot of orders. She is a very hardworking person and she always has a new product according to the season. She will use the money from the loan to purchase merchandise. Luisa is new to the group. She sells flowers that she brings from the town of El Torno and delivers them to cemeteries in town. She has two older children, but she is raising two grandchildren because their parents work in the fields and she takes care of them every day. She will buy flowers in large quantities with the money from the loan since she has a lot of orders. Fabiola is a founding member who sells food from her house. Every evening she sells the food that she prepares in her home, as well as sodas and tradition drinks that she makes. All of the members are good role models who help with the economies of their homes. All of them are planning on investing the loan in purchasing merchandise for their businesses. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in them with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother who also takes care of additional family members. All her children go to school.  Annet sells cassava and sweet potatoes in Bwaise market. She has been doing this job for a long time. Besides this vending, she has also been selling cooked food in the same market and at the same stall. Annet is also getting some income from motorcycle (boda boda) hiring. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of cassava and sweet potatoes. She pays market dues of 20,000/= per month and her major customers are mainly people who own hotels and nearby homes. Annet works six days a week. She doesn’t pay transport costs because she buys from her place of work. Annet’s business aspirations include starting to go  directly to farmers and also owning a delivery van. She joined MCDT because it was charging low interest compared to other nearby MFIs. Maria has access to electricity and piped water. Her expenses include rent for her home, school fees, food and market dues.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cassava and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Day Break Mouth Open Group

texts.en:
Mary M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Day Break Mouth Open. She is 34 years-old and married with four children who range from 4 to 20 years old. She also cares for four siblings.  Mary is a high school graduate but could not continue her education to college.

For eight years , Mary has been selling general goods such as soap, candles, and biscuits at the Du-Port road junction market in Paynesville, Liberia.  Mary sells quality products that are desired by customers in order to keep them returning.  Her goal and dream is to expand to a store and improve the living condition of her family.

She plan to use her 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to purchase more biscuits, soap, and candles.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more biscuits, soap, and candles.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata S. sells clothing and cosmetics for both men and women in a rented shop. She has two years experience in business and she is also a student in a polytechnic college. She is married to a businessman and has four dependents. 

She is hardworking and dedicated to her business and she needs a loan to buy more men's and women's clothing and cosmetics. She hope to use the proceeds from the loan to educate her dependents and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: El Vallecito Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LUZ ESTHER, TIENE 58 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE 4 HIJOS YA ADULTOS, ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "EL VALLECITO", JUNTO CON 9 PERSONAS MAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. LA SRA. LUZ ESTHER FUÉ ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. LUZ ESTHER, INICIÓ HACE CUATRO AÑOS SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. CALZADO, AL INICIÓ EMPEZÓ D. FORMA AMBULATORIA, Y OFRECIENDO D. CASA EN CASA A SUS AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS, AL VER QUE SU NEGOCIO CRECÍA Y QUE TENÍA MAS CLIENTES E INGRESOS SE ANIMÓA A ALQUILAR UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO.
CON SU TRABAJAO A CONSEGUIDO ARREGLAR SU CASA, TENER ESTABILIDAD E INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA.
SU PROXIMA META SERÍA TENER UN LOCAL PROPIO, CON MUCHO MERCADERÍA EN CALZADO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPRAR CALZADO D. PREFERENCIA PARA DAMAS, PARA APROVECHAR LA CAMPAÑA POR EL DÍA D. LA MADRE.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Esther is 58, and has 4 adult children. She is a member of the group “El Vallecito” along with 9 more residents of the Carabayllo District. Mrs. Luz Esther was elected president of the Board by the members. Four years ago she began her business of selling shoes from house to house to friends and acquaintances. When she saw that her business was growing and she had more customers and earnings, she decided to rent a stand in the market. With her business she was able to fix up her house, and to have economic independence and stability. Her next goal is to have her own stand, with a lot of inventory of shoes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, particularly women’s shoes, for the sales for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes for sales for Mother's Day

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed Z.

texts.en:
Mohamed Z. T. owns a shop that is located along Soldier Street, a central business area in Makeni.

He started his business from funds he secured from his brother-in-law to sell tobacco.  He spent about twenty years selling tobacco and then decided to change his business and now sells building materials. He is married to a trader and has five children. He spends his entire time in the business. He has a good credit history in group loans in ARD. He needs a loan to buy building materials and hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to educate his secondary school kids to university level and build a house.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma B. trades in palm oil and gari (ginger product). She is hardworking and dedicated to her business, and her store is located along the main Market Road.  She started in fish trading and later switched to her present business (palm oil and gari). She has 10 years of experience in business. She is married to a Field Officer and they have 2 children. She needs the loan to buy palm oil and gari from neighbouring villages and hopes to use the proceeds to educate her kids and build a house.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and gari to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 48 años y es natural de Calca.  Ella es profesora en el colegio “Natividad de Huallabamba”, ya son 8 años que trabaja en el colegio. Su actividad económica complementaria es la producción de gaseosas llamada  “Sumac Kola”.  Ella nos cuenta que antes tenía una fábrica de gaseosas  “Kola Sol” en la ciudad de Moquegua. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos y materiales como por ejemplo frutas naturales, botellas y chapas. El anhelo de la socia es producción agua natural y frugos en mayor  cantidad. (Frugos es la bebida de jugo natural).                

Cristina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa's VALLE SAGRADO community bank. She is 48 years old and a native of Calca. She has worked as a teacher at the Natividad de Huallabamba school for 8 years now. Her business is producing a bottled drink called Sumac Kola. She tells us that she used to own a Kola Sol soft drink factory in the city of Moquegua. She needs the loan to buy supplies and materials such as fruit, bottles and bottle caps. Her goal is to produce larger volumes of bottled water and "frugos". (Frugos is a natural fruit drink.) Cristina is grateful for the opportunity that this kind of lending offers and she is committed to repaying the loan in the scheduled time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for bottled drink business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed S. is a trader who sells along one of the main business streets in Makeni. He started with sales of cigarettes and later moved to plastic slippers.

He is married to a trader and they have four children who all attend school. He has 30 years of business experience and needs a loan to buy plastic slippers from the neighbouring country of Guinea.

He hopes to use the proceeds to educate his children and build on to his house.

loans.use: To purchase plastic slippers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos, pues ha sido muy importante para ella. Sus inicios se dieron hace mas de 30 años por lo que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya que tiene que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia ella busca la forma de obtener un medio de vida ya que el arduo trabajo que realiza es admirable. Sueña con realizar mejoras para su vivienda, ya que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será invertido en la compra de maíz pues así le resulta mas favorable.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is a long-time client who has been working with Fundación León 2000 because she is always concerned about improving her income. Therefore, this relationship is very important to her. She started selling tortillas more than 30 years ago as a means of generating an income for her family.

Her desire to find ways to make a living and work hard is admirable. Maria Antonia dreams of making improvements to her home because she wants to provide her family with better living conditions. The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to buy corn since prices right now are favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 35 años, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, el vive con su  pareja Aminda de 25 años y sus hijas Brigitte de 6 años y Yun Su de 2 años, en su casa propia. Todo comenzó cuando le ofrecieron a Ricardo un trabajo como panadero, de esa manera aprendió todos lo secretos de este oficio, durando casi 15 años realizando esta labor. Disfruta mucho lo que hace, empezando su día desde muy temprano para dedicarse a la preparación de panes, con la experiencia que tiene, le ha sido mucho más fácil lograr su trabajo, agregando algunos tips y secretos culinarios. Actualmente sus ventas son buenas y su negocio muy concurrido,  pues Ricardo tiene muy buena fama en la zona en la que vive. Lo que más anhela es incursionar en otra actividad, que es la venta de ropa, por lo que necesitará del apoyo de su padre para que se encargue de esta labor, ya que eso lo ayudará a tener el tiempo ocupado y distraerse y evitar mantenerse solo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunas prendas para iniciarse en el negocio de la venta de ropa y también en algunos ingredientes para continuar elaborando pan.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 35 years old and has always been known as a hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own home with his partner Aminda (age 25) and their two daughters Brigitte (age 6) and Yun Su (age 2). It all started when Ricardo was offered a job as a baker. For the past 15 years, he has learned all the secrets about this craft. He enjoys his work and begins every day early in order to prepare bread. His work has become easier with experience and he has gained a great reputation in the area where he lives. What Ricardo wants most is to start another business selling clothing. He plans to obtain the help of his father since putting him charge of the work will help him stay busy and keep his mind off being alone.

This is his third loan with MFP. Ricardo promises to make all of his payments on time. The loan he requested will be used to purchase a few articles of clothing to start his new business as well as ingredients for making bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread & clothing to start a new business

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 73  años y tiene tres hijos. Su principal actividad económica  es vender colchones los días domingos en el mercado modelo de Calca y su actividad económica complementaria es vender comestibles en su domicilio. Ya son tres años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. El requiere el crédito para comprar colchones. El nos cuenta que su negocio bajo porque  no hay clientes debido a que el puente de la ciudad de Pisaq se cayó por causa del aumento el caudal del rio Vilcanota
   
Apolinar  se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Apolinar is a member of the “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley) Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is 73 years old and has three children. His main business activity is selling mattresses every Sunday at the standard market in Calca. He has another business selling food from his house. Apolinar has been in this business for three years and is doing very well. He needs a loan to buy more mattresses. At the moment, he says business is slow because there are no customers since the bridge in the city of Pisaq collapsed due to overflow from the Vilcanota River.

Apolinar is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mattresses

loans.name: Dulce Honestidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dulce Honestidad está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Teresa Yesenia  García A. de 29 años quien desde hace dos años empezó ofertando los productos de la marca Avon, reconocida en Nicaragua por sus ventas vía catalogo. 
Este ha ido aumentando poco a poco gran parte de esto es debido a los prestamos y a la capacitación que les brido Adim donde aprendieron a invertir y tener una mejor atención al cliente y posibles socias. Ella con el crédito compra varios encargos que tiene en cosméticos y perfumes de dicha marca.
Sus compañeros de grupo son Verónica Lorena A. Martínez quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos vía catalogo y ropa intima de diferentes marcas y Wilfredo A. C. es propietario de una zapatería.  Ellos invertirán el crédito en mercadería para sus negocios y así aumentarlos.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Honestidad” (Sweet Honesty) Group consists of three strong, hardworking, and enterprising individuals. The group coordinator is a young woman named Teresa Yesenia García A. who is 29 years of age. She started a business two years ago offering Avon products, which are well-known in Nicaragua, through catalog sales. Her business has been increasing gradually partly due to the loans and training classes that ADIM has provided. She learned how to invest and provide better service to her customers and potential members. Teresa will use her loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes to fulfill various orders.

Her fellow group members are Verónica Lorena A. Martínez, who sells cosmetics through a catalog and intimate apparel of various brands, and Wilfredo A. C., who owns a shoe store. They will invest their loan in merchandise so as to increase their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & perfumes

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CARLOS  ES UN CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO DOCE CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION, EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD, EL SE DEDICA A DAR SERVICIO DE AMPLIFICACION EL TRABAJA EN  DIFERENTES ZONAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO Y LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, TODAS SU MAQUINAS AMPLICADORAS LAS GUARDA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, SU PROPAGANDA LA REALIZA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, SU TRABAJO COMIENZA NORMALMENTE LOS FINES DE SEMANA DESDE EL DIA JUEVES HASTA EL DIA DOMINGO, SU AMPLICADORES VAN A FIESTAS DE MATRIMINIO, BAUTIZOS Y FIESTAS DE COLEGIOS, EL TRABAJO DEL SEÑOR CARLOS Q. ES UN POCO SACRIFICADO PORQUE EL TIENE QUE AMANECERSE PARA RECOGER SUS AMPLIFICADORES, EL TIENE TRES HIJOS  ELLOS ESTAN ESTUDIANDO PERO LOS FINES DE SEMANA LE AYUDAN A SU PADRE, LA ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE COLCHONES QUE LOS VENDE EN LA ZONA 16 DE JULIO, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE EQUIPOS DE SONIDO EL CLIENTE YA TRABAJO VARIAS SECUENCIAS CON LA INSTITUCION Y EL CREDITO  QUE SACO EN LA INSTITUCION LO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE AMPLIFICADORES PARA ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE SONIDO PARA BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A LOS CLIENTES. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carlos is a client who has had 12 loans with the institution. He demonstrated responsibility with the previous loans. He provides amplification service. He works in different areas of the city of El Alto and the city of La Paz. He keeps all of his amplification machines in his own home. He does his advertising in his own home. His work normally starts on the week-ends from Thursday through Sunday. His amplifiers go to weddings, baptisms, and school parties. The work Carlos Q. does is a bit self-sacrificing because he has to get up at dawn to gather his amplifiers. He has three children, and they go to school. But, on the week-ends they help their father. His wife makes mattresses, and she sells them in the 16 de Julio zone. The loan is to buy sound equipment. The client has already worked with the institution in various cycles. He will use this loan from the institution to buy amplifiers to improve the quality of sound. That way he will provide his customers with better service. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aerial sound equipment and fabric

loans.name: Tarr Group

texts.en:
Esther B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called T. Group. She is 55 years old, married, and has nine children. Esther was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For 27 years, Esther has been selling cosmetics at the Old Road Market, which is near Monrovia. She says that she talks to her customers in a friendly manner, which keeps them returning.

Esther plans to use her 14,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 74,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetics. Her dream is to open a shop.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ANASTACIA LIDIA, TIENE 37 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA HIJA, QUE ES LA RAZON DE TODO SUS ESFUERZOS Y SACRIFICIOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "FORTALEZA" JUNTO CON 9 PERSONAS MÁS, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO Y QUE LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. ANASTACIA LIDIA, HACE SEIS AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN SU DOMICILIO, TUVO QUE INGENIARSE UN TRABAJO QUE PUDIERA DESEMPEÑAR EN SU DOMICILIO Y ASÍ PODER TENER CERCA A SU HIJA PARA CUIDARLA.
CON SU TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO HA PODIDO MANTENER A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, ASUMIR GASTOS DE LA CASA Y COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS, NECESARIOS EN EL HOGAR.
SU PROXIMA META, SERÍA INSTALAR UN MINIMARKET.
CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO PAGARÁ ALGUNAS DEUDAS Y EL RESTO LO INVERTIRÁ.
texts.en:
Anastacia Lidia is 37 years old, single, and has a small daughter who is the reason for all of her efforts and sacrifice. She is part of the group "Fortaleza," along with 9 other people who live in the Carabayllo district. They chose her to be the president of the board of directors of the group. Anastacia Lidia has sold groceries from her home for 6 years. She had to devise a job for herself that she could perform in her home, so that she could stay close to her daughter to care for her. With her work and effort, she has been able to support her small daughter and assume the household expenses and buy the appliances needed for the home. Her next goal would be to establish a mini-market. With the loan requested she will pay off some debts, and she will invest the rest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FELISA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE UNA HIJA YA MAYOR, TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 23 AÑOS EN LO QUE ES LA VENTA DE ROPA, ELLA INICIALMENTE COMENZO EN UN PUESTO BASATANTE REDUCIDO EN LA PUERTA DEL QUE AHORA ES SU DOMICILIO. YA LUEGO DE SER MADRE SOLTERA  ELLA TENIA LA NECESIDAD DE GENERAR  ALGUN TIPO DE INGRESO NO TENIA NINGUNA ACTIVIDAD Y UNA DE SUS VECINAS LE DIO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE VENDER ROPA SE HIZO DE CAPITAL Y COMPRO MERCADERIA EMPEZO DE POCO PERO AHORA YA TIENE UNA TIENDA DONDE OFRECE SUS PRODUCTOS, FUE AHI DONDE LE NACIO LA POSIBILIDAD DE REALIZAR ESTE NEGOCIO, AHORA ELLA YA QUIERE ABRIR OTRA TIENDA DE ROPA DONDE SE ENCARGUE DE LA VENTA SU  HIJA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA ABRIR UNA NUEVA TIENDA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Felisa is a single mother who has a grown daughter. She has 23 years of experience selling clothing. She started out selling through a very small post at the door of what is now her home. Then, upon becoming a single mother, she needed to generate income and she didn't have any means to do so. One of her neighbors gave her the opportunity to sell clothing. She accumulated capital, and gradually bought merchandise. Now she has a store where she offers her products. It was there that she came up with the idea of this business. Now she wants to open another clothing store where her daughter will be in charge of sales. With the money from this loan, she will buy merchandise to open a new store. She is very grateful to Empreder and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
Leda F. V., Carla Patricia V. y Julieta del Socorro L. Cano tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas que conforman al grupo Antonela. Ellas son provenientes del reparto Martin Castellon de Nindiri.
Lea F. Judit V. desde siete años se dedica al comercio de prendas en oro laminado y oro con lo cual mantiene a su familia que consta de tres hijos entre 6, 16 y 19 años y su pequeña nieta que pronto nacerá. Esta señora de 38 años es  la coordinadora del grupo y con el préstamo desea mejorar su negocio con la compra de mercadería.
Las otras integrantes del grupo Karla Patricia Valberde de 29 años de edad la cual se dedica al comercio de perfumes cosméticos y ropa y  Julieta del Socorro L. Cano quien desde los 19 años se dedica al estilismo y belleza servicio que oferta a domicilio desde hace 30 años. Ellas con el préstamo piensan adquirir mercadería y productos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lea F. V., Karla Patricia V., and Julieta del Socorro L. Cano are three strong, hardworking, and enterprising women who make up the Antonela Group. They are from the subdivision of Martin Castellon de Nindiri.

Lea F. Judith V. has been selling gold and gold laminate jewelry for seven years in order to support her family that consists of her three children (ages 19, 16, and 6). She also has a newborn granddaughter. Lea is 38 years old and serves as the group coordinator. With her loan, she will improve her business by acquiring merchandise.

The other group members are Karla Patricia V. (age 29) who sells perfumes, cosmetics, and clothing; and Julieta del Socorro L. Cano who has worked as a stylist since she was 19 and has been providing beauty services from her home for 30 years. They will use their loans to acquire merchandise and products to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold & gold laminate jewelry

loans.name: Dolores Alejandra

texts.es: Doña Dolores Alejandra tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Ella se dedica al negocio a la compra de mercadería en general, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante pues inicio hace 30 años, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia ella atiende a sus  clientes muy amable es así que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa, bolsos, calzado y cosméticos.  Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Doña Dolores Alejandra is 48 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She manages a business selling general merchandise as a street vendor. Dolores started this business 30 years ago and has always been concerned about improving her family’s income. She attends to her customers in a friendly manner that helps put them at ease. Dolores will invest her loan in the purchase of clothing, purses, shoes, and cosmetics. Her goal has always been to have an established business where she can sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, purses, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Santa Cecilia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Cecilia debe su nombre a L. patrona D. los músicos “Santa Cecilia” y porque el grupo es muy alegre, les encanta L. música. Así es L. gente del poblado Tapotzingo, en Nacajuca. Cuatro señoras conforman el grupo: Doña María DomitiL. es L. representante del grupo, elL. venD. zapatos por catálogo, doña Sara venD. antojitos, doña María Concepción hace artesanía (petates) y doña María del Rosario tiene una tiendita D. abarrotes.

Me gusta el trabajo D. L. artesanía, nos dice doña Concha, como L. conocen en L. comunidad, tiene 4 hijos, uno D. ellos es su ayudante en L. elaboración D. sus artesanías (aparece en L. foto tejiendo) y su esposo es campesino. L. señora D. dedica a L. elaboración  D. petates desD. hace aproximadamente 20 años, también  hace bolsas y abanicos. ElL. aprendió a elaborarlas  en un curso que se llevó a cabo en su casa por parte del gobierno. El crédito que pidió es para comprar más materiales como cañitas, hilera, pintura, cintas y flor D. pantano (lirio). Quiere conservar las tradiciones del pueblo.Vender directamente sus productos y evitar intermediarios.

El grupo es muy unido porque se conocen desD. que nacieron y se han ayudado, esperan poder agradecer en persona a KIVA por considerarlos y hacer que su trabajo sea más  reconocido en todo el mundo.
texts.en:
The Santa Cecilia Group is named after St. Cecilia, the patron saint of music, since they are a cheerful group that enjoys music. The group consists of four women from the village of Tapotzingo in Nacajuca. Doña María DomitiL. is the group representative and sells shoes through a catalog. Doña Sara sells snacks. Doña María Concepción sells “petates” (handwoven bedrolls). Doña María del Rosario manages a grocery store.

“I enjoy making things by hand,” says María Concepción, who is known as “Doña Concha” within the community. She has four children, one of whom helps with making the bedrolls (as shown in the photograph). Her husband is a farmer. Doña Concha has been making bedrolls for approximately 20 years, as well as purses and fans. She learned this craft after taking a course at home that was being offered by the government. The loan she requested will be used to purchase more materials such as straw, string, paint, ribbons, and marsh lilies. By making these products, she hopes to preserve the traditions of her town. She sells her products directly to the public in order to avoid middlemen.

This group is very close and the members have known each other since birth. They help one another and wish they could thank Kiva in person for considering them and providing recognition of their work to the rest of the world.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making handwoven bedrolls

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou N. habite à Yoff Ngaparou. Elle est âgée de 47 ans et évolue dans le commerce de diverses marchandises comme les chaussures, les tissus, etc. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce secteur. Elle a choisi cette activité  a cause de son aspect lucratif car son principal objectif est la réalisation de profits pour satisfaire ses besoins. C’est dans le but d’avoir des revenus supplémentaires pour prendre en charge la scolarité des enfants qu’elle projette de construire une chambre et de la mettre en location. Son soucis  est d’améliorer la situation scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou N. lives in the Ngaparou borough of Yoff. She is 47 years old and is engaged in trading a variety of merchandise such as shoe wear, clothing fabric, etc. She has an accumulated five years’ experience in this domain, which she chose because of its lucrative aspects. Her main objective is to make profits to satisfy her needs. She wants to build a room she can rent out, which will provide her with additional income to cover her children’s tuition costs. Her main concern is to improve the children’s schooling situation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building a room for rent

loans.name: Roselmira

texts.es: Roselmira tiene 39 años, ella vive con su pareja Aquiles de 40 años, quien es panadero y sus hijos Pierina de 12 años, Brayan de 11 años, Kenedy de 7 años y Yamira de 4 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 meses se dedica en la venta de muñecos de peluches, por lo que va a la ciudad a comprarlos al por mayor, para luego ser vendidos a sus clientes y vecinos que le gustan estos productos, la gran mayoría de las veces son ofrecidos de forma ambulatoria, en donde logra mayor aceptación de sus compradores. Con este trabajo Roselmira se siente muy contenta, ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo libre para dedicarse a sus hijos. Las ventas que logra hacer son muy buenas, es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo y convertir su negocio en un gran bazar, donde pueda exhibir mejor su mercadería, evitando el cansancio durante el día cuando va caminando porla ciudad para ofrecer sus productos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará peluches para aumentar sus ventas en estas próximas festividades por el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Roselmira is 39 years old and has her own home. She lives with her partner Aquiles (age 40), who is a baker, and their children: Pierina (age 12), Brayan (age 11), Kenedy (age 7), and Yamira (age 4).

For more than six months, Roselmira has been selling stuffed toys. She travels to the city to buy her products in bulk and then sells them to customers and neighbors who enjoy this type of merchandise. Most of her sales are made as a street vendor, which gives her great recognition among her buyers. Roselmira is very happy with her work because it provides her enough free time to dedicate to her children. Her sales have gone very well, so she wants to continue investing in her business and convert it into a large bazaar where she can display more merchandise. She avoids getting fatigued during the day by walking through the city as she offers her products.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Roselmira promises to complete all of her payments on time. The loan she requested will be used to buy stuffed toys so that she can increase her sales for the upcoming Mother’s Day holiday.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stuffed toys

loans.name: Xiomara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Xiomara está conformado por Rosa Esther Manas D., Magdalena C. M. y Maribel del Carmen Silva tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas las cuales se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras. La coordinadora es la señora Menas Días quien desde hace siete años se dedica al comercio de perecederos en el mercado de Masaya donde le ayuda su hijo menor de 19 años.

Ellas invertiran el préstamo en la compra de cosechas en frutas y verduras de temporada.
texts.en:
The Xiomara Group consists of Rosa Esther M. D., Magdalena C. M., and Maribel del Carmen Silva. These three strong, hardworking women engage in selling fruits and vegetables. Sra. Rosa Esther is the group coordinator and has seven years of experience selling perishables at the market in Masaya with the help of her 19 year old son.

They will invest the loan in the purchase of harvested fruits and vegetables that are in season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria tiene la edad de 48 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante, además que las personas ya conocen que ella se dedica a esa actividad por eso le encargan una variedad de ropa. Además, así podrá asegurar a su hijos estudios universitarios, ya que ella no pudo finalizar sus estudios es por eso que quiere proporcionarle estos ingresos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria is 48 years old and has one child who is still in her care. She has been selling clothes as a traveling merchant for more than three years. People know that she offers a variety of clothing. In addition, she wants to secure a college education for her children since she was not able to do the same for herself. This is why she earns an income. Ana Maria will invest her loan in the purchase of trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses. She dreams of making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more clothing

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
El señor José es padre de familia de dos hijos, vive en una comarca jocote dulce, junto con su esposa, a mucho esfuerzo hizo su casa de concreto, trabaja como supervisor móvil, actualmente, ya que anteriormente por falta de desempleo trabajo de albañil, haciendo pozos, y cualquier trabajo que tuviera a su alcance para cubrir las necesidades de alimentación.
 El zinc de su casa esta en mal estado tiene mucho hoyos en donde se le pasa el agua en temporada de  invierno. No ha logrado cambiarlo por que no ha tenido el dinero en efectivo es por eso que con este financiamiento comprara zinc, perlinez, golosos y poder cambiar el techo, el cual se le hace mas favorable por esta vía. Sus planes es seguir mejorando su casa para dar a su familia un techo digno.
texts.en:
José is a family man, father of two and lives in an area that grows cauliflower. Together with his wife, and a lot of effort, he built a concrete house. Presently he works as a mobile supervisor and previously, due to lack of work, as a construction worker making wells or any type of work that would allow him to provide food for his family. The tin zinc roof on his house is in poor condition has a lot of holes where water comes in during the winter. He has not been able to repair it because he has not had the money. This is why the loan would be used to buy tin zinc, solder and corrugated roofing materials to make a better roof this way. His plans are to improve the home by giving his family a decent roof.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tin zinc, solder and corrugated roofing materials to change the roof on his house

loans.name: Esther Luzmila

texts.es: Cliente recurrente que viene cancelando en forma puntual su credito, solicita una ampliacion del mismo para gastos persoanles, cliente que no cuenta con deuda alguna, esta firmando con su madre quien tambien fue clienta  de la CRAC, se propone el credito por contar con buen comportamiento crediticio.
texts.en:
This is a previous client who repaid her loan punctually. She is applying for another similar loan for personal expenses. The client does not have other debt. She is signing with her mother who has also been a client of CRAL. She is eligible for the loan because she has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ROSA OFELIA, TIENE 63 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA, SU PESPOSO LA APOYA EN TODOS LOS RETOS QUE ELLA SE PROPONGA, TIENEN CUATRO HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD.ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "SANTA ROSA DE HUAQUILLAY", INTEGRADO POR NUEVE PERSONAS, SUS VECINAS, ELLAS SON RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
HACE NUEVE AÑOS, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, INICIÓ COMO AMBULANTE CON POCOS PRODUCTOS, IVA VISITANDO DE CASA EN CASA, LUEGO SE ANIMÓ A CRECER Y PAGAR EL ALQUILER DE UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO DE SU ZONA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, AUMENTAR SU STOCK Y ASUMIR SUS GASTOS PERSONALES.
SU PROXIMA META SERÁ CONSEGUIR SU PROPIO LOCAL.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPRAR MÁS MERCADERÍA.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Ofelia, age 63, is married. Her husband supports her in all the challenges she faces. They have four grown children.

She is a member of the Santa Rosa de Huaquillay group, which consists of 9 people who are her neighbors. They are residents of the Comas district.

For nine years, Sra. Rosa has been involved with the sale of beauty products. She began selling a few products on an itinerant basis, going from house to house. Later, she got the courage to enlarge her business and paid to rent a stall in the market in her area. Her work has succeeded in making her business grow. She has added to her stock and met her personal expenses.

Her next goal is to get her own shop. The loan applied for will be used for the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor es un joven emprendedor de 26 años, casado y juntos viven solos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja en su panadería, por lo que agradece el haber encontrado este trabajo, en donde aprendió todos los secretos para elaborar pan. Durante estos años de experiencia le han valido a Víctor ser muy conocido y valorado su trabajo, pues nadie prepara el pan como él, por todo esto, se siente muy contento y motivado para seguir adelante y más por familia. Su mayor anhelo es instalar un negocio en el que Víctor y su esposa puedan trabajar juntos, como una tienda de comestibles o un bazar, pero aún no lo tienen definido. Ellos esperan progresar poco a poco y así preparar el hogar para sus futuros hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus panes y además hacer algunos arreglos en la infraestructura de su hogar y acondicionar su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is a 26-year-old entrepreneur. He and his wife live alone in their own home. For more than 10 years, Victor has been working in a bakery. He’s grateful for his job, which has allowed him to learn all the secrets to bread-making. Victor’s many years of experience have earned him plenty of customer appreciation-- no one bakes it like Victor! This praise is exactly what he needs to keep him working hard and supporting his family. Victor wants to set up a storefront, where he and his wife can work together selling groceries or other products. At this point, though, it’s still just a dream. Little by little, they are hoping to prepare their home for any future children. This is Victor’s third loan with MFP, and he has promised to make all his payments on time. Victor plans to buy ingredients for making bread, make a few repairs to his home, and put a little toward his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making bread; completing home repairs.

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Madame Mbene S. habite a Yoff Mbenguene. Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2009. Elle a 43 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 30 ans. Elle exerce l’activité de vente de poissons depuis plus de 20 ans car elle ne veut pas rester inactive. Madame S. sollicite ce prêt pour accroitre son fond de roulement dans le but de  satisfaire les commandes des clients qui la sollicitent de plus en plus. Son objectif est de maximiser ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider la famille aussi bien sur le plan social, éducatif mais surtout nutritionnel
texts.en:
Mrs. Mbene S. lives in Yoff Mbenguene. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC (a Sénégalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) savings bank since September 2009. She is 43 years old, married and mother to six children, whose ages vary between four and 30 years old. She has been selling fish for more than 20 years, because she does not want to remain idle. Mrs. S. is requesting this loan in order to increase her working capital so that she can satisfy the orders of customers who are demanding more and more from her. Her objective is to maximise profits in order to be able to help her family, above all with food but also with social and school expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of working capital

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luís tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su madre. El 
se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte ya dedicándose a esta actividad hace 4 
años. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio, brindándole buen servicio y 
seguridad, en la actualidad también se esta dedicando a la comercialización de pecana, 
el compra por huertas y la cosecha, el sueño de Luís es tener mayores ingresos 
y así poder seguir ayudando a su madre a la construcción de su vivienda, antes de 
poder iniciar su familia, solicita el crédito para la compra de una huerta de pecana 
de cerca de 10 plantas.
texts.en:
Luis is 40 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in his mother's house. He has been providing transportation services for 4 years. He has a lot of experience doing this; he provides good service and security. Currently he also sells pecans, which he buys from the orchards during the harvest. Luis dreams of having a better income. This way he could continue helping his mother with the construction of her house before starting his own family. He requests a loan to buy a pecan orchard nearby with 10 plants.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a pecan orchard

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Progreso está integrado por Danelia del Socorro O., Teresa de Jesús C. S. y Roberto Carlos C. S. quienes se dedican a la agruicultura trabajo arduo que aprendieron desde muy jovenes. 

La coordinadora del grupo es  Danelia O. quien desde hace 12 años trabaja la tierra con el apoyo de sus esposo y sus hijos mayores de 21, 19, 17, 15 y 13 años. Está señora de 36 años con el préstamo invertira en la siembra con la compra de abono, podada y semillas para mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
The 'El Progreso' group is made up of Danelia del Socorro O., Teresa de Jesús C. S. and Roberto Carlos C. S., all of whom have worked arduously in agriculture from a very young age. The coordinator of the group is Danelia O., 36, who has worked the land for 12 years with the support of her husband and her grown up children who are 21, 19, 17, 15 and 13 years of age. She will use her loan to purchase fertiliser, pruning shears and seeds to improve her production when it comes time to sow.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertiliser, seeds and pruning shears

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Tiene 43 años de edad es separado tiene una hija de 10 años de edad ella se encuentra viviendo en Lima juntamente con su madre. El Sr. Luis vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el AA.HH el Juncal B-04 casa de material noble de dos pisos. El  actualmente cuenta con el ingreso del servcio de transporte en vehiculo propio recientemente adquirido, el se inicio como chofer el viene trabajndo hace 14 años, asi pudo juntar su dinero para adquirir su vehiculo propio.El Sr. Luis tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener una cas propia, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mantenimiento de su vehiculo.El Sr. Luis Tiene 43 años de edad es separado tiene una hija de 10 años de edad ella se encuentra viviendo en Lima juntamente con su madre. El Sr. Luis vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el AA.HH el Juncal B-04 casa de material noble de dos pisos. El  actualmente cuenta con el ingreso del servcio de transporte en vehiculo propio recientemente adquirido, el se inicio como chofer el viene trabajndo hace 14 años, asi pudo juntar su dinero para adquirir su vehiculo propio.El Sr. Luis tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener una cas propia, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Luis, 43, is separated and has a 10-year-old daugther who lives in Lima with her mother. Luis lives in his parents’ house which is in El Juncal; it’s a two-story house made of substantial materials. He recently acquired a vehicle with which he provides public transportation services. He has worked as a driver for 14 years and was able to save up enough to buy his own vehicle. Luis has many dreams and objectives one of which is to own his own home. He will use the requested funds for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Carmen Laura

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  Z. es socia del Bankito Progresista, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  considerada por los ecuatorianos como la ciudad más bella del país. Una de las primeras cosas que remarcará cuando entre en la ciudad es su fabulosa línea de horizonte marcada por las cúpulas radiantes de sus iglesias; sus calles empedradas, sus ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica atractivos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad,  es madre soltera de seis hijos que se encuentran  de 32, 26, 24, 22, 21, 16 años, vive con su ultima hija de 16 años que estudia en un colegio de la localidad y una de sus hijas casadas con quien comparte no solo la casa sino también los gastos que se incurren en ella, nos manifiesta que la casa es arrendada.

Carmen tiene un pequeño local adecuado en su misma casa donde vende comida desde hace doce años, comenzó por iniciativa propia y por salir  adelante con su familia, su jordana se inicia muy temprano para preparar sus platos y alistar todo para la hora que llegan sus clientes, y finaliza cuando ha terminado todo lo que prepara para la venta.

 Anteriormente ya era socia del banco pero se retiró por problemas de enfermedad y hace un año  que reingreso, con su nuevo crédito va a  comprar  arroz,  azúcar, sal, aceite, condimentos y otros productos necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.

Tiene como meta  ver a sus hijos progresar día a día junto a sus familias.
texts.en:
Carmen Z. is a a member of the 'Bankito Progresista' (Progressive Bank), and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which Equatorians consider to be the most beautiful city in the country. One of the first things you notice when you enter the city is its wonderful skyline, marked by radiant church domes; its cobbled streets, serpent-like rivers, attractive iron-work balconies and beautiful gardens, all of which form part of the lovely atmosphere of this historic city whose sites of interest attract tourists from Equador and abroad. Carmen is a 54 year old single mother of six children, who are 32, 26, 24, 22, 21 and 16 years of age. She lives in a rented house with her 16 year old daughter, who studies at a local secondary school, and with one of her married daughters who shares not only the house but also the bills. Carmen runs a small shop from her own house where she has been selling food for 12 years. She started the shop out of her own initiative so she could get her family ahead. Her day begins very early to prepare the meals and get everything ready for her customers, and finishes when everything she has made has been sold. She had been a member of Bankito Progresista for some time but she had to pull out due to illness. She has since returned a year ago and with the loan that she is applying for she hopes to buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, condiments and other necessary products for her meals. Her goal is to see her children and their families get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, salt, oil and condiments

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella ha sacrificado mucho para mejorar sus ingresos y mantener a sus 4 hijos que están a su cargo, lo que le resulta mucho más difícil es el tiempo que tiene disponible para dedicárselo a sus hijos, ya que algunas veces tiene que estar atendiendo a sus clientes. Esto no la desanima a seguir adelante, pues así podrá esforzarse más para mejorar cada día. Ella solicita este financiamiento para golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Su deseo es mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 44 years old and manages a store. She has been in this business for more than seven years and has made sacrifices to improve her income and support her four dependent children. The most difficult part for her is having enough time available to devote to her children since she is always attending to her customers. This has not discouraged her from moving forward because she is determined to do more to improve each day. Maria Elena is requesting this loan to purchase candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, and basic grains. Her wish is to keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, and basic grains

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Maria Adilia es una mujer emprendedora de 50 años de edad, desde joven aprendió costura en donde ha logrado una experiencia y ha sido una fuente de entrada para apoyar a sus siete hijos que junto con su esposo han trabajado mucho. Su esposo trabaja de albañil un trabajo agotador pero le pagan bien. Hoy en día solo tiene a cargo dos hijos que están cursando estudios, los otros viven independientes. Un tiempo trabajo en cocina ya que solo la costura no le daba, pero el restaurante cerró y siguió con  la costura es un trabajo en donde le permite hacer sus oficios de la casa y ver por su familia.
Con este préstamo comprara tela variada,  botones, bordados, ziper para hacer los vestidos y encargos. Entre sus planes es comprar una maquina eléctrica en donde pueda trabajar con mas rapidez, mejor calidad. Asi como lograr hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Adilia is an enterprising woman who is 50 years old. She learned to sew as a young woman. As she gained experience, Maria’s skill became a source of income with which she could support her seven children. She and her husband have worked very hard. His work as a mason is exhausting, but it pays well. Today, only two of her children live with her since they are currently in school. The others live independently. At one time she worked at a restaurant kitchen when her sewing business did not generate enough income, but the establishment closed down, so she resumed sewing while attending to her household chores and caring for her family.

With this loan, Maria will buy various fabrics, buttons, fringe, and zippers for making dresses to complete her orders. Her plans include buying an electric sewing machine so that she can work faster and produce better quality. She also wants to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, buttons, zippers, and other materials for making dresses

loans.name: Pablo Fernando

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre que lucha día a día por salir adelante, a sus 47 años es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, de 17, 15, 13, 9 y 7 años, trabaja con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 4 años, se dedica  al transporte como moto taxista, desde hace 5 años, se inicio en este negocio por la necesidad que había en su hogar, luego compro una moto con el que trabaja, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprar 2 motos, arreglar la casa de sus padres y comprarse un terreno.
El gran sueño de Pablo, es tener su propia empresa. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su moto. Pablo se encuentra muy agradecido por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablo is a gentleman who struggles day after day to get ahead. He is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children (ages 17, 15, 13, 9, and 7). Pablo has been a client of EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for four years. He has been working as a motorcycle taxi driver for five years. Pablo started in this business so that he could provide for his household needs. Through the efforts of his daily work, he was able to buy two motorcycle taxis, remodel his parents’ house, and acquire a plot of land.

Pablo’s greatest wish is to have his own business. This current loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for his motorcycle taxi. Pablo is very grateful for all the support that has been provided because it has help improve the quality of life for him and his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es: Visitación tiene 44 años, él comparte su vida con su esposa Catalina y su hijo Andy de 10 años,  ya que sus otros hijos ya son independientes. Hace más de 19 años trabaja en el campo de la construcción, en donde ejerce la labor de albañil, por lo que es contratado por sus servicios para realizar techos, paredes, entre otros. En este trabajo lo ayudan sus obreros para realizar las obras que suelen ser muy pesadas y arriesgadas. Visitación es muy solicitado gracias a su gran experiencia en esta actividad, por tal motivo obtiene buenos trabajos. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y mejorar, es por ello que quiere comprar una máquina para cargar ladrillos, ya que eso lo beneficiaría mucho, ahorrándole tiempo y esfuerzo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo siempre ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una máquina para carga ladrillos, con lo que espera optimizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Visitación is 44 years old and shares his life with his wife Catalina and his ten year old son Andy. Their other children already live independently. Visitación has worked in the construction business for more than 19 years as a mason. He is hired to build roofs, walls, and other structures. In this line of work, he has the assistance of his employees whenever the job involves risk or handling heavy objects. Thanks to his wealth of experience, Visitación receives many requests for his services and is able to secure good jobs. His greatest wish is to succeed and improve. For this reason, he wants to buy a machine for carrying bricks. This will be a great benefit since it will help him save time and effort.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Throughout his time as a member, Visitación has always demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his loan payments. The loan he requested will be used to buy a machine for carrying bricks, which he hopes will make him more efficient in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine for carrying bricks

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza del Socorro tiene 67 años, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con financiamientos. La actividad económica de Maritza es la venta de comida y otros. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. El negocio inicio con recursos propios, pues para ella ha sido muy difícil, pues la experiencia que ha tenido hasta los momentos con su negocio ha sido muy gratificante para mejorar su condición la de su familia. Así lograra realizar las compras de frijoles, arroz, aceite, pollo y gaseosas ya que el precio de estos productos está muy caro. Por lo que más desea es mejorar cada día en su negocio y mantenerlo activo.
texts.en:
Maritza del Socorro is 67 years old. This is not her first experience dealing with loans. She has been selling food and other items for more than nine years. Maritza started her business using her own resources. Even though the work can be difficult, she says her business is very rewarding because it has allowed her to improve her family’s condition.

Maritza will use her loan to buy beans, rice, oil, chicken, and sodas since the prices of these items are very inexpensive. What she wants most is to improve her business every day and keep it active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy beans, rice, oil, chicken, and sodas

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos  Tiene 44 años de edad es soltero,  vive en la casa de su hermana , el cuenta con una mototaxi el cual presta servicio de transporte urbano, el se dedica a esta actividad hace 1 año, anteriormente se dedicaba como obrero de campo.Carlos es una persona con muchas metas y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder tener su casa propia, Con el dinero que solicita invertira en mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is 44 years old, single, and lives at his sister’s house. He owns a motorcycle taxi with which he provides transportation services throughout the city. Carlos has been in this business for one year. He was previously employed as a farm worker.

Carlos is a person with many goals and objectives, one of them being to acquire his own home. The money he requested will be invested in the maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. GRACIELA, TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES VIUDAD, TIENE UNA HIJA QUE ES MAYOR DE EDAD QUE VIVE CON ELLA. LA SRA. GRACIELA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "AMPLIACION VILLA EL POLVORIN" INTEGRADO POR 9 PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. 
DEBIDO A LAS NECESIDADES, EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR BRINDANDO SERVICIO DE LIMPIEZA EN CASA, CON LO CUAL PUEDE ASUMIR ALGUNOS DE SUS GASTOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES PONER UN RESTAURANT, PARA LO QUE HA SOLICITADO EL PRESTAMO.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is 38 years old, widowed, and has an adult daughter who lives with her. She is part of the group “Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin”, which consists of nine individuals who live in the District of Carabayllo. To meet her needs, Graciela started providing housekeeping services in order to pay for some of her expenses.

Her next goal is to open a restaurant, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a restaurant

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr: Monsieur Idrissa S. est un jeune yoffois de 28 ans qui évolue dans le domaine du mareyage depuis qu’il a quitte l’école. Mais parallèlement il s’adonne à l’achat et la revente d’appareils téléphoniques portables. Monsieur S. a choisi l’activité de vente de poissons par l’intermédiaire de ses amis qui font la même activité. Il s’est rendu compte que c’est un secteur qui marche fort et se pratique au quotidien. Il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs pour se procurer des poissons au niveau des piroguiers qui vont en mer et qu’il va revendre en détail  aux femmes. Ce crédit lui permettra  de mieux valoriser son activité  et de pouvoir faire face aux conditions difficiles de la vie.
texts.en:
M.Idrissa S. is a young man from Yoff, aged 28, who has been developing a business in the fish trade since he left school. Additionally, he has been engaged in buying and selling cell phones. M. S. chose to trade in fish at the urging of friends in the same business. He believes that it is a fast-growing type of business that he can engage in every day. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 Fr to buy his fish directly from seagoing boatmen for resale at retail to women customers. The loan will allow him to increase his profit and be able to cope with life's difficulties.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: La Rubia Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Rubia lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Damaris L. M. quien se dedica al comercio de artesanía en el norte del país. L. por su negocio vive viajando según comento una semana está en el norte comercializando con una muchacha y otra semana viene a traer mercadería a Masaya.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha Azucena García quien desde hace diez años vende calzado y Martha M.  quien tiene una tortillería y los fines de semana realiza nacatamales, moronga, frito etc.
texts.en:
The group “La Rubia” consists of three strong, hardworking, and enterprising women. The group coordinator is Sra. Damaris L. M., who sells handicrafts in the northern part of the country. She spends most of the time traveling for her business. Damaris says that one week she will be in the north selling with another young woman, and on another week, she will be bringing her merchandise to Masaya. Her fellow group members are Martha Azucena García, who has been selling shoes for ten years, and Martha M., who sells tortillas and makes Nicaraguan tamales, blood sausage, and fried foods on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crafts to sell

loans.name: Lenoi Ene

texts.en:
Lenoi Ene I. is 51 years-old. She is married to Riyian I. and is the mother of four children.  Lenoi is a wheat farmer in an area which normally does well due to good climatic conditions. She has been farming for the last four years.

Lenoi learned about Kiva partner KADET from other women who had already registered as members in KADET. This will be her fourth loan and she plans to use it to prepare the land to plant more wheat. She hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small scale to commercial farming.

Lenoi dreams of doing large scale farming in order to attain financial independence. She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
