Armando was born in 1979 in Padilla Tomina Chuquisaca Sucre, capital of Bolivia. He lives with Paulina and they have four school-aged children. 20 years ago he bought a five hectare parcel of land in Santo Corazon. He currently raises corn, yucca, and potatoes, which he harvests and sells in the central marketplace in El Torno. He is a hard working and responsible person and his wife and children help with the planting and harvest. He will use the money from this loan to buy potato seed. He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him. This is his first loan and he is very happy. He hopes to be able to buy a small truck with which to deliver his products to different markets within the zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato seed

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal D. Virgen D. las Mercedes inicia su primer ciclo con 4 socias.
Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Occollo, Distrito D. Vinchos, la actividad principal D. la zona es la crianza D. ganados.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. la Señora Alejandra que es casada y tiene 11 hijos, la mayor D. sus hijos tiene 25 años y el menor tiene 6 años, Alejandra junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. artesanía en piedra D. Huamanga, D. diferentes modelos, actividad que realizan todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos, un limitante para el desarrollo D. su negocio es la distancia a la ciudad D. Ayacucho para comercializar sus productos. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara piedra D. Huamanga. Los sueños D. Alejandra son aumentar su negocio y tener un puesto en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen D. las Mercedes began its first cycle with 4 members. The members are from the community of Occollo, district of Vinchos. The main activity in the area is cattle raising. The members have different businesses. Alejandra is married and has 11 children. Her oldest is 25 and the youngest is 6. With her husband, Alejandra makes huamanga stone carvings in different shapes. She does this every day with the help of her children. One limitation to the development of her business is the distance from the city of Ayacucho to sell her products. With the loan she will get she will buy huamanga stone. Alejandra's dreams are to grow her business and to have a stall in the artesan's market in Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase huamanga stone

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene 31 años, vive con sus padres en casa de un familiar. Hace más de 8 años se dedica en la venta de productos básicos para el consumo humano, para ello se asoció con un familiar en el invirtieron para alquilar un local comercial, ubicada en una calle muy céntrica de su ciudad. Desde entonces vende al por mayor y menor gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad, además se organizan para atender su clientela. Paralelo a esta actividad, durante los fines de semana se dedican a vender animales y también a la agricultura, éste último le ayuda para su consumo propio, en donde siembra maíz y papa. Su negocio en la venta de productos le ha sido muy rentable, por lo que desea mas adelante ampliar su negocio y emprender uno nuevo e independiente.  Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, invertirá para abastecerse de más productos y además en la compra de abono para su siguiente siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Ron is 31 years old and lives with his parents in the family home. Eight months ago he began selling basic consumer products. For him, he associated with a partnership to invest in renting a local business located on a very central street in the city. Since then, he sells a wide variety of wholesale and retail products that include basic necessities. In addition, he organizes them according to his client's needs. Parallel to this activity, on the weekends he sells animals and agricultural products; the later helps his own efforts in planting corn and potatoes. His business selling products has been very favorable, for his desire to move his business forward, and to become a new independent business owner. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. With the loan he's requesting, he will invest in building a supply of more products and even more so, buy fertilizer for his subsequent potato plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build up a supply of products for his business

loans.name: Jackeline Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jackeline del Carmen G. R., tienen la edad de 39 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, viven en el Barrio de Piedra Quemada, su esposo trabaja como chofer y le ayuda con su salario a cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Ella tiene una pulpería en donde vende artículos domésticos, personales y abarrotes, pero desde hace tres años se le ha presentado problemas de agua potable que afectan a la vida diaria de la familia. Además tienen la necesidad de realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda, pero antes desearía tener los recursos necesarios para invertir en su negocio en la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita un aumento en el volumen de las ventas y con esto la posibilidad de emprender nuevos proyectos que beneficien a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jackeline del Carmen G. R. is a 39-year-old married mother of three children and lives in the Piedra Quemada barrio. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and his salary helps them cover household expenses. Jackeline has a convenience store where she sells groceries and household items. However, for the past three years there has been a problem with drinking water in her area that has affected the family's daily life, and furthermore they need to make other improvements to their home. But first, Jackeline needs to have the necessary means to invest in her business so she can increase her inventory and thus increase her sales, which would bring about the possibility of starting new projects to benefit her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 20 años, actualmente vive con su pareja y su pequeña hija. Tienen una casa propia, ubicada en la selva cuzqueña. 

Joven soñadora y trabajadora recuerda que antes de tener su tienda ofrecía sus productos tocando puertas. De esa manera sus ventas crecían al igual que sus ingresos, con el tiempo obtuvo una lista de clientes fijos, eso le dio ventaja para instalar su bodega y ofrecer a todo público variados productos a precios competitivos. 
Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus padres y su horario de trabajo empieza a las 5:00 AM y termina a las 9:00PM. En lo sucesivo, desea ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal por el apoyo que le brindan. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Esther is 20 years old and lives her partner and their young daughter. They have their own home located in the Cusco rainforest. Esther is a young dreamer who is hard working, and she recalls that before she had her store she sold her products door to door. In this way she grew her sales along with her income, and in time she gained an established clientele, which enabled her to set up her store and offer her varied products to the entire public at competitive prices. She usually works with her partner, but on occasion her parents help out. Her work schedule starts at 5 a.m. and ends at 9 p.m. In the future, she wishes to expand her store with the goal of continuing to satisfy her customers. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to fulfill her payment obligations. Furthermore, she is grateful for her community bank and the support it provides. With the money she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to stock her store

loans.name: María Flor Bertila

texts.es:
María Flor tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, dos de los cuales son menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Sequiones, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, conocido a niver regional por tener a la mayoría de su población concentrada en áreas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, la mayoria de su población es considerada como pobre, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a a hora y  media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría cerdos, chivos y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su vivienda, cuando estos han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente están visitando la zona para adquirir animales  menores y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Como este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Adicionalmente María Flor se dedica a la comercialización de leña y carbón, su esposo extrae el combustible de los bosques secos de la zona y ella los vende a sus vecinos, estos combustibles tienen bastante acogida en la zona ya que son utilizados para la elaboración de alimentos.

María Flor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas cerdos y de alimento balanceado para desarrollarlos bien y así obtener mas ingresos, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Flor es es una mujer bastante hogareña y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia. Ella ya trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
María Flor is 42 years old, married and has five children, two who are still minors. She lives with her family in the hamlet of Sequiones in a rural zone in the district of Mórrope that is known for having the majority of its population concentrated in rural areas very far from one another. The majority of the population is considered poor, comes from the province of Lambayeque and is about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. María makes a living raising and selling animals. She raises pigs, goats and poultry in her home's backyard. When those animals reach a good point in their development, she puts them up for sell to the businesses that frequently visit the area to acquire animals to then resell in Chiclayo. This business helps María's husband cover household expenses. Additionally, María also sells firewood and charcoal. Her husband extracts the wood from the dry forests in the area and she sells it to their neighbors. The firewood is well-received since the people used to make their meals. María wishes to expand her business by purchasing more pigs and feed to promote a good development and thus increase her income. She has decided to request a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 soles that will help her achieve this objective. María is a home-loving woman who always watches out for her family's well being. She has worked int he past with Edpyme Alternativa and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and feeds to expand her business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene 7 hijos. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Es una mujer luchadora que no tuvo complejos de vender sus productos en la calle; recuerda que había empezado en producir hoja de coca, ya que algo tenía que vender para cubrir los alimentos del día. Cuando tuvo hijos, ella y su esposo empezaron en cultivar cacao y café para cubrir las necesidades familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida y hasta hoy le viene dando buenos resultados. Generalmente trabaja junto su esposo en su chacra y hacen un buen equipo, sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad a precio de mercado. Lleva 25 años de labor y sus planes a futuro son de abrir una tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de obtener ingresos adicionales.

Este su cuarto préstamo con MFP y asegura fielmente cumplir con su pagos respectivos, además está conforme por el buen grupo que conformó su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en darle mantenimiento a su terreno cultivo, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de sus productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Filomena is 48 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in the town of Pichari, specifically in the beautiful Cuscan jungle, where she has her own home.

Filomena is a determined woman who does not have complex products to sell on the street. She recalls starting out by growing coca leaves so that she could have something to sell to feed her family every day. When she had her children, she and her husband began growing cacao and coffee to cover the family necessities and improve their quality of life. As of today, they have produced good results. Filomena and her husband generally work together and they make a good team. Their products are sold at the local collections centers at market price. Filomena has been working for 25 years and has future plans of opening a grocery store in hopes of earning additional income.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Filomena is careful about completing each of her payments. She gets along well with the group that started her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be invested in the maintenance of her farmland with the goal of improving the quality of her agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her farmland

loans.name: Jesús Víctor

texts.es:
Jesús Víctor C. D., tiene la edad de 51 años, está soltero, y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar los insumos necesarios ( abono y el fertilizates )para el café. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jesús también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jesús Víctor C. D. is 51 years old, single, and lives alone. His loan will be used for attending to his farm, specifically for growing coffee. He plans to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can adequately maintain his coffee crop in order to obtain better quality and the best price when it is time to harvest. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Don Jesús has been farming for many years. He hopes to provide a better quality of life and greater financial stability for his family. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yamileth es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 35 años y junto con su esposo trabajan para lograr las mejoras de su casa. El trabaja como conductor de cabezal y viaja mucho. Doña Yamileth desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Ya que se afilio con la zermat y vende sus productos por catálogos, da al crédito y cada día adquiere clientes el cual para ella es de muchas ganancias. 
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción  como piedra, arena, piedrin, cemento para hacer la tapa al sumidero y levantarlo para lograr una mejor higiene,  ya que lo tiene tapado solo con zinc  y de mucho peligro para su familia  Sus planes es seguir en el comercio y de esta forma generar ingresos que beneficien en lo personal
texts.en:
Doña Yamileth is a hardworking woman and a 35 year old mother of three children. She and her husband work together to make improvements to her home. Her husband is a truck driver by profession and travels frequently. Doña Yamileth has been selling clothing and cosmetics for several years. Since she is affiliated with the Zermat brand, she sells their products through a catalog. She offers her products on credit and acquires customers each day so that she can generate good earnings.

With this loan she will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, gravel, and cement in order to build a cover for her sewage drain that will provide more hygienic conditions. At the moment it is covered with sheets of zinc, which makes it dangerous for her family. Doña Yamileth plans to continue with her business so that she can generate income that benefits her personally.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a cover for a sewage drain

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
EL SR. EUGENIO, VIVE EN SANTA RITA A 2KM DE EL TORNO, EL NACIO EN SANTA CRUZ, VIVIO DESDE MUY NIÑO EN SANTA RITA,CONVIVE (QUE VIVE EN PAREJA PERO NO SE CASO) CON LA SEÑORA DOMINGA, TIENE 4 HIJOS MAYORES. 

EL TRABAJA EN LA AGRICULTURA, SIEMBRA PAPA Y YUCA Y TAMBIEN TIENE SU CAMIONCITO CON EL QUE TRANSPORTA SUS PRODUCTOS AL MERCADO DE LA ZONA, TAMBIEN TRABAJA TRANSPORTANDO MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCCION, PERO SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA AGRICULTURA LA TIERRA EN LA QUE EL TRABAJA  ES EN LA BANDA DEL RIO A 1500 MTRS. DE SU CASA, EN ESTE MOMENTO EL  EL TIENE YUCA PARA COSECHAR. 

ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PENSANDO EN LE BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA YA QUE ES TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Eugenio lives in Santa Rita, 2 kilometers from El Torno. He was born in Santa Cruz but grew up in Santa Rita. He is partnered with Dominga but they never married; he has four adult children. He is a farmer who plants potatoes and yucca (manioc) and also has a small truck that he uses to bring his products to local markets. He also works hauling construction materials and supplies; but his main commercial activity is farming. The land he farms is in Banda del Rio which is about 1500 meters from his home. He is currently getting ready to harvest yucca. He is a hard-working, responsible person who always thinks about the well-being of his family. With the loan money, he will buy seeds to plant potatoes, since planting season is approaching. He is very grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for trusting him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia tiene 28 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la hermosa selva cusqueña, en la localidad de Pichari, donde tienen su casa propia. 

Ella es una persona que piensan que para trabajar no hay pretextos, ya que siempre hay algo qué hacer. Es por ello que desde los 7 años empezó ayudando a sus padres en la agricultura, tanto que llegó a gustarle esta actividad. Hoy, sigue dedicándose a cultivar cacao y en efecto, este producto le brinda muy buenas ganancias. 
Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en ocasiones tiene a cargo algunos peones que le facilitan la cosecha, y su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Sus planes a futuro son de construir su casa de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente conforme con el trabajo en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en darle mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos de cacao, con el propósito de incrementar su productividad a corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Herminia is 28 years old, married, and has two school age children. She resides in the beautiful Cuscan jungle, in the town of Pichari, where she has her own home.

Herminia is someone who believes one should not have an excuse to avoid work since there is always something to do. For this reason, seven years ago, she began helping her parents on their farm and discovered that she enjoyed the work. Today she remains committed to growing cacao, which generates very good earnings.

Herminia usually works with her husband, but sometimes they hire a few workers to help facilitate the harvest. They sell their products at the local collection centers. Her plans include building a house of solid materials in hopes of improving her family’s quality of life.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Herminia promises to complete her payments on time. She is also satisfied with the work of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to provide adequate maintenance to her cacao crop so that she can increase her productivity in the short term.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her cacao crop

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos en etapa escolar. Vive en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy aguerrido, pues a corta edad vivió junto a sus padres la época de terrorismo en su localidad. Por ello, desde muy joven empezó a tener su pequeña parcela (que sus padres le obsequiaron), de donde sacó mucho provecho, pues empezó a cultivar cacao. 
En el presente, con una cantidad considerable de tierras, cultiva y comercializa sus productos de cacao y hoja de coca con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para Ismael sus hijos son la razón de existir, ya que le dan muchas fuerzas de seguir adelante, por más que en el camino esté lleno de obstáculos. 
Generalmente sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad, por lo que sus ventas están mejorando con respecto al mes anterior y normalmente recibe la ayuda de sus familiares para el trabajo en el campo. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00AM hasta las 6:00PM y ya lleva casi 10 años trabajando en esta actividad.
Su plan a futuro es comprar un carrito sanguchero (móvil para comida rápida), para que su esposa labore con éste y obtenga dinero extra.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por las facilidades que le otorgan. Es por ello que se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal por la solidaridad que ejercen entre todos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en darle un mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones de cacao y hoja de coca, con la finalidad de minimizar futuras apariciones de plagas.
texts.en:
Ismael is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three school age children in the town of Pichari, located in beautiful Cuscan jungle, where he has his own home.

He is known for being a courageous man because, at a young age, he and his parents lived during a violent period in their neighborhood. Ismael took advantage of a small plot of land that his parents bought for him and began growing cacao. He presently owns a considerable amount of land that he uses to grow and sell products such as cacao and coca leaf so that he can improve his family’s quality of life. For Ismael, his children are the reason for his existence since they provide him great strength to press forward even though the road of life has many obstacles.

Ismael usually sells his products at the local collection centers. Lately his sales have been improving as compared to previous months. His relatives normally help him with the work in the fields. He works from 6am to 6pm and has been engaged in farming for almost ten years. His future plans include buying a mobile fast food cart so that his wife can work and earn extra income.

This is his second loan with MFP. Ismael is appreciative of the services that he has received. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments. In addition, he is grateful that everyone in his Communal Bank works closely with one another. The money he requested will be used to provide adequate maintenance to his cacao and coca leaf crops in order to minimize future occurrences of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his crops

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 48 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, específicamente en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Él se caracteriza por ser una persona con muchos proyectos en mente, pero sabe que debe ir paso a paso para llegar a su objetivo. Es por ello que empezó en cultivar la hoja de coca, ya que es un producto que no tiene temporada y a medida que sus ventas incrementaron incursionó en la producción de cacao.
Manuel piensa que le falta mucho por recorrer, es por ello que se levanta muy temprano para ir a su chacra y sacarle todo el provecho a sus tierras. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia para que le faciliten la extracción de sus productos y su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM. Para el futuro quiere empezar a criar gallinas y cerdos, con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago durante las fechas pactadas. Además hace hincapié al buen manejo organizacional de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado le servirá para comprar abono, con la finalidad de hacer más fértil su chacra y mejorar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Manuel is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the town of Pichari, specifically in the Cuscan jungle, where he has his own home.

Manuel is known as someone who has many projects planned, but he knows he must go step by step in order to accomplish each goal. For this reason, he began growing coca leaves since this crop can be grown anytime during the year. As his sales increased, he later ventured into growing cacao.

Manuel feels he has a long way to go, so he gets up early every morning to head toward his farm so that he can take full advantage of his land. He generally has the help of his family with harvesting his crops. His work schedule is from 6am to 6pm. In the future, he wants to begin raising chickens and pigs in order to boost his earnings.

This is his third loan with MFP. Manuel commits to meeting his payment obligations by the established deadlines. His Communal Bank emphasizes good organizational management. The money he requested will be used to purchase compost to make his land more fertile and improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 61 años, es divorciada y vive con sus 2 hijas y 2 nietas en su casa propia. Hace más D. 20 años venD. varios productos en mercería, prendas D. vestir y librería, por lo que son ofrecidos a conocidos y clientes que saben D. la calidad D. productos que tiene. Es así que viaja a la ciudad para comprar al por mayor D. estos productos, para luego cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes, que en la gran mayoría le hacen la compra a crédito, para luego ir D. casa en casa a realizar las cobranzas respectivas. D. esta manera se gana la vida trabajando sola y lo hace con el fin D. cubrir las necesidades D. su hogar. En adelante desea tener más mercadería y nuevos clientes para seguir vendiendo sus productos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP,  por tanto promete en ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. mercadería en productos D. escritorio y mercería.
texts.en:
Martha is 61 years old, divorced, and lives in her own home with her two daughters and two granddaughters. For more than 20 years she has been selling various products such as sewing supplies, clothing, and books. Her customers and acquaintances are familiar with the quality of products that she offers. Martha travels to the city in order to buy merchandise in bulk so that she can meet the demand of her customers. Most of her sales are maD. on credit, so she goes door to door to collect payments. She earns her living by herself so that she can cover her household necessities. In the future, she wants to have more merchandise and acquire new customers so that she can continue selling her products.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Martha commits to being responsible with her payments. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, such as office supplies and sewing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase office supplies & sewing supplies

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William B. N., tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado, y tiene tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 19,16 y 12 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan.Además, desea reparar el corral y terminar de ponerle el techo.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don William también trabaja desde hace muchos años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
William B. N. is 45 years old, married, and has three children who are his top priority. Their ages are 19, 16, and 12. His loan will be used to buy cattle to raise for both meat and milk production. He wants to maintain the cattle properly in order to obtain the best possible price when the time comes to sell them. Additionally, he wants to repair his corral and finish putting on a roof.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don William has been raising cattle for several years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle & make repairs to a corral

loans.name: Aura

texts.es: Aura tiene 57 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 20 años se dedica en la venta de carne de cerdo frito, negocio que tiene como nombre Chicharrón, plato típico de la ciudad. Desde entonces sus clientes acuden a su establecimiento a consumir este rico platillo, lo que motiva a Aura a quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche y al día siguiente realizar las compras necesarias para su siguiente venta que se inicia en las tardes. Con estos años de experiencia, Aura ha logrado tener logros y eso lo anima a continuar adelante con su negocio e implementarlo con mejor herramientas. Este es su diecisieteavo crédito con MFP, y como fundadora de su grupo comunal, promete en ser puntual con sus pagos. Además considera que este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cubiertos y platos nuevos, así como de gaseosas y cervezas para complementar su servicio.
texts.en:
Aura is 57 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home with her two children. For more than 20 years she has been selling fried pork (known as “chicharrón”), which is a traditional dish of the city. Her customers come to her establishment to eat her tasty dishes, which motivates her to stay late into the night and into the following morning to continue making sales. She then reopens her business in the afternoon. With her years of experience, Aura has achieved success and is encouraged to continue forward with her business and establish it with better equipment.

This is her seventeenth loan with MFP. As one of the founding members of her Communal Bank, Aura promises to be punctual with her payments. She considers this loan to be very useful in advancing her business. The funds she requested will be invested in cutlery and new dishes, as well as sodas and beer to complement her food service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cutlery, dishes, sodas, and beer

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MARIA,  ella tiene 48 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con gobierno regional, la socia es funcionaría pública y trabaja desde hace 29 años; Nuestra socia tiene una hija que es ingeniero civil su hija trabaja haciendo proyectos de construcción en el campo a 8 horas del Cusco en santo tomas chumbivilcas, la socia solicita el préstamo para su hija que desea invertir en sus estudios previos a este su nuevo proyecto en el área rural, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para darle a su hija para que ella haga los primeros estudios básicaos de su proyecto en la zona rural.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Comuzone” Communal Bank. She lives in the District of Huanchac in the city of Cusco, Department of Cusco.

Maria is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She divides her time between her household activities and her job working for the regional government. Maria has worked as a civil servant for 29 years. She has a daughter who is a civil engineer and works in the field on construction projects in Santo Tomas Chumbivilcas, which is located eight hours away from Cusco. Maria is requesting a loan for her daughter so that she can invest in continuing education classes that will allow her to work on new projects in rural areas. The loan will be used to pay for her first basic courses in rural projects.

Maria appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's continuing education courses in engineering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for the decorations.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene  56 años, tiene dos hijas y es docente jubilado. Su principal actividad económica es hacer servicios de moto taxi. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Julio Cesar es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Julio Cesar requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del moto taxi comprará repuestos y llantas. El socio es presidente de “La Asociación de Moto Taxi Valle Sagrado” que está conformado por 76 socios. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a member of the “VALLE SAGRADO” (“Sacred Valley”) communal bank. He is a retired teacher who is 56 years old and has two daughters. His main economic activity is providing a moto taxi service. He has made a living from this business for two years and it is going very well. Julio Cesar is a very responsible and enterprising man who spends every moment looking for opportunities to get ahead and makes an effort every day to help his family. Julio Cesar needs a loan so that he can do maintenance work on his moto taxi, and will use the money to purchase spare parts and tires. He is president of the “Valle Sagrado Moto Taxi Association”, an organization that has 76 members. Julio Cesar is grateful for the opportunity he is being given through this loan, and he agrees to complete all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance work on his moto taxi.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 27 años, vive con su esposa en una casa alquilada. Hace mas de 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando papa, maíz, brócoli y apio. Desde entonces su labor empieza todas las mañanas, cuidando sus plantaciones, para cuando llega la temporada de cosecha, su esposa la ayuda en la recolección de sus productos.  Luego es comercializada la producción en los mercados de su localidad. Su mayor anhelo es tener sus propios terrenos de cultivo para evitar arrendar otros terrenos para la siembra. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, además fue invitado a formar parte del grupo comunal, por ser una persona responsable. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old. He and his wife live in a rented house. Edwin has been farming potatoes, corn, broccoli and celery for more than eight years. Since then, he has always gotten up early in the morning to tend his crops, and his wife helps him with the harvest. After that, Edwin sells his produce at local markets. He hopes to one day own his own farmland, so that he no longer has to lease space for planting. This is his first loan with MFP. Since he’s a responsible person, he has also been invited to join a community banking group. Edwin will use his loan to buy bags of compost and fertilizer for his next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. CLARA,  ella tiene 51 años de edad es casada y tiene 6 hijos  todos independientes Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades básicas con el comercio minorista, La socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el barrio de Santiago , nuestra socia trabaja con su tienda desde hace 20 años, ella ayudo a sus hijos con su educación superior con los ingresos de esta tienda, ahora lo hace más por distracción y es muy feliz con su negocio, cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para acomodar y abrir su tienda y atiende con el mayor agrado y carisma. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su tienda y comprar arroz, azúcar, leche al por mayor y otros pequeños productos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the “COMUZONE” Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cusco, in the Huanchac district in the department of Cusco. Clara is 51 years old, married, and has 6 adult children. She mixes her household activities with retail. Clara has a small grocery store in the neighborhood of Santiago. She has worked at her store for 20 years—she helped her children with their higher education with her income from the store. These days she works more because it provides a distraction, and she is very happy with her business. Every morning Clara gets up very early to set up and open her store, and she attends to her customers with much cheer and charisma. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her store by purchasing rice, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices, and also purchase other small products. Clara is very grateful for the support she is being given through this loan, and she agrees to complete her payments according to the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her store by purchasing rice, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices, and purchasing other small products.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime T. C. de 34 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos. Vive en casa propia de material noble en el caserio de Paraya. Trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr de  construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Jaime T. C., 34, is single and has no children. He lives in his own home in the hamlet of Paraya. His is a field worker for an agro-industrial business. He is an entrepreneurial person and thanks to his determination has done well for himself. He needs this loan to finish construction on his home. His dream is to work on his whole home and have a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the support we can give him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving his home

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus tres hijos adultos. Reside en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona emprendedora y tenaz, desde hace 22 años se dedica al servicio de peluquería. Los meses de julio, octubre, noviembre y diciembre son las épocas donde obtiene mayores ingresos debido a las fechas festivas que se realizan en su localidad.
Generalmente trabaja por sí sola, pero en tiempo de campaña necesita de ayudantes, siendo su rutina diaria de 8:00 AM a 9:00 PM. Pero no contenta con ello, para el futuro piensa ampliar su peluquería, introduciendo nuevas máquinas de lavado y planchado de cabello, con el propósito de captar más clientes y a la vez ofrecer cortes de cabello, teñidos y ondulaciones a menores precios, con respecto a su competencia.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago y a la vez agradece a la institución por la facilidades de préstamo que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de tintes para todo tipo de cabello, con el resto adquirirá revistas de belleza.
texts.en:
Lidia, age 48, lives with her life partner and father of their three adult children. They live in the San Franscisco area, which is in the Ayachucan jungle. They have their own house there. She is characterized as being a hard-working and tenacious person. She has been working as a hairdresser for 22 years. The months of July, October, November, and December are times when she gets the greatest earnings due to the dates of the holidays they celebrate in her area. She generally works by herself. But, during the holiday season she needs helpers as her daily routine is from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. But, she is not content with it. In the future she plans to expand her hair salon. She will introduce new washing machines and hair irons. She will do this to gain more customers. At the same time she offers haircuts, weavings, and perms at lower prices than her competition. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to fulfill her payment obligations. She is grateful to the institution for the ease of the loan that they offer. She will use the requested money to buy tints for all types of hair. With the rest of the money she will get beauty magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair tints

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Cuando era adolescente tenía una pequeña parcela que le habían otorgado sus padres con el propósito de que siga sus pasos. Ahora se dedica específicamente al cultivo de cacao, pero no todo lo fue “color de rosa”, ya que en anteriores oportunidades existían compradores que no querían pagar lo justo, pero tenía que vender para cubrir sus gastos familiares.
En ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su esposo, pero por lo general tiene a cargo peones que le faciliten la siembra y cosecha. Con su esposo enfrentaron la peor época cuando su producto no podían competir con los precios menores al suyo, pero no se amilanó, siguió adelante, sabía que se acercaba una oportunidad de salir de sus problemas y es así que encontró otros compradores que aceptaron pagar mejores precios. Para un futuro próximo quiere comprar más terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de producir más y cumplir con sus compromisos.

Con éste, lleva cuatro créditos con MFP, por lo que asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además felicita su banco comunal por la buena organización que tienen. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Marisol is 34 years, married and has three children. She lives in the town of Pichari, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle and is where she owns her own home. When she was an teenager, she owned a small plot of land that her parents had given her with the condition that she follow in their footsteps. Now, she makes her living cultivating cacao specifically. But life isn't always a bed of roses. In early dealings, there were buyers who didn't want to give her a fair price, but she had to sell to them anyway to have money to meet her family's expenses. Sometimes her husbands helps her, but generally speaking she hires laborers who help with the planting and harvesting. She and her husband faced their worst period when they couldn't compete with prices lower than theirs. Even so they were undaunted, and they moved forward, knowing that an opportunity would present itself to free them from their problems. And indeed they did find other buyers who agreed to pay better prices. In the near future, she wants to purchase more farmland for the purpose of producing more crops and fulfilling her obligations. With this one, she will have four loans with MFP. She promises to loyally comply with all payments, and in addition she congratulates her communal bank for their excellent organization. She plans to invest the requested funds in maintaining her farmland with the intention of improving the quality of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her farmland.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 41 años, es casado y tienen 5 hijos mayores y 2 hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la ceja de selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Sus padres fueron toda la vida agricultores, pero él decidió cambiar de actividad, es por ello que tiene un restaurante. Pero no todo fue éxito en su vida, ya que pasó momentos de verdadera angustia económica cuando no le estaba dando resultados su negocio, pero aun así perseveró. Ahora tiene buena cantidad de clientela y por ende, buenas ganancias, por lo que ahora quiere incursionar en la agricultura, específicamente en el cultivo de cacao y café.
Generalmente trabaja junto a su esposa, pero ocasionalmente también recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su horario de trabajo es de 10:00 AM a 1:00 AM. Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su negocio teniendo sucursales de su restaurante en otras localidades.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente. Además  tiene un buen concepto de su banco comunal, por la responsabilidad de cada uno de sus socios. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en ampliar y mejorar su local, con el fin de captar mayor clientela y que se sientan más cómodos y satisfechos con la atención.
texts.en:
Paulino is 41 years old, married, and has 5 adult children and 2 school-age children. He lives in Pichari, located in the jungle of Cuzco, where he has his own house. His parents were farmers their whole lives, but he decided to do something else. For this reason he has a restaurant. However, his whole life has not been full of success. He had moments that were truly very difficult economically when his business was not doing well, but he still persevered. Now he has a lot of customers that provide good earnings. Now he wants to begin agricultural work, specifically by farming cocoa and coffee. He normally works with his wife, but his children sometimes help as well. His work schedule is from 10:00 am until 1:00 am. His future plans are to expand his business by having branches of his restaurant in other places.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is committed to making the payments on time. He also has a good understanding of community banks, and of the responsibility required of each of the members. He will use the money to invest in expanding and improving his restaurant, with the goal of attracting more customers so that they feel more comfortable and satisfied with the service.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Alfredo Tomas

texts.es:
Alfredo forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos. Su principal actividad económica es fabricar gaseosas “Embotelladora Industrial Sumac Kola” y  su actividad económica complementaria es administrar sus dos carros que hacen servicios de transportes de las ciudades de Cusco a Calca y viceversa. Ya son seis años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.

Alfredo es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Alfredo requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando insumos como por ejemplo saborizantes.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Alfredo is part of the Sacred Valley communal bank. He is 49 years old and has three children. His main business as the sumac cola industrial bottler is to make soda. He also runs two taxis that go between Cusco and Calca. He's been at this work for six years, and it's going very well. Alfredo is a responsible and entrepreneurial person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and help his family. Alfredo needs this loan for working capital to buy ingredients such as flavorings. He is very grateful for the opportunity he has through this Kiva partner and promises to make his payments on time, according to his payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soda flavorings

loans.name: Severo

texts.es:
Severo tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos mayores. Vive en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Pichari, donde tienen su casa propia.

A pesar de no tener una carrera, los conocimientos los adquirió con la experiencia y enseñanza de sus familiares y es por ello que lleva casi 45 años en la actividad agrícola
Actualmente cultiva y comercializa cacao y café a los comerciantes mayoristas y le está dando buenos resultados económicos. Severo siente que todavía no acabado para él el trabajo, ya que quiere seguir laborando toda su vida, pues esta actividad es su razón de existir. 
Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero también recibe la ayuda de sus familiares, permaneciendo en sus chacras 12 horas diarias, a excepción de los domingos, cuando se toma un descanso para estar con la familia. 
Sus planes a futuro son de implementar una tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de obtener ganancias económicas adicionales.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago de forma puntual. Además felicita a su banco comunal por la seguridad y transparencia que brindan en el desarrollo de sus ciclos de crédito. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones de café y cacao.
texts.en:
Severo is 58 years old, is married and has 4 adult children. He lives in the beautiful Cuzco jungle located in Pichari where he has his own home.

Despite not having a degree, his knowledge has been gathered by experience and by teaching his family and it is because of it that he has almost 45 years in the agricultural field.

Now he grows and sells cocoa and coffee to the wholesalers and he is receiving good income. Severo feels that work is not over for him and wants to keep working all of his life, since it is his reason to be.

He generally works by himself but he also gets help from his family. Severo works on his small farm 12 hours daily, except Sundays where he rests to be with his family.

Severo’s future plans are to set up a small grocery store to have some supplemental income.

This is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is committed to meeting his duties by paying punctually. Further, he congratulates his communal bank for the security and transparency that they have in the loans. He will use the money to maintain his crops of coffee and cocoa.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his crops of coffee and cocoa.

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es:
Teodosio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos mayores y dos hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la localidad de Pichari, específicamente en la ceja de la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

A pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentaron en la vida, él sobresalió desde abajo y al final del camino tuvo su recompensa. Ahora se dedica por entero a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café. Trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa e hijos y algunos peones que le facilitan la extracción y selección de sus productos. 
Normalmente labora desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM y sus productos los venden en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad; por lo cual le está dando buenos resultados económicos. No contento con ello, en el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo con el propósito de incrementar su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece a su banco comunal por el respaldo que le brindan. Con el dinero solicitado piensa darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos de cacao, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Teodosio is 55 years old, is married and has 4 adult children and 2 children of school age. He lives in Pichari, specifically the rim of the Cuzco jungle where he has his home.

Despite the obstacles that he has faced in life he overcame them and in the end he got his reward. Now he dedicates his time completely to agriculture, specifically to cocoa and coffee. He works by himself but sometimes his wife and children help him as well as some workers that help pick and select his products.

Normally Teodosio works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM and his products are sold in the central gathering places of his neighborhood, which is why he has such good profits. Not satisfied with his success, he hopes in the future to expand his plotted land to increase his production. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and is committed to meeting his set quotas and adds that he is grateful to his communal bank for the support that they give him. With the money loaned he will use it to take care of his crops of cocoa to improve the quality of his product.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To take care of his crops.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y madre de tres hijos. Vive en la localidad de Pichari, ubicada en la hermosa selva del Cuzco, donde tiene su casa propia.

Recuerda que en la época de los 80’, cuando el terrorismo causaba pánico en su comunidad, no tenían ni para comer. Ella pensaba que su vida iba ser llena de sufrimientos y cuando después se separó de su esposo todo le iba mal, pero recibió el apoyo de su familia en los momentos más difíciles. En el presente tiene dos negocios: una tienda de abarrotes y una de venta de repuestos para carros. En efecto, agradece eternamente a sus padres por el apoyo incondicional que lo dieron. Es por ello, que siempre se levanta muy temprano y atiende de las 5:30 AM hasta las 9:00 PM. Ahora que sus ventas están creciendo aspira a otras cosas, como implementar sus dos negocios, incrementar su clientela y mejorar sus ganancias.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos. Con el dinero solicitado piensa invertir en adquirir más productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 34 years old; she is single and a mother to three children. He lives in the Pichari neighborhood located in the beautiful Cuzco jungle where she has her own home.

She remembers the 80s, where terrorism caused panic in her community, they didn’t even have food to eat. Yolanda thought that her life was going to be filled with suffering and when she separated from her husband everything went wrong but she received the support of her family in the most difficult moments. At present, she has two businesses, a small grocery store and she also sells spare parts for cars. She is eternally grateful to her parents for the unconditional support that they gave her, it is because of them that she wakes up really early and works from 5:30 AM to 9:00 PM. Now her sales are growing and she aspires for new things like: working on her two businesses, increasing the number of customers and improving her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she is committed to meeting her respective payments. With the money, she will buy more basic household goods for her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandize.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 46 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 1 año que tiene una tienda, en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, por lo que trata de mantener surtida su negocio para poder cumplir con la demanda de su cliente. Es así que trabaja todos los días, incluidos los fines de semana, que son lo días que más ventas tiene, quedándose hasta largas horas de la noche. Para ella este negocio le es rentable, y más cuando vende gaseosas, cervezas y condimentos. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, cría cuyes y cada 15 días realiza alguna venta, de acuerdo a la demanda del cliente. Su negocio le ha dado la oportunidad de mejorar económicamente, es por eso que desea suministrar su tienda con variados productos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que éste aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cerveza y productos envasados.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old; she lives with her 3 children in her parents’ home. For more than 1 year, she has had a store where she sells basic household goods and tries to maintain her business stocked to be able to meet her customer’s needs. Elizabeth works everyday including weekends which are the days where she sells the most and she works long hours into the night. For her, this business is more profitable and she sells mostly soft drinks, beers and seasonings. Additionally to this work, she breeds cuyes (a hamster like animal) and every 15 days she has a sale according to the needs of her customers. Elizabeth’s business has given her the opportunity to improve financially and that is why she wishes to supply her store with a variety of products. This is her fifth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she will be very responsible with her payments and feels that this support will be very helpful to the development of her business. With the loan she will buy beer and bottled products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and bottled products.

loans.name: Diana Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Diana tiene  41 años de edad y es madre soltera. vive en casa propia junto a su hija. Trabaja  como obrera de campo desde hace 6 años en parcelas agricolas de la zona. Es una persona muy emprendedora que a salido adelante gracias a su trabajo. Solicita el crédito para terminar de tarrajear su vivienda. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa para tener una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra Diana Magdalena Y. A., agradece la ayuda que le podamos brindar a traves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Diana, 41, is a single mother; she lives in her own home with her daughter. She has worked as a field hand for the last 6 years in area farms. She is a very enterprising person who has gotten ahead in life thanks to her hard work. She is asking for funds to finish sealing the walls of her house. Her dream is to be able to finish building her house so that her quality of life will be better. Diana Magdalena Y. A. is grateful for whatever help we may be able to offer through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el anexo La Zorra del caserío Arbolsol, un área rural del distrito de Mórrope, conocido en la región por tener a su población dispersa en varios sectores que distan mucho una de la otra, la mayoría de ellas son consideradas como zonas pobres, el distrito pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y el sector se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que se casó, ella cría animales menores en la parte exterior de su domicilio, especialmente chivos y ovejas, cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen desarrollo los venden a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar para adquirir animales y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. El negocio goza de buena acogida en la zona y le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Antonia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para darles una crianza de calidad y asi poder obtener mas ingresos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Antonia es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir ayudando a su esposo a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos del lugar en donde vive.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 49-year-old housewife who lives with her family in the La Zorra annex of the hamlet of Arbolsol. It's a rural area of the Morrope district, known in the region for having a scattered population, where one group lives far from the other. The majority of the groups are considered poor. The district is part of the Lambayeque province, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Antonia has been raising and selling animals since she got married. She raises small animals just outside her home, especially goats and sheep. When they are grown, she sells them to the businesspeople who always visit the area to buy animals that they will sell again in Chiclayo. Her business is well received in the area and allows her to help her husband provide for the family. Antonia wants to grow her business by buying more animals and good feed for them so that she can raise quality livestock and earn more money. Because of this, she needs to get her first loan for 1500 nuevos soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her meet her goals. Antonia is a hard working woman who has always fought to help her family get ahead. Her greatest longing is to continue helping her husband improve the family's quality of life. She is very well known and esteemed among her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

location.town: Anexo La Zorra - Caserío Arbolsol - Morrope - Lamb

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz tiene 20 años, vive con su madre en una casa alquilada. Desde su niñez aprendió el arte de la artesanía, como hacer mates burilados, convirtiéndose en un experto diseñando bellos adornos, en el que luego serán llevados a la ciudad para su comercialización a los vendedores de ferias artesanales. El trabajo que realiza lo hace en las instalaciones de su casa, quien en compañía de su madre la ayuda en la elaboración de este arte. Este negocio es rentable y ventajoso para Franz porque le permite disponer de su tiempo y a la vez cubrir sus estudios. Ahora anhela tener un taller más grande en donde pueda contratar mano de obra para seguir elaborando su artesanía. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, además se siente contento por ser invitado a formar parte del grupo comunal, por ser una persona muy responsable. Asimismo considera que el aporte que recibirá le ayudará en el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mates al por mayor por ello tendrá que viajar a Chiclayo para adquirir este producto al por mayor, en el que luego serán diseñados y trabajados de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Franz, 20, lives with his mother in a rented house. As a child he learned crafts, specifically carved gourds, becoming an expert at designing beautiful decorations which will later be taken to the city to sell at crafts markets. He works at home and his mother helps him. It is quite a profitable business and is very advantageous for Franz because it leaves him with time to pursue his studies. He would like to have a larger workshop so that he can hire employees to help him continue making his crafts. This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to have been invited to be part of a communal bank because he is a very responsible person. He also feels that the funds he’ll get will help him develop his business. He will use the requested funds to buy gourds at wholesale to decorate. To do that he must travel to Chiclayo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gourds and pay for transportation costs to acquire them.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor Silvia D. es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Ellos son padres de 2 niños a los cuales quieren ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Flor Silvia inicio desde hace una año un negocio de abarrotes el cual es llamado “Miscelánea Michell” este fue instalado en su misma casa, pensado en la seguridad de sus 2 hijos. Ahora ella recurre a esta institución pidiendo el apoyo para seguir surtiendo su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad de producto que hay en el mercado.
texts.en:
Flor S. D. is an enterprising woman who likes to help her husband with household expenses. They have two children to whom they would like to offer a better quality of life. A year ago, Flor S. started a grocery store called “Miscelánea Michell.” She opened the store in her own house, thinking of the safety of her two children. Now she is asking this institution for help to continue supplying her store in order to offer her customers higher quality products than are in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. tres años venD. cosméticos D. diversas marcas reconocidas en el mercado. DesD. entonces ofrece a su clientela, productos como: Shampoo, acondicionadores, cremas, labiales, rubores, rizador, entre otros, en donD. la gran mayoría tiene mucha demanda por amigas y vecinas D. su barrio, luego estaría realizando las respectivas cobranzas D. casa en casa hasta que terminen D. pagar sus cuotas. Georgina se siente contenta y satisfecha con al actividad que realiza, ya que el recibir sus ganancias, le permiten ser una fuente D. financiamiento para sus hijos. Es por ello que continuará esforzándose en la venta D. cosméticos siendo su anhelo aumentar su mercadería y sus ingresos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto promete en ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. cosméticos al por mayor para tener mayor variedad D. productos en venta.
texts.en:
Georgina is 51 years old; she lives with her husband and 4 children in her own home. For more than three years she has been selling cosmetics of different brands that are recognized in the market. She offers her customers items like: shampoo, conditioners, creams, lipstick, blush, hair-curlers among other items. For the most part, she has great demand from her friends and neighbors and she collects the money from the items sold from her customers door to door until they pay their balance due. Georgina fells happy and satisfied with her work since when she receives her payments it allows her to be a source of income for her children. This is why she will continue to work wholeheartedly selling cosmetics with the hope of increasing her merchandize and income. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and promises to be responsible with her payments. With the loan she will buy cosmetics wholesale to have a greater variety of products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Lagafuaina

texts.en:
Lagifuaina M. is 35 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  Lagifuaina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Lagifuaina needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Lagifuaina joined SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lagifuaina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es la esposa del señor Alberto R. en ese momento se encontraba en su trabajo.
Esta familia esta agradecida con el apoyo brindado por esta institución ya que ha sido la forma por la que han podido ir extendiendo su casa, pues este crédito será el tercero. Ahora Alberto desea empastar la losa por que cuando la construyo le quedo muy delgada y en temporada de lluvia se trasmina el agua. El teme que todo lo que ha hecho con mucho esfuerzo se le deteriore. Es por ello que quiere un préstamo para poder realizar este proyecto para que su vivienda este en las mejores condiciones para ofrecerle a su familia confort y seguridad.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is Alberto R.’s wife; he was at work at that moment. This family is very grateful for the help they’ve gotten from the institution because they have been able to enlarge their home; this will be their third loan. Alberto would like to re-grout the tile because when he installed it it was too thin and when it rains water seeps in; he fears that everything he’s built with so much effort will deteriorate. He needs funds, therefore, to accomplish this project so that his home will be in the best possible conditions to offer his family comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To re-grout tile.

loans.name: Faava

texts.en:
Faava T. is 32 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business catching and selling ocean-caught fish .  Faava has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faava needs a loan of 1500 talas to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faava is a woman who had the initiative to develop her business and assist her family financially.  In 2009, Faava joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faava's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La señora Blanca Rosa es madre de 2 pequeñas niñas pues hace tiempo su esposo falleció y quedo viuda. Pero a pesar del dolor que paso ella sigua adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas. Ella tiene una papelería y mercería llamada “Angelique” desde hace 2 años. Blanca ofrece a sus clientes variedad de artículos escolares a un bajo precio, pero en este momento requiere de un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y así obtener mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca Rosa is the mother of two small daughters who she raises alone after her husband passed away some time ago. Despite the pain that she endured from his death, she works to move forward and offer a better quality of life for her daughters. She has owned a stationary and hardware store called “Angelique” for the past two years. Blanca offers her customers a variety of merchandise at a low price, but currently needs a loan to buy more supplies for her business so that she can earn bigger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Heyd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for business

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en casa de su suegra. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, en donde su esposo es el encargado de conducir el vehiculo, recorriendo las rutas locales de su  ciudad, mientras que María se encarga de administrar las ganancias. Asimismo deriva parte de sus ingresos en un negocio que acaba de iniciar el negocio de venta de dulces en un cafetín escolar y que mas adelante tiene el propósito de arrendar todo el cafetín. Por toro lado, el servicio de transporte que ofrece es rentable, es así que estos dos negocios le dará las ganancias necesarias para cubrir la necesidades de su hogar, además desea darle mantenimiento a su vehiculo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto promete en ser muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, invertirá para pagar el servicio del mecánico, en donde llevará a darle mantenimiento a su carro, asimismo comprará algunos repuestos.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in her mother-in-laws’ home. For more than 3 years she has been in the public transportation business, and her husband is in charge of driving the car by traveling the local routes of his city, while María is in charge of managing their income. She also gets part of her revenue from selling candy in a school cafeteria and in the future she plans to lease the entire cafeteria. The transportation service is profitable and with both businesses she will have enough earnings to meet the needs of her home and she also wants to service her vehicle. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) which is why she promises to be very responsible with her payments. The loan will be used to pay the mechanic for his work where she will take her car to be serviced and to buy some spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service a car and to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es: Gloria Guadalupe P. A., es mujer muy trabajadora de 37 años de edad, la cual vela por el bienestar de toda su familia. Reside en el departamento de La Libertad y vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad. Gloria se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de diferentes marcas, las cuales son muy reconocidas en el país, algunos de estos productos son: cremas limpiadoras del rostro, perfumes, crema para el cuerpo entre otros más. Ella los comercializa de forma ambulante, ya que debe salir a ofrecerlos entre sus vecinos y amigos, es por esta razón que posee muchos clientes, ya que Gloria se dedica a visitarlos de manera periódica  ofreciendo sus servicios. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que desea poder vender más, así mismo es de mucha importancia contar con el dinero necesario para hacer esto ultimo, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes compran su mercadería a crédito, por lo que en algunas ocasiones esto le dificulta seguir invirtiendo en el negocio. Gloria anhela en gran manera seguir superándose en su negocio alcanzando nuevas metas, las cuales beneficien en gran manera el presente y futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Guadalupe P. A. is a hardworking woman. She is 37 years old and watches over her family’s wellbeing. She lives in the La Libertad department and lives with her husband and two children of 7 and 14 years of age. Gloria sells beauty products of different brands that are very well-known in the country, some of the products that she sells are: facial cleanser creams, perfumes, body lotion and other items.
