She sells them door to door since she offers them to her neighbors and friends; she has a lot of customers since Gloria visits them periodically to offer her products. She needs a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of products since she wants to be able to sell more and needs the money to buy them since the majority of her customers buy her merchandize on credit which sometimes makes it difficult for her to invest in the business. Gloria wishes to be able to keep excelling on her job by reaching new goals that will benefit her in a great way as well as the present and future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria Isabel C. de 46 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre, la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, en el centro de San Miguel, a pesar que su venta es muy pequeña ella se muestra muy agradecida de poder contar con ella, ya que ha sido esta la que le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario durante 10 años. Reside en el departamento de San Miguel, junto a su esposo y dos hijas, las cuales le ayudan a Gloria con una tienda de productos perecederos que poseen en su hogar, mientras Gloria trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde vendiendo las frutas y las verduras, sus hijas le ayudan con el negocio, el cual al llegar a casa Gloria se encarga de atender también. Una de las mayores virtudes de ella es la de destacarse por ser muy trabajadora, ya que siempre esta en busca de alguna actividad para poder obtener ganancias extras para su familia. Gloria solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para aumentar los productos de su venta, y así contar con frutas de temporada y más verduras, las cuales las personas solicitan más.
texts.en:
Gloria Isabel C. is 46 years old. She is a very cheerful woman. She sells fruit and vegetables in downtown San Miguel. Despite the fact that her sales are very limited, she is very grateful to be able to count on them. They have allowed for her to have what she has needed for 10 years. She lives in the San Miguel department with her husband and two daughters. Her daughters help Gloria with a perishable items store that they have in their home. While Gloria works from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening selling fruit and vegetables, her daughters help with the business. When Gloria arrives home she takes over. One of her greatest virtues is standing out as a hard worker. She is always looking for an activity to get extra income for the family. Gloria is asking for a loan from Integral. With it, she will be able to have the resources to increase the products for sale, as well as have fruits in season and more vegetables, which is what people request the most.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: María Lorena

texts.es: María Lorena R. B. de 35 años de edad, reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive en casa de su madre junto a ella, su padre quien es jubilado, un hermano el cual se dedica a trabajar, su esposo quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Con el deseo de poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo y así mismo aportar con todos los gastos del hogar, desde hace 2 años y medio que María inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. María atiende el negocio de lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite poder cuidar a su pequeño hijo. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, contando con el enorme beneficio de estar al cuidado de su hijo.
texts.en:
María Lorena R. B. is 35 years old and lives in Antiguo Cuscatlán, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives in her mother’s house, with her retired father, a working brother, her husband who works as a security guard and her young 3 year old son. With her wish to be able to support her husband as well as contribute to the household expenses, María started her own business 2 and a half years ago. Her store sells perishable products and is located in her home. María works from Monday to Sunday. Her work starts each day at 5 in the morning and finishes at 10 in the evening. Even though her work is hard, since she has to tend to clients for most of the day, she’s able to take care of her young son. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she can invest in buying a larger quantity of basic necessity products and this way she can improve her sales and be able to take care of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic necessities

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel G. G. de 36 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace 6 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, gracias al cual ha logrado sostener a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica en la escuela del lugar. El negocio de venta de madera es muy rentable para José ya que cuenta con muchos clientes quienes hacen pedidos grandes, lo que le permite obtener más ganancias. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar madera por mayor y así contar con más materia prima para su negocio. El mayor deseo de José es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
José Manuel G. G. is 36 years old. He lives in the city of Santa Tecla, which is located in the La Libertad district. For 6 years, he has been buying and selling wood, a business which is located in his home. Thanks to this business, he been successful in supporting his family. This is confirmed by his wife, who does the household chores, and his two children, who are 14 and 12 years old and go to the local school. The business of selling wood is very profitable for José, since he can count on many clients who place large orders, which gives him bigger earnings. He is applying for a loan so that he will have the money needed to buy wood wholesale and thus have more material for his business. José's greatest wish is to increase his earnings and in this way improve the economy of his household.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood wholesale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Deysi Mercedes

texts.es: Deysi Mercedes H. S. 28 años de edad es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual posee su propio negocio el cual es una venta de productos de primera necesidad tales como: leche, granos básicos, aceite, así mismo comercializa verduras y frutas, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de San Juan Opico, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella reside en  Santa Tecla, ciudad en la que vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y su único hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual es la mayor razón de Deysi  para trabajar y esforzarse día con día. El negocio es muy grande por lo que posee muchos clientes quienes comprar en grandes cantidades sus productos, por lo que ella desea aumentar su inventario, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos de primera necesidad todas por mayor y de esta manera abastecer a todos sus clientes y de paso obtener algunos nuevos. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Deysi ya que ella es una persona que día con día trabaja mucho para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Deysi Mercedes H. S. is 28 years old. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial young woman who has her own business, which is a store that sells basic products such as milk, grains, and oil, and she also sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in the market of San Juan Opico, which is located in the La Libertad district. She lives in Santa Tecla with her husband, who works, and her only son, who is 6 years old and is the main reason why Deysi works and exerts herself day after day. Her business is quite large, so she has many customers who buy her products in large quantities. For this reason, she wants to increase her inventory, and that is why she is applying for a loan, which she can use to buy basic products, all wholesale, and in this way provide for all her customers and at the same time obtain some new ones. This idea fills Deysi with great expectations, since she is a person who works hard day after day to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products wholesale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maricel's Group

texts.en:
Maricel P. is from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Maricel is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan 1.

Maricel is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruit products like watermelon, mangoes, bananas, rambutan, etc. in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maricel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Poverty has made Elenita O. a tough and determined woman. She has been through a lot of challenges in life even before she had her own family. Even then, she has able to surmount those hurdles and has able to make her life happy with her loving and supportive husband and her four treasured children who inspire her. They made themselves contended with the things they can afford. However, they are dreaming of a better life in the future. 

Four of Elenita’s children were not able to graduate or even reach a secondary level of education. They now range are from 14 to 21 years old and are working as a hired laborers. Despite that, Elenita O. is hoping that her youngest child, who is ten years old, will graduate from college because of the proceeds from her hog-raising business. 

Elenita is requesting a loan from ASHI to finance her plan of expanding her hog-raising business. She wished to raise many hogs and sell them in a larger volume to have more gains. Making her business stable would be a great help to the family because her husband's earnings as a hired laborer are sporadic and just small.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for a hog-raising business.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 32, is the mother of three young children who are enrolled in the local public school and who are dependent on her. She is married to Yoeung Chan, 34, who works for a small firm in the building field.

C. is a garment laborer who has been doing her job since she was single, earning a specific salary of $110 a month. She has also been using her income to help solve the family’s financial crisis.

In the paste, C. hired a taxi to go to work or anywhere else because she doesn’t own a vehicle. She right now hopes to avoid the taxi fares and is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation for her family

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar S. lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, Nandintsetseg, attends a local secondary school and his youngest daughter attends kindergarten.

Batbaatar operates a traditional Mongolian boots manufacturing business. His oldest daughter and wife help with his business. He started his business in 2005, then manufacturing only traditional Mongolian boots. Since 2008, he has expanded his product line and has begun to manufacture fancy Mongolian and Buriad boots for his customers.

Batbaatar sells his products at a local market called Uliastai. He and his family have built a loyal customer base because of their good location and excellent service.

Batbaatar is a very hardworking person who has good communication skills. He says, “In the beginning, I was manufacturing traditional Mongolian boots for family use and selling a few leftover boots to local residents. Since that time, the number of people who would like to buy our boots has increased and my business has expanded. Our service and product quality have improved over the past years.”

Batbaatar is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase leather and other necessary materials to manufacture traditional Mongolian boots. This is in anticipation of the upcoming spring, when demand for his products is very high. During the spring his customers' buying power increases because they sell large amounts of cashmere and earn a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase leather and other necessary materials

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
33-year-old Marilyn T. wants to increase the revenue of her business to support the needs of her family and to improve their standard of living. Among her dreams, Marilyn is whimsical about her children graduating from college. 

That is why she is requesting for a loan from ASHI. The loan will be used to finance her plans of expanding her small backyard hog business and its revenues. With this loan, she will be able to augment the small and sporadic income of her husband, who is a hired carpenter.  

Marilyn’s 18-year-old eldest child works as a laborer. He works to help his parents to improve their lives and support the education of his siblings, instead of going to school. He understood that his parents wouldn’t be able to afford to support his education and that of his siblings. Instead of feeling sad about her son’s achievement, Marilyn feels grateful that her eldest child is very responsible. Someday, once her business has grown, she hopes to employ her own child to be her business partner. They will sell their hogs, either alive or slaughtered, in the town’s public market or to the people in their village.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for a hog-raising business.

In 2009, Regina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Regina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lyka Mae's Group

texts.en: Lyka Mae D.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as candies, diapers, sugar, coffee, cotton, baby oil, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 21 years old, single and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Lyka Mae has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Lyka Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lyka Mae is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. Lyka Mae is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Tulips 4". About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M. is a 44-year-old widowed mother who resides in a small house located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Sok M. works on the massage staff of a small club and is able to earn a small salary of $90 per month to meet her family’s daily expenses. She also relies on the income from her three single children (two are garment workers and one is a waiter in a restaurant), while another four of her children are married and have already started new homes.

Sok M.’s children complain that they face a problem with traveling to work because they have no vehicle. Since Sok M. doesn’t have the money to buy one, she has asked for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to use for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her childen to use for commuting

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Cherry owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette E. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Bernadette owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mrs. Man Y. is a humble woman who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns about US$4 per day from selling fresh fish at Chrang Chomres market. Mrs. Man Y. has five children: one is now married and lives outside of the family home, while the other four are no longer in school and are employed at different jobs. She has a life partner in her husband who is shown in the picture above. He assists his wife in delivering fish to the market for sale.

Man Y. has a son who wants to have a life partner in his wife but he needs to hold a wedding party. Because the family doesn’t have enough money yet, Man Y. decided to request a loan of US$1,100 from Kiva lenders to pay for a wedding party for her son.

loans.use: To pay for a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 50 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a food stall, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to increase her working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im T. generates her daily income by delivering smoked fish directly to her client’s houses around her community. She started her business in early 1990 and is able to earn about $3 a day. Im T. is 60 and married with two daughters. The older daughter is working in industry, while the younger is now married. Im T. has a life partner in her husband who is a construction laborer. Im T. is taking out her loan to pay the fee required to connect a new electric line. (Im T. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To pay the fee to connect a new electricity line.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: This loan is for a group that consists of six people from Char village in Kandal province. The group leader is Mrs. Sophea Y., who was selected for that role by all the group members. Each group member will use her loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sophea Y. sells desserts in a local village. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver who earns some money to support their family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sophea Y. is asking for a loan to concrete her house. This couple does not have a child.

loans.use: To concrete her house

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for a group that consists of nine people who live in Stueng Chrov village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sophea K. is the leader of this group, selected by all the members of the group. Each member will use a loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sophea K. sells vegetables in a local market. Her husband, Mr. Choeurn Chey, is a construction worker and a fisherman. Her husband did not have enough fishing supplies to support his work as a fisherman. To improve this business, Mrs. Sophea K. is asking for a loan to buy a boat. She supports three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory. Another is a furniture maker. The third is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Tann Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who live in Stueng Chrov village in Kandal province are asking for a village bank loan. Mrs. Chantha T. is the group leader, selected by all the members. Each member will use a loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Chantha T. sells vegetables and fish in a local market. Her husband, Mr. Saret Ven, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve her business, Mrs. Chantha T. is applying for a loan to buy more fish and morning glory to resell. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school. The others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish and morning glory to resell

loans.name: Kim Ang

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Ang N. lives in An long Ta Sek Kraom village in Kandal province and she was born in 1971. She and her husband, Mr. Khuy Heng Phorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income. So to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Kim Ang N. is finding a loan to buy some piglets to breed to start a new business. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school. The other one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon B. was born in 1959 and now is living in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Lin Khen, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to grow corn to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field is ready to grow corn, but they do not have enough money to support the field. So to improve production, Mrs. Lon B. is requesting a loan to buy corn seed, and fertilizer and hire farm laborers to plow her field. She is the mother of a child who is studying in the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy corn seed and fertilizer and to hire laborers to plow her field

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 53 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con Jarol, de 11 años, en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona de selva.

Su actividad es la venta de productos comestibles en un espacio de su vivienda desde hace 10 años. Lamentablemente no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie, pero eso no la amilana, sino al contrario, le da fuerzas para salir adelante, pues está segura que sus hijos aprovechan su tiempo en actividades favorables para sí mismos.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es atender a sus clientes de una manera cordial que asegure su regreso, por eso este negocio le resulta rentable porque gracias a su buena atención sus ventas son dinámicas.
Para más adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio surtiéndolo de mayor cantidad de mercadería solicitada por sus vecinos, quienes siempre incentivan su trabajo con palabras alentadoras.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y señala que desde que empezó a acceder a los empréstitos siente su progreso; por eso le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son personas muy confiables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Betty is 53 years old. She is the single mother of 5 children, of whom only Jarol, who is 11 years old, lives with her. She lives in her own house, located in a forested region.

For 10 years, her business has been the sale of food products in a space in her house. Unfortunately, she has no one to help her, but this does not intimidate her. On the contrary, it gives her the strength to advance herself, since she is sure that her children make good use of their time in activities that are beneficial to them.

What she likes most about her work is attending to her customers in a cordial manner that assures their return. For this reason, her business is profitable for her, because thanks to her good service, her sales are dynamic.

In the future, she is thinking of expanding her business, stocking it with greater quantities of the merchandise requested by her neighbors, who always motivate her work with encouraging words.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, which indicates that it has noted her progress since it began to grant her loans. For this reason, she likes to work with the members of her community bank, who are very reliable people. With the money that she is seeking, she will buy food products and other basic products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
A sus 38 años, Eusebia continúa luchando por sacar a delante a su familia. Está casada con Andrés de 35 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos; todos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona turística de la selva peruana central.   

Lleva 17 años dedicada a la fabricación de artesanía; como bolsos, collares y pulseras a base de semillas de los diferentes frutos oriundos de su zona. Adicionalmente, junto a su esposo, prepara y vende bebidas de yerbas que son medicina natural. Su puesto de venta está ubicado en la comunidad nativa “Pampa Michi”, donde aún se conserva las costumbres y tradiciones de un pueblo nativo selvático.
Lo que más le gusta es viajar a otras ciudades llevando sus artesanías y medicinas que elabora, pero para disfrutar más de su familia, para más adelante quiere alquilar su stand para ella poder instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que cuida muy bien su historial crediticio para no perder la confianza que se ganó con la entidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará telas especiales para fabricar bolsas, además de yerbas, tallos y hojas para preparar sus medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
At 38 years old, Eusebia continues to fight to get her family ahead. She is married to Andrés, 35, with whom she has 3 children. They all live in their own home, located in the tourist area of the central Peruvian jungle. She has been working in artisanal craft production for 17 years. She makes things such as: bags, necklaces and bracelets made from the seeds of different plants from the area. With her husband, she also makes and sells herbal drinks that are natural medicine. Her stall is located in the native community "Pampa Michi", where the customs and traditions of the native rainforest people is still conserved. What she likes the most is travelling to other cities bringing the artisanal crafts and medicines that she makes. But in order to enjoy her family more, in the future she wants to rent a stand in order to start a food store in her house. This is the third loan that she has had with MFP and she makes sure to take care of her credit history so that she doesn't lose the trust that she has gained with the organization. With the money that she is asking for she will buy special fabrics to make bags with, as well as herbs, stalks and leaves to prepare her natural medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her artisanal crafts

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva P. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Silva owns and operates a clothing business, selling used clothes to local community members. She goes to the city and buys ready to wear used clothing and peddles it in her village. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Silva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Silva is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola, de 29 años, es soltera y madre de Fabricio (6 años), con quien vive en la casa de sus padres y junto a ellos emprendió el negocio de la panadería. 

Elaborar panes de diferentes variedades y biscochos, es su especialidad, lleva 20 años dedicada a esta actividad bajo las enseñanzas de su padre, con quien hasta hoy labora. Asegura que gracias a la rentabilidad de su negocio ha podido implementar aún más la panadería, cubrir los gastos domiciliarios, la educación de su hijo y de ella misma, pues está estudiando Educación Primaria en un instituto de su localidad, viene cursando el séptimo ciclo.
Lo que más le gusta de  su trabajo es repartir los panes y adornar las tortas para ocasiones especiales, pero por otro lado lo más difícil es elaborarlos hasta quedar perfectos. Para su futuro, piensa estudiar chocolatería y repostería para incrementar la venta de pasteles y bocaditos en su establecimiento y lograr que sus ventas sean más constantes y seguras.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, está feliz y entusiasmada de continuar laborando de manera activa en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará los insumos (harina, manteca, azúcar, sal y levadura) necesarios para elaborar mayor cantidad de panes en sus diferentes variedades.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 29 years old. She is single and lives in her parents' home with her son Fabricio, age 6. Working together with her parents, Fabiola started in the bakery business. Making different kinds of bread and sponge cakes is Fabiola's specialty. She has been involved in this line of work for 20 years as an apprentice of her father, with whom she works to this day. Thanks to the profits from the business she has been able to build out the bakery even more as well as cover household expenses, pay for the education of her son as well as for her own - she is studying primary education in a local institute, currently in the seventh term of the program. What she likes best about her work is delivering the bread and decorating the cakes for special occasions. On the other hand, the most difficult part of the job is making the bread and the cakes to perfection. In terms of her future, Fabiola would like to study the craft of making chocolate and other confectionery so that she could increase the sales of pastries and snacks in her establishment and get the business to the point where her sales are more steady and reliable. This is Fabiola's first loan with MFP, she is happy and enthusiastic to continue to work as an active member of her community bank. She plans to use the funds to purchase ingredients (flour, butter, sugar, salt, and yeast) that she needs to be able to make all the different varieties of bread in greater volume.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for baking

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La siempre alegre Felicia tiene 41 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona céntrica de su ciudad.

Buscar estrategias de venta es lo que más le gusta, pues hasta hoy en día y desde hace 20 años viene dedicándose a su tienda de comestibles. La parte difícil de su trabajo es cuando algunas personas piden crédito y luego no quieren pagar o se demoren en los pagos; “me hace perder ganancias”, refiere, pues trabaja con la ayuda de un empleado.
Con el dinero que ha ganado en su negocio logró construir su casa de material noble (ladrillos y cemento), donde tiene implementada su tienda. Ahora viene ahorrando para ampliar su espacio e incrementar su mercadería hasta llegar a ser  una de las distribuidoras de abarrotes más grandes e importantes de su localidad.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy entusiasta de laborar junto a su banco comunal, donde se comprometió a ser puntual y sobre todo responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más comestibles y productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
The always-happy Felicia is 41 years old. She is single and lives alone in her own home located in a central section of her city. Searching for selling strategies is what she likes most, and up till now, and for the past 20 years she's been devoting herself to her food store. The difficult part of her work is when some people ask for credit and then don't want to pay, or are late in their payments "causing her to lose earnings." She works with one employee. With the money she has earned from her business she was able to build her home out of good materials (bricks and mortar), where she also has her store. She has been saving to expand her space and increase her merchandise to the point that she is one of the largest and most important grocery distributors in her neighborhood. This is the first time she's had a loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic to partner with the communal bank, where she's promised to be on time and above all responsible in her payments. With the money she borrows, she will buy more food and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, tiene 44 años, tiene una hija de 27 años, pero recientemente ha iniciando una nueva relación sentimental con Juan (39 años), con quien todavía no tiene hijos. 

Su actividad es la venta de bebidas, golosinas y frutas, productos que ofrece desde su pequeña bodega ubicada en su casa. Hace 25 años que labora sola, sin la ayuda de nadie, por eso le agrada mucho atender cordialmente a sus clientes, quienes siempre regresan por el buen trato que les brinda. Luisa confiesa que sus compradores fieles son las amas de casa, a quienes muchas veces les da crédito para que tengan siempre qué comer en sus casas, pues considera que la ayuda que brinda es retribuida con las ganancias que obtiene.
Actualmente su tienda está fabricada de material rústico (calaminas y madera), por ello viene ahorrando para construir su local de material noble.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra segura de cumplir con los pagos puntualmente como hasta hoy lo vino haciendo. Asimismo, le gusta se parte de su banco comunal, pues todos los socios son responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de primera necesidad (comestibles) para su tienda.
texts.en:
Luisa is 44 years old, has a 27 year old daughter, and has recently started dating Juan (39 years old), with whom she has yet to have children. She works selling drinks, candy, and fruit, products that she sells in her small home-based store. She has worked alone, without anyone's help, for 25 years. Luisa enjoys serving her customers, who always return because of the good service she provides. Luisa tells us that her most loyal customers are housewives, who she sometimes gives credit to so that they always have something to eat in their homes. She believes the help she gives them is paid back in the earnings she makes. Currrently, her store is made of rustic material (calamine and wood) which is why she has been saving to rebuild it with more durable material. This is her third loan with MFP. She is confident that she will make her payments on time, as she has been doing so far. Furthermore, she enjoys been a part of her communal bank as all the members are responsible. The loan she's asking for will be used to purchase more food products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in stock

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves se caracteriza por ser una mujer aguerrida, de corazón noble y sobretodo responsable. Tiene 42 años, está casada con Pablo de 39 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 10 años.

Mientras atiende a su madre, prepara los alimentos que vende entre sus familiares y amigos, aprovechando que todos laboran en instituciones cumpliendo horarios exigentes que no pueden descuidar. De esta actividad, diariamente percibe 30 soles, a parte de la inversión que realiza en los insumos, mientras su esposo trabaja trasportando a personas en su motocarro, por lo que recibe 45 soles diarios.
Nieves lleva 3 años vendiendo comida de lunes a viernes, pero los fines de semana, vende al público en general, y como le va bien, para más adelante quiere comercializar bebidas heladas, chupetes, gelatinas y pasteles, por lo que ya compró la refrigeradora que le servirá como herramienta de trabajo.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre, está segura de pagar cada cuota puntualmente para continuar siendo el ejemplo de las demás socias de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una cocina a gas y terminará de pagar la refrigeradora que adquirió hace algunos días.
texts.en:
Nieves is a strong woman, with a noble heart and above all, she is responsible. Nieves is 42, married to Pablo, 39, and together they have a 10-year old son. While she takes care of her mother, she makes food that sells to her relatives and friends, since they work in institutions with fixed hours that they can't miss. From this daily work she nets 30 sols after paying for the ingredients. Her husband works transporting people in his motocar and makes 45 sols every day. Nieves has been selling food Monday to Friday for 3 years, but on the weekends, she sells to the general public. This is going well and in the future she would like to sell frozen drinks, lollipops, jello and cake. Because of this she bought a refrigerator that serves as a work appliance. This is her third loan with MFP and as always, she is sure to make her payment punctually so that she continues being an example to the other members in the communal bank. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy a gas stove and finish paying for the refrigerator that she bought a few days ago.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a gas stove

loans.name: Orfa Angélica

texts.es: Orfa Angélica S. D. A. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el  municipio D. Izalco, ubicado en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico y junto a sus tres hijos D. 18, 17, y 10 años D. edad. Orfa se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. oro, así mismo comercializa perfumería y productos D. revistas. Su venta esta ubicada en su propia casa, y así mismo con el fin D. poder obtener algunas ganancias extras, ofrece sus productos entre sus vecinos y amigos. El mayor deseo D. Orfa es el D. mejorar sus ganancias y D. esta manera mejorar la estabilidad D. su hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir más en el negocio, comprando diversidad D. perfumes, los cuales son los que poseen mayor demanda. Para Orfa esto representa una gran oportunidad D. salir adelante y mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Orfa Angélica S. D. A., age 35, lives in the Izalco municipality, which is located in the Sonsonate department. She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and their three children. The children are 18, 17, and 10 years old. Orfa sells gold jewelry. She also sells perfume and products from catalogs. She sells from her home. In order to be able to get extra earnings, she also sells her products to her neighbors and friends. Orfa’s greatest wish is to improve her earnings. That way she will improve the household stability. That is why she is requesting a loan, which she will be able to use to invest more in her business. She will buy various perfumes, which are in the greater demand. To Orfa this represents a great opportunity to get ahead and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume

loans.name: Ingreel Geammy

texts.es: Ingreel Geammy H. D. de 22 años de edad, es una joven madre, la cual posee su propia negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación el la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su pequeña hija, su madre quien es un gran apoyo para ella y su hermano. Ingreel se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, así como también productos alimenticios, desde hace dos años que ella trabaja de esta manera en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual también se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a su pequeña hija la cual es el mayor incentivo para Ingreel, ya que ella a su corta edad es madre soltera, por lo que debe trabajar muy arduamente para brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija. Ingreel solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda, comprando productos los cuales aún no posee y así mismo aumentando el número de aquellos que tienen una gran demanda lo cual le permita aumentar sus ventas, lo que es el mayor deseo de Ingreel, puesto que esto le permitirá brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Ingreel Geammy H. D., age 22, is a young mother. She has her own business, which is located in her house. It is in the city of Soyapango in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her little daughter; her mother, who is a great help to her; and her brother. Ingreel sells basic needs items for the home. She also sells food products. She has been working in her house this way for two years. She also does the household chores and takes care of her little daughter. Her daughter is Ingreel’s greatest incentive. At her young age, she is a single mother. She needs to work arduously in order to provide her daughter with all of the necessities. Ingreel is asking for a loan to have the money she needs to invest in the store. She will buy products that she still does not have. She will also increase the number of products for which she has a great demand. This will allow her to increase her sales, which is Ingreel’s greatest wish. This will allow her to give her daughter a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Marta María

texts.es: Marta María R. H. de 34 años de edad, reside en Pasaquina, ubicado en el departamento de La Unión. Marta es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora quien vela por el bienestar de su familia día y noche, ya que su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos, razón por la que ella sola se encarga de sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marta posee un comedor en el cual se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos, el cual esta ubicado frente a la Alcaldía de Pasaquina, lugar el cual cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas, lo que beneficia a Marta en gran manera. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, tales como: verduras, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frutas y otros más, todo con el enorme deseo de aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta María R. H. is 34 years old. She lives in Pasaquina, which is located in the La Unión department. Marta is a very strong woman. She is a hard-working person who watches out for her family’s well-being day and night. Her husband lives in the United States, which is the reason she is raising her two minor children alone. Her children go to school. Marta has a restaurant, and she sells breakfasts and lunches. It is located in front of the mayor’s office in Pasaquina. There are a lot of people there, and that is of great benefit to Martha. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of raw material to make the food. She will buy things like vegetables, rice, beans, sugar, fruit, and other things. She does all of this with a great desire to increase her sales. This way she will give her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food

loans.name: Ada July

texts.es: Ada July P. G. de 27 años de edad, de 27 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 5 y 11 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, entre los productos que ella comercializa están: las cremas para el cabello, cremas desmaquilladoras, perfumes y otros más. Todas sus ventas son hechas a crédito, por lo que Ada solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para aumentar sus productos, ya que en muchas ocasiones ella no posee  la capacidad económica de comprar todos los productos que le solicitan lo cual es una gran pérdida para Ada, quien desea aprovechar al máximo sus ventas. Ella es una mujer muy responsable la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos, ya que es muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Ada July P. Guzman is 27 years old. She lives in San Francisco Goteras, in the Department of Morazan. Ada and her husband have two children, ages 5 and 11. Ada sells cosmetics, including hair creams, make-up removers, perfumes, etc. All her sales are made on credit; this loan will give her the money to increase her inventory. Ada often lacks the resources to buy all the products her customers request, so she ends up losing business. However, she is a very responsible woman with a number of good references from customers and neighbours, and she works very hard.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Kech's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kech Khun is 44 years old and is the leader of a group loan. She was selected by four members who are located in Char village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Kech Khun and her husband, Mr. Sok Son, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow vegetables for a living. Mrs. Kech Khun is now requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a house. This couple has five children; one is seamstress in a garment factory, one is a barber and the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To add her savings to build a house.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela H. A. de 33 años de edad, posee una venta de zapatos deportivos y formales para mujeres y niñas, las cuales comercializa en la zona urbana de San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual también vive junto a su esposo quien es comerciante y junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad quienes se dedica atrabajar. La zona en la cual se encuentra María con su negocio es un lugar muy apto para este tipo de ventas ya que no existen muchos almacenes formales  por lo que las personas en su mayoría deben comprar en estos lugares, así también son de bajo costo, lo cual las personas buscan. Este negocio es fundamental para la economía familiar de María, ya que representa gran parte de los ingresos los cuales son utilizados para todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos, lo que le permita ofrecer mayor variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Ángela H. A., 33 years old, sells sports shoes and clothes for women and children. She sells them in the urban zone of San Francisco Goteras, located in the Morazán department, a location where she lives together with her husband, a businessman, and their two small children who work. The zone where María works is very apt for her business, as there aren't many formal stores and so the majority of residents must buy from María. These sales represent the greatest part of her earnings, and are used to cover household costs. María is seeking a loan to purchase a greater quantity of shoes, which will allow her to offer a greater variety of styles and colours to her clients and in this way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes and women's clothing

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rem U. is a 25-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Preak Ta Thok village in Kandal province. Mrs. Rem U. is a leader of a group loan. She was selected by the nine group members. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Rem U. is a pig breeder at home. For her pig business, Mrs. Rem U. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Noeun Soem is an iron welder who earns a small income to support his family. This couple has two children; one is attending a local school and youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Omed Group

texts.en:
Rohullah is a member of the Omed group. He is a 55-year-old man who lives in district 3 of Nangarhar province. He has three kids and they are all in school.

He has a retail shop. Currently he has some financial problems. Due to that, he wants to take a loan to buy some essential materials for his retail shop that have more demand in the market. This will allow him to increase his business income and solve his financial problems. He would like to thanks to both AFS and Kiva lenders for their helpful process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: They want to complete their stocks

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla M. is 43 years old and was selected by 10 group members to be the village bank president. She lives in the village of Koh Chamroeun in the Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use their part for different purposes. Mrs. M. owns a small store where she sells groceries. Mrs. M. decided to ask for a loan so she would be able to buy more groceries to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Khut, is a construction worker. He earns a small salaR. to support his family's living situation. The couple has three children; one is attending a local school, while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more groceries

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sim Y. is 37 years old and lives in the village of Chamka Doung in the Kandal province. Mrs. Sim Y. was selected by five members to be the leader of the group loan. Each of the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sim Y. and her husband, Mr. Sean Soeun, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow crops for a living. Aside from farming, Mr. Sean Soeun is a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Sim Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies. This couple has a child who is a student in a local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies.

loans.name: Shokirdjon

texts.en:
S. Shokirdjon is 30 years old and married with two children. Shokirdjon runs his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located in the market. He has been in this business for six years. On average he serves 30-40 clients a day. He tries to use only the best ingredients in his café. The business is stable and brings considerable income for the family. 

Shokirdjon is planning to expand his business to earn more money. He is requesting a loan of $2000 to purchase meat and coal for his café. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Shokirdjon wants to thank everyone who is supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy meat and coal for his shish kebab café

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Say T. is 59 years old and was selected to be the leader of a four-person group loan. She lives in the village of Lech Buon in the Kandal province. With the loans, the members hope to increase their incomes in order to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Say T. is a fruit seller who earns a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Heng Pen, is farmer who owns a plot of land where he grow crops for a living. Even with both businesses, they still earn too little income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Say T. wants to start a new chicken-breeding business. She decided to ask for a loan so she could build a chicken house for breeding. This couple has three children: One is seamstress in a garment factory, one stays at home, and the last one is a student and also supports the parents' business.

loans.use: To build a chicken house.

loans.name: Parwana Ahmad Shah Group

texts.en:
Shafiqa wants to take out a loan for her business of quilt sewing. She is 46 years old and lives with four children in District 8, Kabul, Afghanistan. She has been involved in her business for a very long time – more than 18 years. She learned the skill of quilt sewing from her mother. She wants to develop her business. She needs the loan to purchase materials like nice colors of cloth, thread and so on. She hopes for more progress in the future.

Shafiqa is the leader of Parwana A. Shah Group.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
W. Aisha is a good-humored widow with one child in secondary school. After her husband’s demise, she found herself at a hard crossroads. She had to go to any length to conjure up a way of making her family’s ends meet on the little money her husband had left as savings.

The turn in her tide occurred when Aisha began her cosmetics sales business eight years ago in Mpigi church center. Her good hospitality has been her winning recourse and she makes 120,000 shillings a month.

Aisha’s dream is to solidify and expand her business. She also wants to see to it that her child studies up to the university level. With this loan she wants to be in a position to buy more cosmetics for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics like creams and body lotions for her shop

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
For ten years, Damalie N., 40 years old, has been selling cheap secondhand clothing in Mpigi. For this divorced mother of six, life has been about counting the few blessings that have shown forth in her daily life while trying to make ends meet.

What stands out about Damalie is her resilience and unwavering hard-work attitude. Though she has been saddled with a myriad of operational cost challenges over the years, she has stood firm in the provision of welfare to her six orphaned children and three other dependents.

Damalie started her business after the demise of her husband. Though she was destitute and in a dilemma, it was incumbent upon her to shoulder her dead husband’s responsibilities because, as is the case in Africa, once a man dies, his children bear the brunt, especially if he was poor.

Damalie’s diligence was her only empowering recourse in such a wit’s-end situation. She, with the help of friends, began her business selling secondhand clothes to extricate herself from such adversity. On the face of it, it was not the wrong decision. As it is now her growing business brings her close to 54,000 shillings a week.

Damalie is anticipating opening new horizons for her business in the future by setting up her own shop. With this loan, she is optimistic that her prospects will improve. She says she will buy increased stocks of secondhand garments.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Akhludin

texts.en:
E. Akhludin is 55 years old and married with three children. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land in his village where he grows different kinds of crops like wheat, potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He has been in this business since 1995. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labor and to expand the business, Akhludin would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Sayllap Group

texts.en:
Abdul Aziz has a small shop selling mobile cards. He is married with four children and he is responsible for paying their school fees and expenses. Every morning he wakes up early and goes out to his shop to start his work. He has been involved in this business for three years and wants to expand it. He needs this loan to purchase more mobile cards. He is a very hardworking man and he is confident that he will progress soon.

Abdul Aziz is the leader of Sayllap Group. He lives in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He reA. admires this loan process.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima is 33 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family lives in Shahrituz, Southern Tajikistan. Rahima sells clothes for men, and has been in this trade for many years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. 

Rahima is hoping to take out a loan of $800 to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
This is K. Bahrom, who is married with three children. He has a retail shop and supports his family with this business. Bahrom sells spare parts for foreign cars like Mercedes-Benz and Opel. He has been involved in this business for more than nine years. He provides the cars with spare parts and his family with the necessary food and needs. Bahrom has a great demand for these spare parts so he wants to stock more in order to fulfill the requests of his clients. He wants to take out an individual loan of 6,600 TJS to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family. Bahrom is happy about this loan and would like to thank everyone for their trust and support.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Boimurod

texts.en:
M. Boimurod is 30 years old. He is a dynamic and ambitious young man - very professional and focused on his business. He sells cement, whitewash and other construction materials. Boimurod has been in this business for four years and gained a lot of experience. He has a special warehouse where he keeps his goods in safety. He knows how to save cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate. All this allows Boimurod to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family.

Knowing that the price of cement is low but will increase soon for sure, he wants to purchase more goods for saving. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $2000. Earned money from his business will be used for his own wedding. Boimurod expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.
