Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kuteesa Women's Group, Kampala

texts.en:
On the face of it, N. Rehema’s seven-year-old hardware business in Kiseka Market, Kampala, is a beehive of activity. She has mostly been selling car spare-parts since she began.

Rehema is a married woman with three children. In keeping with her parental responsibilities, she has gone to all extremes to give her children an education through earnings from her business. Her stock in trade factor has been her resilient hard-work ethic. With this in tow, she has managed to get into a profit stride of 70,000 shillings a month.

Rehema’s dream is to transform her business into a wholesale franchise with the assistance of this loan. With this loan she wants to buy more car spare-parts like shock-absorbers and engines.

loans.use: To purchase more car spare-parts for her business

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en:
Musharraf J. is a 48 year old woman. She is married with 4 children. Since Musharraf has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and also breeding sheep. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. Musharraf currently has 5 cows which she will fatten for some time to later sell them. With the loan she wants to buy additional young cattle and feed for the animals. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience I. is a 33 years old, single and ambitious. She owns a pharmacy where she sells different medicines, and she is a certified nurse. She has been in this business for six years. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She sends a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more river fish and cray fish to sell

loans.name: Adom Ahenwa Trust Group

texts.en:
Kenneth is a hard-working man and resourceful on behalf of his family. He is married to a petty trader who sells cereals and together they have four children who are from age 2-12. He is also a trader who purchases brand-new motorcycles from importers and sells them to customers. Motorcycles are one of the most common means of transport in the middle and northern parts of Ghana, hence selling motorcycles is a lucrative job for traders. He also purchases cows from the northern part of the country and sells them to butchers and restaurant operators.  Kenneth and his wife want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

Kenneth is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Adom Ahenwa”, (translated as 'The Seat of Grace'), made up of nine members. The other members are engaged in trades such as manufacturing, baking, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major bread winners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase motorbikes and cow for resale

loans.name: Onokwafo Nyame Trust Group

texts.en:
Abena B. is a lovely and hard-working woman. She is married to a cobbler and together they have three children. She is now thirty-eight years old. 

Abena lives together with her family in a family house at Sunyani, where she also does her trading. She is able to provide support to her family’s financial needs through the sale of 'kenkey'. Kenkey is one of Ghanaians' favorite local dishes that is rich in carbohydrates. It is prepared with corn dough made into balls, cooked 1-2 hours, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. It could also be enjoyed with other sauces. 'Kenkey' is known throughout all the tribes in Ghana and commonly sold on most streets.  'Kenkey' is a heavy diet and much preferred over beverages by people who do manual drudgery. Selling for the past 16 years, Abena has attracted quite a number of regular customers through good customer relations. 

Abena is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Onokwafo Nyame” (translated as 'Faithful God'), made up of six members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as foodstuff selling, 'kenkey' selling, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are requesting the loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, vegetables, fish etc.  in bulk

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman A. is a 32 year old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and four children. Ayman opened his own grocery store back in 2008, when he realized that there were no stores of this kind in their local area. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy all the products he lacks for his store, which will bring in more customers, and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy the products he lacks for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plumbing materials to sell

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine M. was born in 1976. She lives in Koti Village, in the Tavush area, with her family, which consists of her husband and four children. Since 1994, Marine has been engaged in breeding swine and poultry, husbandry, and growing tobacco plants. She says that farming is very labor-intensive, but not very profitable. Marine’s husband helps her in farming and they keep their family with the income they earn by farming. Marine intends to begin bee-keeping as well. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 Armenian dramas (AMD) to enable her to buy some beehives, which will help her increase her family's income.     

Marine is third-cycle borrower from Nor Horizon, and she has never been delinquent on her repayments.

loans.use: To buy beehives

loans.name: Possible Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Yaw S. is a 30-year-old 'Kente' seller at Domeabre near Mampong. He is a father of 2 and calls himself a trustworthy and hard-working young man. 'Kente' is one of the traditional cloths that depict the rich culture of the Asanti in particular and Ghana as a whole. Each design has its own interpretation as per Asante culture. 

Yaw sellers different kinds of 'Kente' cloth and has a vision of setting up his own factory at Mampong so he can employ workers to weave his products for export to Europe. He currently buys from weavers on whom he depends for his supplies.  He desires to give his two kids a good education so they can be gainfully employed in future.

'Possible Trust bank' has a membership of four and all are into the sale of 'Kente' cloth. Yaw, the leader of the group, was elected because of his hard work. The entire membership intend to use the loan to purchase more 'Kente' cloth so as to gain more customers.

loans.use: To purchase Kente cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more paints and painting brushes to sell

loans.name: Siama Mma Trust Group

texts.en:
Yaa M. describes herself as truthful, a woman who faces reality. She is 50 years old and is the leader of the “Siama Mma” borrower group. Yaa lives in Goaso and sells dried fish in the new market in town. She has been running her fish business for 10 years. Yaa is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase two large basket of dried fish. 

Yaa is married to a farmer and together they have seven children. She hopes to sell enough fish to be able to provide good education for all of her children, hopefully through university level. 

As the leader of the "Siama Mma" borrower group, Yaa ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments. The other women in Yaa’s group operate businesses selling various foodstuffs, groceries, pastries etc. They are requesting the loan to support their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish in large baskets

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 38 years old, married, and a father of three. He sells suitcases in a very competitive environment. He uses part of his income to pay wages to his employee and saves some in a group in Faulu Kenya called Forty In One. He was previously guaranteed a loan by the group members and used the loan to improve his business. He started the business ten years ago and hopes to venture into a van transport business in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy more suitcases for sale.

loans.use: To buy suitcases to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and married with two school-aged children. He provides motorbike transport for a living and has employed two people.  He also grows cabbages for sale. Previously, he was selling clothes to earn a living. Joseph is a member of Woni Astol group in Faulu Kenya, whose aim is to guarantee each other's loans.

Joseph joined this group so that he could easily access loans. The group members meet weekly and they save their money and share business ideas. Joseph has benefited from the group because he has been empowered to work hard in his business. He wants to buy a new motorbike so as to serve more customers, hence he requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to buy a lorry in the future for transporting sand. He believes that the lorry transport business pays more than the motorbike business. Joseph describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 36 years old, married and a father of three. He has been running "Titanic Cutz Base barber shop" for ten years and has four employees. Since he joined Faulu Kenya under a group called Mathare Umoja, he has started tailoring, employed more people, and educated his children because his business has improved. He has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to renovate his business premises. His group members have guaranteed the loan. He believes that if he renovates his business premises, he will be able to attract more customers. He hopes to complete building his rental houses and begin renting them out.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 70 years old and married to a farmer. He has been operating a shop in his area for ten years. He also rents out houses to earn more income for supporting his family. He was previously employed as a civil servant. He has five children who he has seen through school. He belongs to Kwa Mbemba group in Faulu Kenya. He has been guaranteed a loan of Kes. 40, 000 by his group members. He wants to use this loan to add stock of maize flour, salt, and soaps. He hopes to build more rental houses in the future and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, salt and soaps.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa A. is a 27 year old, married man, from Gaza. He lives with his wife and two children. Alaa opened his own clothes store back in 2008, when he realized that there were no stores of this kind in their local area. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy new types of clothes, which will bring in more customers, and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new types of fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, bags, and jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius M. M. is 35 years old and married, with three children. His wife is a farmer and they hope to give their children a quality education to the university level. His business is located at Kiganjo, a busy residential area in Thika, and it is well known by the name "Kimuchu Bodaboda". He gives boda boda (motorcycle) transport services to the local people. He says that business is good but the major challenge is bad roads. He is using his loan of KES 40,000 to buy another motorcycle to expand his business. He describes himself as hardworking and social.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plantains and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun is a 44 year old commercial dairy farmer. He also runs a retail business in his local market. Since he joined Lenres group in Faulu Kenya which consists of business persons, he has become focused and determined in his business. The group members support each other by guaranteeing loans. He has requested a loan of Kes.80,000 from Faulu Kenya, to buy a dairy cow and a calf, which the group members have guaranteed. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a calf.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David K. M. is 27 years old and married with one child, 2 years old, to whom they hope to give a good education. His business is located in Kiganjo,a residential area in Thika. He runs a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business for the local people. He has been in this business for the last five years. He says the business is good but the only major challenge is bad roads. He says that he would like to expand the business and that is why he is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy another motorcycle. He wants to enlarge his business and have more children. He is a very hardworking, cheerful and social man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 39 years old and has been farming for six years. She does dairy farming and also grows tea for sale. She has three cows and sells her milk to a company called Fresha Dairy Co-operative. Beatrice is a member of gathiraini B self help group which consists of farmers. In this group she is able to get some knowledge of farming methods. The group members have guaranteed her a loan of Kes.70, 000 to buy animal feed and farm inputs. She hopes to have a well established business in the future. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Soforaal Group

texts.en:
The group "Soforaal" (meaning "to support one another" in Diola, the local language) is a solidarity group of the "Banc Villageois" TAMBACOUMBA from the Casamance region in Senegal. The six women who are part of the group mainly work as seafood retailers, though most women in this region have multiple occupations. The group has existed since 2002, when the "Banc Villageois" was founded. So far, the members have received 16 loans each, all of which they repaid in time to Caurie Microfinance, one of Kiva's Fieldpartners in Senegal.

Dédé Kanté is the leader of the group: she is 57 years old, widowed and responsible for four children (three boys and one girl). Market gardening is her main activity and most important source of revenues. Besides this, she sells fish as a second occupation to earn some extra money. She purchases the fish in the villages of Tambacoumba or Adéane and sells them at the market of Adéane at the border of the Casamance River in Senegal. Dédé Kanté is very experienced in this domain. Her daughter supports her in this business.

As a widow, Madame Kanté needs the money from her two activities to cover health and food expenses for herself and the children she's responsible for.

loans.use: To purchase new seafood to resell.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin is a 27 year old entrepreneur from Surallah, South Cotabato. He is still single and wants to take this opportunity to save for his future. He says that he also works hard to help provide for his family. He works at the farm and also raises some pigs. He wants to have his own family and he hopes to have a stable income by then.

Alvin became a member of CEVI in 2008. He used his previous loans to sustain the farm he tills and the pigs that he raises. He is now applying for a loan of PHP 15,000, which he will use to buy farm inputs and feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and feed.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella grows pigs and also owns a small fish pond. This is where she generates income. To meet some of her family’s daily needs, she opened a small store where she sells noodles, soap and other merchandise. She is married and has three children. Despite having multiple businesses, she makes sure to spend quality time with her family. 

Bella hopes to succeed in her ventures. She joined CEVI in 2007 so she would have financial support for her business. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy feed for the fish and pigs. She will also buy materials for her fish pond.

loans.use: To buy feed for fish and pigs.

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Marta Irene tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 pues siempre se ha preocupado por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene a su cargo a sus hijos, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle lo más necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido caminar largas distancias para ofrecer la variedad de productos que ofrece, ya que solo así puede obtener nuevos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para trajes, cosméticos, calzado y vestidos. Siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda en donde sus clientes se encuentren mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Marta Irene has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and she has always made sure she makes her payments in time. Marta has her children in her care, and always worries about providing them with all the necessary things. Her economic activity is the sale of general groceries. One of her biggest challenges has been walking the long distances to offer the variety of products that she offers, as this is the only way she can get new clients. The loan she is seeking is for working capital and to purchase suits, cosmetics, shoes and clothes. Marta has always dreamt of having a shop where her clients can be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Solitarias Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SOLITARIAS ES GRUPO DE PERSONAS QUE ESTA CONFORMADA DE 3 SOCIAS MUY TRABAJADORAS Y RESPONSABLES.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. LIZ  SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO SE DEDICA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD VARIOS AÑOS VISITA A LOS CLIENTES EN SU OFICINA, EN SUS DOMICILIOS Y TAMBIEN EN LA CALLE, ESTA ES SU UNICA FUENTE DE TRABAJO, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENE A SU FAMILIA, ELLA VIVE EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES CON SUS HERMANOS, LA SRA. LIZ ES MUY TRABAJADORA COMENZO A TRABAJAR DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA PARA AYUDAR AL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA Y DE SUS  HERMANOS, CON EL DINERO DLE CREDITO COMPRARA COSMETICOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN PROMOSION PARA DESPUES VENDERLOS AL PRECIO ORIGINAL.

LA SRA . SIMONA VENDE ROPA AL IGUAL QUE LA SRA. FLORENCIA  SUS PUESTOS SON A UNA CUADRA DE LA OFICINA DE SACABA SON AMIGAS DE MUCHO TIEMPO , EL PRESTADO SERA DESTINADO AL AUMENTO DE CAPITAL YA QUE CON ESO PODRAN OBTENER MAS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SUS FAMILIAS ESE  ES EL MAYOR DESEO DE ELLAS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The “Solitarias” is a group of three responsible working women. The president is Liz who sells cosmetics from catalogs and has been doing so for several years. She visits her customers in their offices, homes, and in the street. She only has this one job in order to support her family. She lives in her parents’ house with her siblings. Liz is a hard worker who started to work when she was very little to help support her family. With the money from this loan, she will buy cosmetics that will be used to advertise her products. Afterwards, she will sell them at cost. Simona and Florencia both sell clothing. Their clothing stands are on the same block and they have been friends for a long time. The loan will be use buy merchandise in order to increase their sales. This will allow them to improve the quality of life for their families, each of the women’s primary interest. These two women very much appreciate Emprender and Kiva for the confidence this loan brings them.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Heyd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Raphan

texts.en: Raphan is a 40 year old father of three. He earns a living from dairy farming. He lives in the Kiambu area in a slum. He has been doing dairy farming since 2007 and has employed one person who milks his cows. Raphan is also employed as a casual laborer who does carpentry and construction. He has a membership with Ruturu farmers in Faulu Kenya. Through this group, his standard of living has changed because his business has improved since he has been taught new farming methods. He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy animal feed and build a cow shed. He hopes to build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and build a cow shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electrical accessories and  stationery to sell

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: Felipe Santiago de 64 años de edad. El tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. La actividad económica de Felipe es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 36 años que se dedica a este negocio. el inicia este negocio porque no tenía suficiente ingresos para sufragar los gastos de su familia, a Felipe le encanta su trabajo ya que se distrae recorriendo las calles y además conversa con sus clientes por lo que tiene la facilidad de ofrecerles una tarjeta para que puedan contactarlo. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo así podrá comprar ciertos repuestos necesarios. El desea seguir adelante con su actividad.
texts.en:
Felipe Santiago is 64 years old. He has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. Felipe's economic activity is a taxi service. He has been in this business for more than 36 years. He started this businesss because he didn't have enough income to pay his family's expenses. Felipes loves his job since it is interesting to drive through the streets and he talks to his clients. This is why he is able to give them a card so that they can contact him. He is asking for this financing for working capital to be able to purchase some necessary replacement parts. He wants to continue with this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: D. Éric

texts.fr: O. D. Éric est né le 04 Janvier 1978 à Savè, dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Marié à SEDJAME Gislaine, une revendeuse, Éric est père de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Éric vit avec ses enfants et sa femme au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis près de cinq ans. Éric subvient en grande partie aux différents besoins de sa famille. Éric a fréquenté l'école et s'est arrêté à l'université. C'est un instituteur, qui exerce en plus de sa profession, la vente du charbon de bois à son domicile. Cette autre activité l'aide à subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Éric s'approvisionne à Savè. C'est la deuxième fois que Éric sollicite un appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. Le premier crédit que Éric a obtenu de ALIDé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Éric O. was born January 4, 1978 in Savè in the district of Collines in Benin. He is married to Gislaine Sedjame, a stockist. The couple has five children and a few attend school. Éric has lived for 5 years with his wife and his children in the neighborhood Agbalilamè in the village of Sèmè-Podji. Éric provides for a large part of his family's needs. He did attend school, but did not go to university. He is a teacher, but supplements his income by also selling wood coal from his home. These sales have helped him provide for his family without many problems. Éric gets his provisions from Savè. This is the second time that he has sought financial aid through ALIDé, with the goal of building up his business and to increase sales. The first loan that Éric recieved through ALIDé was repayed in full.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of wood coal.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel tiene 43 años, esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de ladrillos. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, su negocio tiene mucho tiempo de permanecer en la familia, es así que ha luchado por mantener esta actividad. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima que será utilizado para la fabricación de sus productos. El deseo de Víctor es mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is 43 years old. This is not his first experience with financing; working with Fundacion has been a big help. His economic activity is making and selling bricks. He has been in this business for more than 31 years. Since he has three children to take care of, his business has been in his family for a long time. That is why he has fought to maintain this activity. Presently, he is asking for this financing for working capital in order to buy the raw materials that will be used to manufacture his products. Victor wants to improve his income to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: Y. Estelle est née le 16 Septembre 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à LANDEDJI Landry, un plombier, Estelle est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leurs enfants. C'est depuis une vingtaine d'année que Estelle vit au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou. Estelle vit dans ce quartier avec son mari et ses enfants. Estelle assure avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Estelle a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis près de onze ans, Estelle mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, savons, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, piles, bougies, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Estelle vend également du charbon de bois. Estelle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a toujours bien remboursés ses crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Estelle voudrait augmenter davantage son stock de produits et faire face à la concurrence. C'est donc pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, que Estelle sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Estelle Y. was born on September 16, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Landry Landedji, a plumber, and is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. In addition to their own children, the couple also takes care of another child. Estelle has been living in the Finagnon district in Cotonou for some twenty years. She lives there with her husband and children. She and her husband jointly take care of various family expenses. Estelle left school at the secondary level. For more than eleven years, she has been selling various products (such as canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, soap, sugar, pasta, batteries, candles etc) out of her home. As a secondary activity, she also sells wood charcoal. Estelle has been a client of ALIDé in the past and always reimbursed her loans well. In response to the growing customer demand, Estelle would like to enlarge her stock and become more competitive. And thus, to better satisfy her customers’ needs, she is seeking a new loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various products such as sardines, milk, soap, sugar, pasta etc [for resale]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E.  is a 45 years old.  She is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 6 children. Mercy’s children are doing well at school and this is her joy as a mother. She owns a restaurant where she sells mouth watering  Nigerian cooked food. Mercy loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. 

Mercy says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Famiyi Pascaline

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Famiyi Pascaline est mariée à FABI Emmanuel. Famiyi Pascaline est mère de quatre enfants, qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. La famille habite au quartier Kpakpakanmè à Cotonou depuis près de neuf ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Famiyi Pascaline n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Famiyi Pascaline mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers, mais également la vente de farine de blé et de farine de manioc à son domicile. Famiyi Pascaline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Famiyi Pascaline a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l'optique de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Famiyi Pascaline sollicite un troisième prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. A. Famiyi Pascaline is married to Mr. FABI Emmanuel and is the mother of four children, who are all in school and who live together with their parents. The family has been living in the Kpakpakanmè district in Cotonou for nearly nine years. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Famiyi Pascaline attended primary school only. For about ten years, she has been running a business selling staple foods but also sells wheat flour and cassava flour out of her home. She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already benefited from two loans from ALIDé that have all been repaid. With regard to bolstering her business and satisfying her customers further, she is requesting a third loan, so as to increase her stock of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains (corn) and wheat flour

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: Alma Nubia tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y atiende un kiosco. Este negocio lo inicio hace más 7 años, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarles a sus hijos lo que más necesitan. Ella disfruta mucho de este negocio, pues cuando inicio no tenia este pequeño Kiosco ahora tiene un puesto para ofrecer sus productos y así sus clientes puedan disfrutar. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, frutas, jugos, gaseosas y sopas en cajas. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para tener una fuente ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia, 42, has 3 children. She operates a food stand, a business that she has worked at for more than 7 years. For all that time, she has thought of little but providing her children with the things that they most need. She likes the business very much. She didn't have the food stand when she first started but now she has a place to sell her dishes and where her customers can come to enjoy them. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, sweets, fruit, juices, soft drinks and boxed soups. Her goal is to continue investing in the business so that she can establish a steady source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela U. is 25 years old and  single. She runs a medicine store where she sells various kinds of medicines. Angela has been in this business for over two years. Angela says her business is moving fine, and with the profit derived she is able to take care of her needs and to continue the business. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Angela says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
Augusta pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 50 años y es natural de Lamay.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 
Su principal actividad económica es vender comestibles en su domicilio. Ya son 22 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.  Su actividad económica complementaria es administrar su cabina de internet. Ella requiere el préstamo para ampliar el local de la cabina de internet y comprar una computadora personal. El sueño de la socia es abrir un hotel.     

Augusta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Augusta belongs to the commercial bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley), which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 50 years old, and is a native of Lamay. Currently she lives in the city of Calca. Her main economic activity is selling food from her home. She has had this business for 22 years, and it is going very well. In addition, she also has an internet cafe. She needs a loan to expand the premises of her internet cafe, and to buy a personal computer. Her dream is to open a hotel. August is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the premises of her internet cafe, and to buy a computer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 4 años se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes, cuidando y limpiando sus galpones. Para ella este negocio le es muy rentable, por eso cada día intensifica la crianza D. estos animales, en donD. selecciona la calidad y genero para la venta. Pasado un tiempo determinado, solo venD. los cuyes machos D. edad joven, por tener la carne más suave y rica. El trabajo que realiza  le permite  estar en su casa, puesto que tiene inquilinos, ya que le es importante la seguridad. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar la reproducción D. los cuyes para incrementar sus ganancias. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. nuevos cuyes, además D. comprar forraje para estos animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, and she lives with her husband. For more than four years she has worked raising guinea pigs, caring for them and cleaning their sheds. Guinea pigs are a common food in the region. This business is very profitable for her, which is why she is raising more animals every day. She selects them for quality and their gender and sells them. She only sells young male guinea pigs, so that they have the more tender and flavorful meat. Her job allows her to work from home, where she has renters, and she is concerned with security. Her greatest hope is to continue growing the production of guinea pigs and thus increase her earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and it will help her improve her business. With the loan money she will buy more guinea pigs and animal feed for them.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs and food for raising those animals

loans.name: Los Toritos Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO LOS TORITOS ESTA FORMADO POR TRES INTEGRANTES, LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES, DIMAMICAS Y TRABAJADORAS.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. ALICIA TIENE CASA PROPIA LA COMPRO CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, TIENE UN PUESTO D. VENTA DOND. OFRECE SUS RIQUISIMOS PLATILLOS, GENERALMENTE SUS CLIENTES SON LOS CHOFERES QUE HACEN SU PARADA EN SU PUESTO CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS E INGREDIENTES PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS RIQUISIMAS COMIDAS.

EL SR. GUSTAVO Y LA SRA. MARIA   TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN A ESTA ACTIVIDAD D. LA VENTAS D. HAMBURGUESAS Y SALCHIPAPAS POR LAS NOCHES, ES UN  GRUPO MUY CONOCIDO TODOS ELLOS POR LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZAN EN EL CENTRO D. SACABA POR LA VARIEDAD D. PLATOS QUE PREPARAN CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARAN INGREDIENTES PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS PLATILLOS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The “Los Toritos” group is maD. up of three dynamic, hard working, and responsible members. Alicia is the group’s president. She has her own home which she bought with a lot of effort and hard work. She sells food and offers a variety of delicious dishes. Most of her customers are drivers who stop at her stall. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients. Gustavo and Maria also sell food. They sell hamburgers and “salchipapas” in the evening. They are very well known in the city center, for the variety they offer. They will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients. They are all grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have place in them in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Estrellas De Atipiri Group

texts.es:
Nora H. integrante de la Asociación Comunal  Estrellas de Atipiri, del Centro Focal  Senkata, tiene 25 años y  es soltera, ella vive  en la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente en la zona Senkata, tiene el negocio de venta de cocinas  en la zona 12 de Octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, contando con un lugar propio de venta y necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.

Las demás integrantes  de esta Asociación  tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, cosméticos, producción de aguayo (tela colorida que se utiliza para cargar bebes), atención de tienda, transportista.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Nora H., a member of the Stars of Atipri Community Association from the Senkata Center, is 25 years old and single. She lives in the city of El Alto, specifically in the Senkata area. She has a business selling kitchen products in the 12th of October neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She has her own shop and needs the loan to purchase merchandise. The other members of the this association have different businesses like clothing sales, cosmetics, making aguayo (a colored fabric used to carry babies), and a taxi driver. They are all requesting loans to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Oby

texts.en: Oby C. is 36 years of age and the mother of 4 children. She produces and sells cellophane bags which are used for packaging of bread and other products. She has been in the business for 10 years. Her husband helps her in the business before going to his own business place. Oby hopes for a loan of NGN70, 000 to purchase more materials to produce more cellophane bags to sell to increase her business profit. Oby thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: A. Véronique est née en 1975 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à ZANNOU Thimonté, un revendeur, Véronique est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Véronique vit ensemble avec sa petite famille au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de treize ans que Véronique habite dans ce quartier. Véronique partage avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Véronique n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Véronique vend divers produits alimentaires (biscuits, bombons, lait, etc.) de façon ambulante, mais aussi à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Véronique vend des chaussures. Véronique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Mais Véronique achète ses chaussures à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Véronique est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Véronique désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et renforcer surtout son activité de vente de chaussures. C'est la raison pour laquelle Véronique sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
A. Véronique was born in 1975 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County. Married to ZANNOU Thimonté, a retailer, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her small family in the Avotrou district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For almost thirteen years, she has been living in this district. She and her husband share in covering the various family expenses. Véronique never attended school. To meet her needs and to provide for her family, she sells a variety of food items (cookies, candy, milk, etc.) from place to place but also out of her home. As a side business, she sells footwear. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She buys her shoes in Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already had three loans, which have all been repaid. She would like to increase her stock of goods and to bolster her business in particular for selling shoes. For these reasons, Véronique is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of cookies, candy, and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs (plantains and palm oil) to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
Raymunda se levanta muy temprano para vender desayuno en L. puerta D. un colegio cerca a su casa lo hace con L. ayuda D. sus hijos además venD. gaseosas y golosinas que le dan ingresos extras para solventar sus gastos diarios, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en L. compra D. gaseosas y golosinas y llenar su mostrador D. productos..
Hace 15 años L. Sra. Rosa aperturo una tienda en su casa pero viendo las necesidades D. sus vecinos apertura un foto estudio además una librería esto L. ayudo mucho ya que con las ganancias ayuda con L. educación D. sus 5 hijos. Aun continúa trabajando pero desea abrir otra tienda, elL. sabe que pueD. lograrlo con mucho esfuerzo. L. compra D. productos para su tienda lo realizara con el préstamo recibido. Los socios se muestran muy agradecidos por L. confianza depositada y  desean seguir trabajando con más entusiasmo con L. Institución. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
Raymunda gets up very early to sell breakfast at the door of a school near her house. She does this with the help of her children. She also sells soft drinks and sweets, which give her extra income to cover household expenses. She will invest this loan in the purchase of soft drinks and sweets and fill her display case. 15 years ago, Rosa opened a stO. in her house, but seeing her neighbors' needs, she also opened a photo studio and bookshop. The earnings helped her with the education of her five children. She continues working but wants to open another stO.. She knows she can achieve this with great effort. She will use the loan to purchase products for her stO.. The group members are very grateful for the trust placed in them and are enthusiastic about continuing to work with EDAPROSPO. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and supplies

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María Juana tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el sector El Tabacal, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Túcume y pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, el lugar se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha desde hace cinco años, adicionalmente también vende cerveza en un bar instalado en su domicilio, su establecimiento se encuentra ubicada a un lado de la carretera, lo que ayuda a que este tenga muy buena acogida. Su negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como peón agrícola, a sostener la economía familiar, por lo que se esfuerza siempre para mantenerlo.

La chicha es una bebida tipica de todo el país, se prepara tanto en la costa como en la sierra del Perú desde tiempos ancestrales, está elaborada en base de una variedad de maiz y es muy consumida por las personas que viven en las zonas rurales ya que se cree que les da energía para continuar con sus trabajos.

María Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para la elaboración de más chicha, así como en la compra de más cerveza de modo que pueda mejorar la atención de su bar, tratando de lograr su objetivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Juana es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre trabaja para lograr que ellos salgan adelante. En la zona donde reside ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, quienes la consideran una mujer honorable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Juana is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the El Tabacal, a rural area where the principal economic activity is agriculture. It is located between the district of Tucume and is in the Lambayeque province. It is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She works making and selling chicha, a traditional corn-based drink, for the last five years. She also sells beer at the bar she has installed in her house. Her establishment is on the side of the highway and has a very welcoming environment. Her business helps allows her to help out her husband, who is a farm worker, with family expenses. She always works hard to maintain. Chica is a traditional drink common in all of Peru. It has been drunk on the coast as well as in the mountains of Peru since ancient times. Chicha is made with different types of corn and is consumed by many people in rural areas because they believe that it gives them the energy to continue with their manual labor. Maria Juana wants to grow her business by purchasing supplies to make more chicha and also more beer in order to be able to improve her bar. In order to reach her goal she is applying for her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new soles. Maria Juana is a family woman, and she has always worked to improve their lives. In her neighborhood she is well known and appreciated by her neighbors, who think she is an honorable and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make chicha and to buy beer for her bar

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 56  años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender chicha de jora. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosas. El sueño de la socia es ampliar su local de la chichería.     

Lucila se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucila belongs to the "Valle Sagrado" (Holy Valley) communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, and she is 56 years old. She currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main business activity is selling chicha de jora (a traditional Andean drink made of fermented corn). She has been in this business for 10 years, and it has gone very well for her. She needs the loan to buy beer and soft drinks. Her dream is to expand her chichería (the shop in which she makes and sells the chicha de jora). Lucila is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to pay off her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more gift items and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1957 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, K. Julienne vit depuis 23 ans environs au quartier Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Julienne est mariée à MIWAKOUNOU Paulin, un revendeur. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Agblangandan. Julienne vient en aide à son mari, et supporte avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Julienne n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a près de treize ans que Julienne vend du pain à son domicile. Julienne gère également un cafétéria. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Julienne désire rehausser son activité et acheter d'autres produits (œufs, etc.) pour son cafétéria, ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Julienne sollicite une fois encore l'appui financier de ALIDé, pour agrandir son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Porto Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. Giulia K. has lived for about 23 years in the Agblangandan district in the town of Seme-Podji.  She is married to Mr. MIWAKOUNOU Paulin, a retailer. The couple have five children, who are all in school.  The family lives in Agblangandan.   She helps out her husband, and with him, she covers the various family expenses.  Julienne did not attend school.  For about thirteen years, she has been selling bread out of her home.  She also runs a cafeteria.  She is a former ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans obtained from ALIDé.  She would like to enhance her business and to buy other goods (eggs, etc.) for her cafeteria.  This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers.  Given the few financial means at her disposal, Julienne is again requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to increase her customer base. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bread and trays of eggs for the cafeteria

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 48 años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender cerveza en el mercado central. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosas. 

Maria Elena se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She currently lives in the city of Calca.

Her main business activity is selling beer at the central market. She has 20 years of experience in this business and has done very well. Her loan will be used to buy beer and sodas.

Maria Elena is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & sodas

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años realiza tejidos a mano, utilizando palos de tejer o crochet, de esa manera produce bellas piezas de vestir, como: gorros, bufandas, de acuerdo al pedido del cliente. Sarita tiene familiares que constantemente viajan a la ciudad para comercializar su mercadería, es cuando aprovecha para que lleven las prendas que ha tejido, entre 4 a 5 bufandas y gorros. Siempre esta en la búsqueda de nuevos diseños que salen en revistas y también en Internet para tejerlos. Este negocio le es rentable por que tiene clientes que valoran mucho su trabajo, puesto que los años de experiencia que tuvo, le ha ayudado ha elaborar hermosos tejidos, por tal motivo desea que sus trabajos sean exportados a otros países. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de lanas al por mayor, así como variedad de color y calidad.
texts.en:
Sarita is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in the home that they own. For more than 6 years she has been making hand-woven goods, using either knitting needles or crochet hooks. Utilizing these methods, she produces beautiful articles of clothing like hats, scarves or anything her customers order. Sarita has family members who are constantly traveling to the city to sell their merchandise, and she takes advantage of their trips to have them bring the garments she has woven, between 4 and 5 scarves and hats, as well. She is always looking in magazines and on the Internet for new designs to weave. This business has been profitable for her because she has customers that place a high value on her work. Her years of experience have helped her to make lovely knits, and for that reason, she would like her works to be exported to other counties. This is her seventh credit with MFP. She is very responsible with her payments, and in addition, she considers that this contribution will be very useful in the progress of her business. The credit she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale wool and wool in a variety of colors and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool in a variety of colors and quality.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal LAS DIVINAS. Se agruparon hace 4 años aproximadamente, por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita fortalecer sus negocios.

Una de las integrantes es Sandra D. de 26 años desde hace mucho tiempo atrás se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos (yogurt, leche, queso y sus derivados) tratando siempre de mejorar la atención a sus clientes, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen varias actividades económicas como la venta de ropa, helado, CDS, repuestos de auto, tejido a prendas de vestir a mano y trenzado de mantas.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) meets every two weeks at the Pan American Community Center. The members formed this group approximately four years ago because they needed capital to strengthen their businesses.

One of the members is Sandra D., who is 26 years old and has been selling dairy products (yogurt, milk, cheese, and other derivatives) for several years. She is always trying to improve customer service and now needs a loan to buy merchandise.

The other members of the group engage in different business activities such as selling clothing, selling ice cream, selling CDs, selling auto parts, weaving clothing by hand, and making hand-braided rugs. They all need loans to invest in and strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products to sell

loans.name: Edelina

texts.es:
Edelina tiene 52 años, está felizmente casada con Jesús D. 54 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos, D. los cuales viven con sólo con uno en su casa propia.

DesD. hace dos años venD. comida preparada, comestibles, productos D. primera necesidad, bebidas y bocaditos en un local alquilado ubicado en una zona céntrica D. su ciudad. Por otro lado, por las tardes, su esposo labora transportando personas en su carro propio.
Los ingresos económicos diarios D. Edelina suman más D. 60 soles, los cuales distribuyen para cubrir los gastos D. la casa y ahorrar, asimismo sus ganancias como repartidora D. productos D. belleza le alcanzan para solventar las deudas que tiene.
Para más adelante piensa incrementar su mercadería con la venta D. verduras y condimentos molidos.

Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se muestra segura D. cumplir con sus pagos, pues la responsabilidad que tiene “es D. herencia”, menciona entre risas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará bebidas gasificadas, dulces e insumos para preparar bocaditos y comidas típicas.
texts.en:
Edelina is 52 years old and happily married to Jesús, who is 54. They have six children, but only one still lives with them in the home that they own.

For the past two years, Edelina has been selling prepared foods, groceries, basic necessities, beverages, and snacks from a rented store located in the central part of the city. Her husband provides personal transportation services in the afternoons using his own car.

Edelina’s daily income totals to more than 60 PEN, which goes toward covering her household expenses and building up her savings. Also, her earnings as a beauty products distributor enable her to pay off existing debts. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory by adding vegetables and ground condiments.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Edelina is careful to complete her payments because it is her responsibility “to leave an inheritance”, she says with a laugh. The money she requested will be used to buy sodas, candy, and ingredients for preparing snacks and traditional foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, candy, and ingredients for preparing snacks and traditional foods

loans.name: Las Esteritas Group

texts.es:
Hace muchos años Natividad tuvo un restaurant donD. ella misma cocinaba con el tiempo ya no pudo mantenerlo asi que ahora se dedica a la venta D.  frutas y verduras, negocio que la ayuda a subsistir.
Herlinda tiene un negocio D. abarrotes en el mercado así también venD. golosinas y gaseosas hace vaR. años, tiene  hijos en edad escolar por los cuales debe trabajar, su esposo no  tiene trabajo estable, con sus pocos ingresos pueD. aportar con los gastos en casa. Los socios son puntuales y responsables con sus créditos saben que deben seguir esforzándose para poder progresar. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
Several years ago Natividad had a restaurant where she herself did the cooking; in time, however, she could no longer keep it going. Now, she’s a fruit and vegetable merchant; a business that helps her subsist. Herlinda has sold groceries, sweets and soft-drinks in the market for several years. She has school age children for whom she must work because her husband does not have a steady job; he contributes his few earnings to household support. The members are punctual and responsible with their loans; they realize they must continue to make the effort in order to progress. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement I. is a talented young man. He is 28 years old, single and without children. I. produces and sells wooden combs to plait hair. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more materials to boost his wooden comb production. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to boost his wooden comb production

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 25 años, es soltero y sólo vive con su hermano menor en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona alta de la selva del Perú.

La agricultura es su oficio desde hace 2 años, cuenta con terrenos propios donde cultiva palta y frutas cítricas con la ayuda de su hermano y algunos operarios. Lo que más le agrada es retirar las malezas de sus tierras para verlas siempre limpias y para que sus frutos se desarrollen adecuadamente, con los que logre cubrir todas sus necesidades.
También desea comprar más terrenos para plantar café e incrementar su producción, ya que Elvis tiene como motivación el esfuerzo de sus padres y quiere que su futura familia tenga lo mejor y no pase las penurias que le tocó vivir de niño.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y confiesa que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas responsables y unidas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará dos sacos de abono para nivelar la producción de sus cultivos, además pagará operarios que le ayuden con los trabajos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Elvis is 25 years old, single, and lives with his younger brother in his own house located in an upper area of the Peruvian jungle.

He has been farming for two years. Elvis has his own land where he grows avocados and citrus fruits with the help of his brother and a few workers. The part of his job that he enjoys most is removing weeds and keeping his land clear so that his crops can develop properly. The fruits they produce help to cover all of his needs. Elvis also wants to buy more land so that he can plant coffee and increase his production. He was motivated by the work of his parents and wants to have his own family in the future. However, he desires to provide them the best so that his children do not experience the hardships he faced as a child.

This is his second loan with MFP. Elvis confesses that he enjoys working with his Communal Bank because the members are responsible and supportive people. With the loan of 800 PEN that he requested, he will buy two sacks of compost for his crops and pay the workers who help around the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & pay his workers

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
Jose Vidal de 50 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Nancy Gutierrez quien se encarga de los quehaceres de la casa, tienen 3 hijos habitan junto a ellos: Hassel de 29 años, Eyner de 28 y Alvaro de 24 años, todos ya estan casados y tienen su propia familia.  Jose Vidal trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 6 años como policia municipal.     

Esta solicitando su 2do credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su vivienda, construyendo un sumidero para los servicios higienicos de su casa, y de esta manera contar con mejores condiciones de salubridad en su casa y mayor comodidad para su familia.   

El mayor sueño que tiene don Jose Vidal es poder tener una vivienda bonita para su familia, ya que es el patrimonio que les dejara cuando falte.
texts.en:
Jose Vidal is 50 years old and married to Sra. Nancy Gutierrez, who is in charge of the household duties. They have three children who live with them: Hassel (age 29), Eyner (age 28), and Alvaro (age 24). All of them are married and have their own families. Jose Vidal has been working the past six years for the City of Juigalpa as a municipal police officer.

He is requesting his second loan from AFODENIC in order to continue making improvements to his home. Jose Vidal plans to build a drain so that his home can receive sewage service, thereby providing healthier and more comfortable conditions for his family.

Don Jose Vidal’s greatest wish is to have a nice home for his family so that he can leave it to them as an inheritance when he is gone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a sewage drain

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive con uno de los 6 hijos que tiene con su esposa Esther, de 49 años. A sus 62 años, él asegura que no termina de plantearse más objetivos que lo satisfagan. 

Su espíritu emprendedor a diario le hace vencer las adversidades, pues no le atemorizan las plagas ni las inclemencias del tiempo, ya que está acostumbrado a lidiar con ellos desde hace 40 años. Se dedica a la plantación de café, plátano, palta y piña, con la ayuda de su hijo y su esposa, esta última es quien siempre lo acompaña en las épocas de cosecha dejando sus quehaceres cotidianos del hogar.
A Juan le gusta cosechar porque ve el fruto de su esfuerzo, el cual le brindará las ganancias económicas necesarias para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Como su actividad es rentable, para el futuro quiere renovar sus plantaciones de café, las cuales crecerán a aproximadamente en 3 años.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y refiere que le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque es una persona recta que y lucha por la unión de sus compañeros. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita pagará el jornal de los operarios que contratará para que le ayuden a cosechar su producción de café.
texts.en:
Juan is married to Esther, age 49, and lives with one of his six children. At 62 years of age, he says has succeeded with most of the objectives he has set out to accomplish.

His enterprising spirit allows him to overcome adversity each day because he is not easily intimidated by pests or inclement weather since he has been dealing with these factors for 40 years. Juan grows coffee, bananas, avocados, and pineapples with the help of his son and his wife. During the harvest season, Juan’s wife sets aside her daily household chores so that she can be by his side. Juan enjoys harvesting because he is able to see the fruits of his labor and generate the necessary income to maintain his household. Since his business is profitable, he wants to renew his coffee crops since they take approximately three years to mature.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Juan enjoys being part of his Communal Bank because is a direct person who strives to bring his fellow group members together. With his loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Juan will pay the workers who have been hired to help harvest coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the workers who help harvest his coffee crop

loans.name: Los Propios Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimieto LOS PROPIOS esta conformado 8 integrantes, seis mujeres y dos varones todos los socios  viven en la misma zona del Torno y Santa Rita en los siguientes barrios ,Bolivia y Paraiso todos los socios cuentan con negocio propio hace varios  años en la comundad de el Torno.

La presidenta es la Sra. SAIDA, esta casada y tiene dos hijitas pequeñas, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, la sra. Saida es un apersona trabajadora y responsable y solidaria con sus compañeras por eso la eligieron como representante del banco, con el dinero del credito la Sra. comprara cosmeticos que se  encuentran en promocion, las revistas sacan productos en promocion que se encuentran mas baratos que el precio original y siguiente publicacion ese producto que estaba mas barato, en la nueva publicacion esta mas caro, y asi ella obtiene una ganancia extra.   

Todas las socias de este banco de emprendimiento en su gran mayoria son padres de familia y son personas muy luchadoras ellos tienen el sueño de que sus negocios engrandesca y ser muy exitosos para cumplir sus sueños de comprarse sus casitas , vehiculo, terreno, ect, ellos se encuentran agradecidos con la institucion por brindarles la confianza en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Los Propios” Entrepreneurial bank is made up of eight members; two women and two gentlemen. All of them live in the same zone of the Bolivia and Paraiso neighborhoods of El Torno and Santa Rita. They each have had their own businesses for a number of years in El Torno. Saida is the president. She is married and has two young daughters. She sells cosmetics through a catalog. Saida is hard working and responsible and shows solidarity with her fellow members. This is why they elected her as a representative. She will use the money from this loan to buy cosmetics, which are currently being offered at a reduced price and be able sell them at a greater profit. All of the group’s members have families and businesses. They all hope to be able to buy homes, vehicles, land, etc. in the future. They are grateful to the institution for the trust they have placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & supplies for her video game parlor

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es una joven audaz de 21 años, está separada de su pareja, con quien tiene un pequeña hija de 2 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.

En busca de su progreso, se esmera por hacer bien las actividades que desarrolla y trata de aprovechar al máximo su tiempo, pues desde hace 3 años se dedica a alquilar y vender videos (películas), mercería y joyería.
Paralelamente, por las mañanas, es locutora radial y posteriormente se desempeña como secretaria de una tienda de comestibles. A su vez, los fines de semana estudia periodismo en una institución de su localidad. Sus actividades son muy rentables, pues le permiten vivir cómodamente y ahorrar para más adelante comprar un terreno en la ciudad y construir su casa propia. En tanto Karen, continua enseñándole a su hija que la esperanza es lo último que se pierde.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y confía en que no defraudará a su banco comunal porque le agrada laborar con ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de videos (DVD´s), además de joyas que comercializará entre sus amistades.
texts.en:
Karen is a bold young woman who is 21 years of age. She is separated from her spouse with whom she has a two year old daughter. Karen lives in the house of her parents.

In hopes of making progress, Karen strives do well in all of her activities and make the most of her time. For the past three years, she has been offering movie videos for rent and for sale, sewing supplies, and jewelry. In addition, she works as a radio announcer in the mornings and then goes to her other job as a secretary for a grocery business. On the weekends, she studies journalism at a local institution. Her various activities generate sufficient income for her to live comfortably. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land in the city so that she can build her own home. Karen continues to teach her daughter that hope is the last thing one can lose.

This is her third loan with MFP. Karen tries not to disappoint her Communal Bank because she enjoys working with them. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of videos (DVDs) and jewelry to sell to her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase videos & jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 48 años, está casada con Lorenzo (50 años), con quien tiene tres hijos, de los cuales vive con dos de ellos en la casa de sus padres. Ella se caracteriza por ser una madre luchadora y abnegada. 

“Con la bendición de Dios todo me va muy bien” manifiesta Maritza, mientras resume que de profesión es docente de nivel inicial y labora en la institución de nombre “María Auxiliadora”, donde es muy querida por su paciencia y bondad.
Asimismo, por las tardes realiza trabajos pastorales en la iglesia de su localidad y paralelamente, en el espacio donde vive, desarrolla servicios de tipeo de documentos, escaneado y fotocopiado desde hace 8 años con la ayuda de sus hijas menores. Ella anhela tener su casa propia, para poder ampliar su negocio, también planea comprar una fotocopiadora profesional para agilizar su trabajo.

Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se compromete a hacer todo lo posible para que su banco comunal marche muy bien y puedan continuar con el trabajo unido que llevan hasta hoy. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales de escritorio (papel y tintas para la impresora).
texts.en:
Maritza is 48 years old and married to Lorenzo (age 50). They have three children, two of whom still live with them in the home of her parents. She is known for being a determined and devoted mother.

“With God’s blessing, everything is going very well,” says Maritza. She resumed her career as a pre-school teacher and works at an institution named “María Auxiliadora”, where she is loved for her patience and kindness. In the afternoons, she does pastoral work at her local church and manages a home business providing document services such as typing, scanning, and photocopying. Maritza started this business eight years ago with the help of her young daughters. She longs to have a house of her own so that she can expand her business. In addition, she plans to buy a professional photocopier to help expedite her work.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She promises to do everything possible to cooperate with her Communal Bank so that they can continue the good work that they have accomplished so far. The money she requested will be used to buy office supplies (paper and ink for her printer).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper and ink for her printer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruits (bananas, watermelons and cherries) to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo de 64 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Josefa Arguello quien se encarga del cuido de la casa, con ella procreo 2 hijos, los que aun viven con ellos: Jorge de 29 años de edad y Elda de 27 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de comida, y tiene una niña de nombre Elda de 9 añitos estudiando la primaria. Don Reynaldo trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de hacer algunas reparaciones en su casa, pues es de madera y parte de ella se encuentra en mal estado y desea cambiarla, pues con esto daria un poco de seguridad a su casita.  

El mayor sueño de Reynaldo es poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia, con las condiciones basicas para que su nietecita crezca en un ambiente alegre.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 64 years old and married to Sra. Josefa Arguello, who is in charge of taking care of their home. They have two children who still live them, Jorge (age 29) and Elda (age 27). Elda sells food and has a nine year old daughter, also named Elda, who attends elementary school. Don Reynaldo has been working as a municipal police officer for the City of Juigalpa for the past nine years.

He is requesting his second loan in order to make a few repairs to his home. His house is made of wood, but some of it is in bad condition and needs to be replaced in order to make his home more secure.

Reynaldo’s greatest wish is to have a decent home for his family that provides basic conditions so that his young granddaughter can grow up in a happy environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to his home by replacing the wood that is in bad condition
